Umamigirl ID step
Umamigirl ID step
987a0195-5200-4958-9ce2-2870606e0e53 Preheat oven to 375°F with a rack in the center.
987a0195-5200-4958-9ce2-2870606e0e53 Chop the bacon into bite-sized pieces and place in a 12-inch nonstick frying pan set over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring frequently, until brown and crisp-tender. Remove bacon to paper towels to drain and pour off all but about two tablespoons fat from pan.
987a0195-5200-4958-9ce2-2870606e0e53 Add broccolini to pan and stir to coat with fat. Cook uncovered for a minute or two, until bright green. Add two tablespoons water to pan and cover. Cook until water is evaporated and broccolini is just tender, a few minutes.
987a0195-5200-4958-9ce2-2870606e0e53 Crack the eggs into a mixing bowl, pour in cream, and beat well with a fork. Pour egg mixture into pan. Sprinkle evenly with cheese. Transfer pan to oven and bake until eggs are set, about 10 minutes.
987a0195-5200-4958-9ce2-2870606e0e53 Cool slightly and then top with broccoli sprouts, tomato pieces, pine nuts, and a drizzle of balsamic glaze. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cut into wedges to serve.
08d3d473-706a-437e-8834-434d5cd9de1d Have egg and milk at room temperature for optimum pancake fluffiness.
08d3d473-706a-437e-8834-434d5cd9de1d Shred the zucchini on the large holes of a box grater or in a food processor with the shredding disk. Place the shredded zucchini in a colander in the sink and sprinkle with the salt. Toss to combine. Let drain for 30 minutes, then pick up by the handful and squeeze out as much moisture as possible. Set aside.
08d3d473-706a-437e-8834-434d5cd9de1d Into a large mixing bowl, sift together the flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
08d3d473-706a-437e-8834-434d5cd9de1d In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the milk, egg, and vanilla. Then whisk in the butter.
08d3d473-706a-437e-8834-434d5cd9de1d Pour the wet ingredients over the dry ingredients and stir together just until combined. Some lumps are fine. Don't overmix. Then gently fold in the zucchini.
08d3d473-706a-437e-8834-434d5cd9de1d Let batter rest for five minutes before proceeding.
08d3d473-706a-437e-8834-434d5cd9de1d Set a griddle or heavy, nonstick pan over medium heat. Coat lightly with safflower oil.
08d3d473-706a-437e-8834-434d5cd9de1d When griddle is hot, scoop batter by the approximate 1/4-cupful onto the skillet, leaving plenty of room between pancakes. Cook until the edges of the underside are browned and the top is covered with bubbles that have begun to burst and stay hollow. Flip and cook until the underside is browned. Repeat with remaining batter.
08d3d473-706a-437e-8834-434d5cd9de1d Pancakes are best served right as they come off the griddle, though you can keep them warm in a 200°F oven while you cook the rest if you insist.
303c4cf3-c98c-41df-8819-c6e091fc4490 In a large mixing bowl (or right in the bowl of your stand mixer, if you like), stir together the sourdough starter, water, and sugar with a fork to break up the starter. It doesn't have to be perfectly incorporated into the water.
303c4cf3-c98c-41df-8819-c6e091fc4490 Add the flour and the salt. Mix until there's no loose flour. I find it's easiest to start mixing with the fork and then switch to using my hand as the dough stiffens and gets less sticky.
303c4cf3-c98c-41df-8819-c6e091fc4490 Knead the dough for eight minutes. You can do this by hand, but it's much easier in a stand mixer since this dough is quite stiff. In a stand mixer, use the dough hook on Speed 2.
303c4cf3-c98c-41df-8819-c6e091fc4490 Clean the bowl and oil it. Use your hands to work the dough into a nice ball and place it in the bowl. Turn it over a few times to coat with oil. Cover with a damp kitchen towel, a plate that's big enough to sit on the rim of the bowl, or plastic wrap.
303c4cf3-c98c-41df-8819-c6e091fc4490 Let the dough rise for eight hours. At this point, you can make the bagels or stash the dough in the fridge overnight.
a94b8c61-97df-41d8-bcd5-8a7ba1461241 In a small mixing bowl, use a fork to beat together the eggs, milk, salt, and pepper. Mix until the eggs are an even light yellow color, but don't go out of your way to incorporate any more air than you need to. (That's one reason to use a fork instead of a whisk to mix.)
a94b8c61-97df-41d8-bcd5-8a7ba1461241 Set a small, good-quality nonstick pan over low heat. For four to eight eggs, an 8-inch pan works well. It's easier to control the heat when you have a bit of depth to the eggs rather than a very shallow layer.
a94b8c61-97df-41d8-bcd5-8a7ba1461241 Add the butter to the pan and swipe it around with the spatula to lightly coat the whole pan. When there's a light layer of melted butter on the pan but most of the butter is still solid, pour in the egg mixture.
a94b8c61-97df-41d8-bcd5-8a7ba1461241 From now until approximately INFINITY, stir the eggs constantly with a wooden spoon or silicone spatula. This will take about 15-20 minutes total, depending on the heat of the low setting on your stove. (For reference: On my professional gas range, I use the low setting rather than the even lower simmer. On the little electric burner that I use to make videos, I started on the low setting and ended up turning it up just a touch to somewhere between low and medium-low.) For the first four to five minutes, it will seem like nothing is happening. The eggs will remain liquid with no curds forming. But slowly bringing the eggs up to temperature will make all the difference in the final process, so don't rush it. Just keep stirring constantly, running your spatula around the entire bottom and sides of the pan. The color will go from brighter to darker yellow over these first few minutes, but you might not notice since it will be very gradual. If nothing at all has happened after about five or six minutes, raise the heat very slightly and note that you can start on that slightly higher setting next time.
a94b8c61-97df-41d8-bcd5-8a7ba1461241 At some point, very small curds will start to form. Just keep doing the same thing you've been doing — stirring until death do us part — while the eggs begin to thicken into a silky, custardy scramble. Keep going until the eggs are just thick enough to stay for a moment on the side of the pan that you push them toward. You can watch the video for visual cues.
a94b8c61-97df-41d8-bcd5-8a7ba1461241 Off the heat, stir in the cream.
a94b8c61-97df-41d8-bcd5-8a7ba1461241 Slide the eggs on to serving plates (or into small bowls if you like) and serve. We like to garnish ours with flaky sea salt, more freshly ground black pepper, and maybe a sprinkle of minced chives, ramps, or parsley if we're in the mood.
ecf8b024-f326-41cd-9345-1094340a3fc7 Crack eggs into a small mixing bowl and pour in cream.
ecf8b024-f326-41cd-9345-1094340a3fc7 With a fork, beat the eggs until the contents of the bowl are an even, creamy yellow, with no visible bits of yolk or white.
ecf8b024-f326-41cd-9345-1094340a3fc7 Set a heavy 8- or 10-inch nonstick pan over medium-low heat. Add the butter. When it's melted and foamy, pour in the eggs.
ecf8b024-f326-41cd-9345-1094340a3fc7 Let the eggs sit undisturbed just until you can see around the edges that they've set on the underside. Then, in a few gentle motions, use a silicone spatula to pull the edges of the eggs into the center.
ecf8b024-f326-41cd-9345-1094340a3fc7 Repeat this process — letting the underside set, and then pulling the edges to the center — once or twice more as needed. You can lift the pan up off the heat a bit to control the temperature so the eggs set without browning.
ecf8b024-f326-41cd-9345-1094340a3fc7 Just before you think the eggs are perfectly cooked, remove the pan from the heat. They'll keep cooking a bit with their residual heat and end up just right.
ecf8b024-f326-41cd-9345-1094340a3fc7 Slide the eggs onto a plate and serve right away, sprinkled with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
77ac96a8-313a-4c29-980d-9008254983e2 Preheat your oven to 375°F with a rack in the center. Grab a 12-inch frying pan.
77ac96a8-313a-4c29-980d-9008254983e2 In a medium mixing bowl, beat the eggs together with the liquid (if using) and a little bit of salt and pepper until smooth.
77ac96a8-313a-4c29-980d-9008254983e2 Chop meat, if using, into bite-sized pieces. The meat should be cooked by the time it goes into the frittata, so if it's raw when you're starting, cook it in the frying pan now. If it leaves more than about a tablespoon of fat in the pan drain the fat before proceeding. At this point you can leave the meat in the pan or remove it and add it back later.
77ac96a8-313a-4c29-980d-9008254983e2 Chop vegetables into bite-sized pieces. Just like the meat, most vegetables should be cooked by the time they go into a frittata. If they aren't yet cooked, give them a sauté in the frying pan at this point.
77ac96a8-313a-4c29-980d-9008254983e2 With the cooked meats and vegetables in the pan and the pan set over medium heat on the stove, pour in the beaten egg mixture and sprinkle with cheese. Let the frittata cook undisturbed until the bottom is set, about a minute.
77ac96a8-313a-4c29-980d-9008254983e2 Transfer the pan to the oven and bake until eggs are just set, about 10 minutes.
77ac96a8-313a-4c29-980d-9008254983e2 That's it! Cut your frittata into wedges, and it's ready to eat warm or at room temperature. Leftovers keep well, tightly wrapped in a cold fridge, for a week.
4b1430d6-cbc4-4cb3-a6a2-87d413a6f987 Bring a large pot of water to a boil. A 7 1/4 quart Dutch oven fits a steamer basket perfectly.
4b1430d6-cbc4-4cb3-a6a2-87d413a6f987 Arrange eggs in a steamer basket. Lower basket into water and cover pot. Set timer for 12 minutes.
4b1430d6-cbc4-4cb3-a6a2-87d413a6f987 As soon as water begins to bubble vigorously again, reduce heat to low to maintain a bare simmer.
4b1430d6-cbc4-4cb3-a6a2-87d413a6f987 Fill a large bowl with ice water.
4b1430d6-cbc4-4cb3-a6a2-87d413a6f987 When timer rings, pull steamer out of pot and tip eggs into ice water. Cool for 15 minutes.
4b1430d6-cbc4-4cb3-a6a2-87d413a6f987 Peel carefully and give a quick rinse under running water to remove any remaining bits of shell.
fcf99c50-9244-43f7-876b-9558b56c5608 Have eggs and milk at room temperature for optimum fluffiness.
fcf99c50-9244-43f7-876b-9558b56c5608 Preheat waffle iron. (If yours has multiple doneness settings, try about 3/4 of the way from light to dark.)
fcf99c50-9244-43f7-876b-9558b56c5608 Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt into a large mixing bowl.
fcf99c50-9244-43f7-876b-9558b56c5608 Separate egg whites from yolks. Place whites into a medium mixing bowl and set aside for the moment. Add yolks to milk. (We like to use a 2-cup glass measuring cup to measure the milk and then mix together the wet ingredients right in the measuring cup.) Add vanilla to milk mixture and whisk together until well combined. Pour in slightly cooled melted butter and whisk to thoroughly.
fcf99c50-9244-43f7-876b-9558b56c5608 Pour wet ingredients over dry ingredients and stir together until just combined. Some lumps of flour are fine. Don’t overmix. Let batter rest while you whip the egg whites.
fcf99c50-9244-43f7-876b-9558b56c5608 Whip egg whites with an electric mixer to the stiff peak stage. This means they are white and shiny, and if you turn off the mixer and pull it out of the egg whites, the little point at the top of the whites stands straight up. There is such a thing as overbeating egg whites, so stop once you reach this stage.
fcf99c50-9244-43f7-876b-9558b56c5608 Scrape egg whites into the bowl with the batter and use a silicone spatula to gently fold the whites into the batter. (See note.) Leave some streaks of whipped egg white throughout the batter. Don’t overmix or the egg whites will deflate too much.
fcf99c50-9244-43f7-876b-9558b56c5608 Spray waffle iron with nonstick cooking spray (or brush very lightly with vegetable oil or melted butter).
fcf99c50-9244-43f7-876b-9558b56c5608 Add batter to waffle iron according to manufacturer’s instructions and cook until waffles are golden brown. Serve immediately, or keep warm in a 200°F oven while you finish cooking. You can place waffles directly on a clean oven rack or place them on a baking rack set into a rimmed baking sheet.
0f1c3bf2-c63f-4f8c-8791-ddeb8ec46cd9 Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center. Place crust (in foil pie plate) onto a rimmed baking sheet and defrost on countertop for 10 minutes. Prick crust all over the bottom and sides with a fork. (See note.)
0f1c3bf2-c63f-4f8c-8791-ddeb8ec46cd9 Bake crust for 10 minutes, then let cool for 10 minutes. (If directions for “blind baking” on your crust’s package vary substantially, you can follow those, but this method should work for most frozen crusts.)
0f1c3bf2-c63f-4f8c-8791-ddeb8ec46cd9 Reduce oven temperature to 325°F.
0f1c3bf2-c63f-4f8c-8791-ddeb8ec46cd9 To cook the spinach, place it and two tablespoons water in a microwave-safe, lidded container and cook on high until just hot, about four minutes depending on your microwave.
0f1c3bf2-c63f-4f8c-8791-ddeb8ec46cd9 When cool enough to handle, place spinach in a fine-mesh strainer and press out all the liquid you can with a fork or spoon, or with your fingers.
0f1c3bf2-c63f-4f8c-8791-ddeb8ec46cd9 While crust bakes and spinach cooks, warm olive oil in a medium-sized frying pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about five minutes. Off the heat, add drained spinach and 1/4 teaspoon salt to pan and use a fork to mix the spinach and onion together thoroughly.
0f1c3bf2-c63f-4f8c-8791-ddeb8ec46cd9 In a medium bowl, beat eggs well with a fork. Add cream, milk, remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, nutmeg, cayenne, and black pepper and mix until well-combined.
0f1c3bf2-c63f-4f8c-8791-ddeb8ec46cd9 Gently spread spinach mixture and cheese evenly over bottom of crust.
0f1c3bf2-c63f-4f8c-8791-ddeb8ec46cd9 Open oven and pull out rack enough to set the partially filled crust (still on rimmed baking sheet) onto the rack. Carefully pour the egg mixture into the crust. It will be very full. Gently slide rack back into place.
0f1c3bf2-c63f-4f8c-8791-ddeb8ec46cd9 Bake until filling is just set and still slightly jiggly but not sloshy in the center, 30-40 minutes. The center will firm up as it cools, and pulling the quiche out at this stage will prevent it from getting tough.
0f1c3bf2-c63f-4f8c-8791-ddeb8ec46cd9 Let cool for at least 10 minutes before serving, preferably longer. Quiche is even better the next day.
00248007-51ea-4aa3-801f-0436d1d5638f Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center. Place crust (in foil pie plate) onto a rimmed baking sheet and defrost on countertop for 10 minutes. Prick crust all over the bottom and sides with a fork. (See note.)
00248007-51ea-4aa3-801f-0436d1d5638f Bake crust for 10 minutes, then let cool for 10 minutes. (If directions for “blind baking” on your crust’s package vary substantially, you can follow those, but this method should work for most frozen crusts.)
00248007-51ea-4aa3-801f-0436d1d5638f Reduce oven temperature to 325°F.
00248007-51ea-4aa3-801f-0436d1d5638f While crust bakes, set a medium-sized frying pan over medium heat. Add bacon and cook, stirring frequently, until browned and crisped to your liking. Remove bacon from pan and drain on paper towels.
00248007-51ea-4aa3-801f-0436d1d5638f Pour off all but about one tablespoon bacon fat from pan and replace pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about five minutes.
00248007-51ea-4aa3-801f-0436d1d5638f In a medium bowl, beat eggs well with a fork. Add cream, milk, salt, nutmeg, cayenne, and black pepper and mix until well-combined.
00248007-51ea-4aa3-801f-0436d1d5638f Gently spread onion, bacon, and cheese evenly over bottom of crust.
00248007-51ea-4aa3-801f-0436d1d5638f Open oven and pull out rack enough to set the partially filled crust (still on rimmed baking sheet) onto the rack. Carefully pour the egg mixture into the crust. It will be very full. Gently slide rack back into place.
00248007-51ea-4aa3-801f-0436d1d5638f Bake until filling is just set and still ever so slightly jiggly (but not sloshy) in the center, 30-40 minutes. The center will firm up as it cools, and pulling the quiche out at this stage will prevent it from getting tough.
00248007-51ea-4aa3-801f-0436d1d5638f Let cool for at least 10 minutes before serving, preferably longer. Quiche is even better the next day.
74c55cbd-8dd6-4ab3-8c2c-806cc82c2568 Prepare one or two batches of classic deviled eggs, depending on the size of your party and what else you're serving. Figure on one to two whole eggs per person depending on circumstances. Set them out on a serving tray near the beginning of the buffet line.
74c55cbd-8dd6-4ab3-8c2c-806cc82c2568 Set out toppings in small bowls. Be thoughtful about grouping ingredients together so as not to give your guests analysis paralysis, and also about setting out serving utensils where needed. Sauces like sriracha can stay right in the bottle, as long as it's been reasonably well maintained.
74c55cbd-8dd6-4ab3-8c2c-806cc82c2568 Place a stack of small plates and a stack of napkins at the start of the buffet line. Depending on your toppings, you may want to include forks as well.
c6bf5ff7-b578-4607-a77a-b4fc7a9b903d Preheat oven to 375°F with a rack in the center.
c6bf5ff7-b578-4607-a77a-b4fc7a9b903d Line a rimmed half-sheet pan with aluminum foil if you like. (We sometimes do and sometimes don't. It helps a bit with cleanup but isn't strictly necessary.) Arrange bacon in a single layer. If you have to overlap the slices just a little, it's okay — they'll shrink.
c6bf5ff7-b578-4607-a77a-b4fc7a9b903d Bake for 15-20 minutes, more or less, until crisped to your liking. Watch carefully toward the end. Cooking time will vary depending on thickness.
c6bf5ff7-b578-4607-a77a-b4fc7a9b903d Drain on paper towels and serve.
036c7d5b-1b03-4955-9444-0df3e6aabee3 Have egg and milk at room temperature for optimum pancake fluffiness.
036c7d5b-1b03-4955-9444-0df3e6aabee3 Into a large mixing bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt.
036c7d5b-1b03-4955-9444-0df3e6aabee3 In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the milk, egg, and vanilla. Then whisk in the butter.
036c7d5b-1b03-4955-9444-0df3e6aabee3 Pour the wet ingredients over the dry ingredients and stir together just until combined. Some lumps are fine. Don't overmix.
036c7d5b-1b03-4955-9444-0df3e6aabee3 Let batter rest for five minutes before proceeding.
036c7d5b-1b03-4955-9444-0df3e6aabee3 Set a griddle or heavy, nonstick pan over medium heat. Coat lightly with safflower oil.
036c7d5b-1b03-4955-9444-0df3e6aabee3 When griddle is hot, scoop batter by the approximate 1/4-cupful onto the skillet, leaving plenty of room between pancakes. Cook until the edges of the underside are browned and the top is covered with bubbles that have begun to burst and stay hollow. Flip and cook until the underside is browned. Repeat with remaining batter.
036c7d5b-1b03-4955-9444-0df3e6aabee3 Pancakes are best served right as they come off the griddle, though you can keep them warm in a 200°F oven while you cook the rest if you insist.
e7c588a3-c10d-465c-907f-65f0c4a83972 Preheat waffle iron.
e7c588a3-c10d-465c-907f-65f0c4a83972 In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, white whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and cloves.
e7c588a3-c10d-465c-907f-65f0c4a83972 In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, sour cream, melted butter, and molasses.
e7c588a3-c10d-465c-907f-65f0c4a83972 Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix together until just combined. A few lumps are okay, just try to avoid any substantial pockets of unmixed dry ingredients.
e7c588a3-c10d-465c-907f-65f0c4a83972 Spray waffle iron lightly with nonstick cooking spray. Pour batter into waffle iron and cook according to manufacturer's instructions. In our waffle iron (recommended below), we use a scant 1/2 cup batter for each waffle and set the iron to medium-dark for these waffles.
e7c588a3-c10d-465c-907f-65f0c4a83972 Serve with a dusting of powdered sugar, maple syrup, and/or lightly sweetened whipped cream.
941f24aa-d8b5-42f8-a72c-4edb6ad7cca1 Heat one tablespoon of the olive oil over medium heat in a nonstick or well-seasoned frying pan. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until starting to soften, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for one minute more.
941f24aa-d8b5-42f8-a72c-4edb6ad7cca1 Add the spinach, in batches if necessary, and cook until wilted. If there's a lot of liquid in the pan at this stage, you may wish to pour it off. (Sometimes there is, sometimes there isn't -- depends on the spinach.)
941f24aa-d8b5-42f8-a72c-4edb6ad7cca1 Add the nutmeg, cayenne, heavy cream, cream cheese, and some salt and pepper. Stir to combine well. Simmer until the sauce is reduced enough to mostly cling to the spinach. Taste for salt and pepper and divide between two shallow bowls.
941f24aa-d8b5-42f8-a72c-4edb6ad7cca1 Wipe out the frying pan. Add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil. Fry the eggs in the pan to your liking, and slide two eggs into each bowl. Cut the toast into strips ("soldiers," as the English call them) for dipping into the yolk and cream, and garnish each bowl with a few. Serve immediately.
9ff08a26-1958-46ef-981e-beaec0b1fd4a Warm olive oil in a 12-inch nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Add shallot, pepper and tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, until peppers have softened and tomatoes have burst, about 5 minutes.
9ff08a26-1958-46ef-981e-beaec0b1fd4a Meanwhile, crack eggs into a bowl and scramble.
9ff08a26-1958-46ef-981e-beaec0b1fd4a Stir spinach into pan and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
9ff08a26-1958-46ef-981e-beaec0b1fd4a Pour in eggs and sprinkle with McCormick breakfast seasoning. Cook, stirring frequently, until eggs are almost set.
9ff08a26-1958-46ef-981e-beaec0b1fd4a Sprinkle in feta and olives and continue cooking until eggs are set to your liking.
9ff08a26-1958-46ef-981e-beaec0b1fd4a Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper.
229dacdd-cdbc-443f-b00b-3adabbd14f04 Fill a small pot about halfway with water and bring to a boil. Carefully lower the eggs into the pot one at a time. (I like to use a small strainer or silicone tongs, but you can also use a spoon.) Set a timer for seven minutes. Try to keep the water at a brisk simmer without jostling the eggs around more than necessary.
229dacdd-cdbc-443f-b00b-3adabbd14f04 While the eggs boil, fill a medium bowl about halfway with lots of ice and cold water.
229dacdd-cdbc-443f-b00b-3adabbd14f04 When the timer rings, take the eggs out right away, place them in the ice water, and let sit until they're cool enough to peel. They should be nice and easy to peel. Use right away or store, peeled and covered, in the fridge for a day or two. You can reheat peeled eggs in the microwave for 30 seconds or so or with a minute's dip in hot water.
47f3e9c5-49bc-4299-8f84-4cacf65a8bb6 In a 12-inch nonstick skillet, heat the olive oil on medium-high. Add shallot and garlic and cook for a few seconds. Add spinach by the handful as it fits in the pan, sprinkle with salt and stir frequently until wilted.
47f3e9c5-49bc-4299-8f84-4cacf65a8bb6 To poach the eggs, fill a wide sauté pan halfway with water. (A pan like this is ideal.) Add vinegar and bring water to a brisk simmer, then reduce heat so the water is virtually still. Crack each egg into a small bowl and tip carefully into the water, submerging the bowl a bit as you pour. I like to add the eggs in a clockwise circle starting near the handle so I remember in which order to remove them for even cooking. Cook undisturbed for four minutes, until whites are set and yolks are runny. Remove eggs from pan with a strainer spoon (something like this). Gently place eggs on a paper towel-lined plate and dab the tops to remove excess water. Cut away any scraggly whites if you like.
47f3e9c5-49bc-4299-8f84-4cacf65a8bb6 While the eggs poach, toast the bread and make the hollandaise.
47f3e9c5-49bc-4299-8f84-4cacf65a8bb6 To serve, on each of four plates, top a piece of toast with some spinach, making a little bed for the eggs. Add two poached eggs. Spoon some Hollandaise sauce overtop. Finish with freshly ground black pepper and some parsley if you like.
5e8d7bdb-d42d-40d6-a694-355106539136 Split the English muffins and toast to your liking. (Lightly toasted, gently crisp on the outside and tender inside if you're looking for a recommendation.) Divide among 4 plates. Drape a slice of prosciutto over each English muffin half while it's still hot.
5e8d7bdb-d42d-40d6-a694-355106539136 To poach the eggs, fill a wide sauté pan halfway with water. (A pan like this is ideal.) Add vinegar and bring water to a brisk simmer, then reduce heat so the water is virtually still. Crack each egg into a small bowl and tip carefully into the water, submerging the bowl a bit as you pour. I like to add the eggs in a clockwise circle starting near the handle so I remember in which order to remove them for even cooking. Cook undisturbed for four minutes, until whites are set and yolks are runny. Remove eggs from pan with a strainer spoon (something like this). Gently place eggs on a paper towel-lined plate and dab the tops to remove excess water. Cut away any scraggly whites if you like.
5e8d7bdb-d42d-40d6-a694-355106539136 While the eggs poach, make the hollandaise.
5e8d7bdb-d42d-40d6-a694-355106539136 To serve, place a poached egg over each prosciutto-draped English muffin half and spoon some Hollandaise sauce overtop. Finish with freshly ground black pepper and some parsley if you like.
eed60467-81a7-450b-8ed6-64751793b2fa Preheat oven to 350°F.
eed60467-81a7-450b-8ed6-64751793b2fa Cut the baguette into six sections and halve each section lengthwise.
eed60467-81a7-450b-8ed6-64751793b2fa Line a sheet pan with parchment paper.
eed60467-81a7-450b-8ed6-64751793b2fa Place sections, cut sides up, in a closely spaced single layer on the pan, leaving some room for the apricots.
eed60467-81a7-450b-8ed6-64751793b2fa In a small bowl, stir together two tablespoons of the apricot preserves and the dried apricots until the apricots are evenly coated.
eed60467-81a7-450b-8ed6-64751793b2fa Place apricots in a single layer in the remaining space on the sheet pan.
eed60467-81a7-450b-8ed6-64751793b2fa Bake for about 15 minutes, until bread is lightly toasted and apricots are a bit sticky and jammy.
eed60467-81a7-450b-8ed6-64751793b2fa Spread each baguette piece with some of the remaining apricot preserves.
eed60467-81a7-450b-8ed6-64751793b2fa Drape with a slice of prosciutto and top with a slice of brie and a couple of jammy apricots.
eed60467-81a7-450b-8ed6-64751793b2fa Garnish with thyme and serve.
4b7372ee-9dd5-4ca3-ab42-02a94b0c041a Heat the olive oil over medium-high heat in a 10-inch nonstick skillet. Add peppers and onions along with a good pinch of salt. Cook for a few minutes, until softened to your liking. Meanwhile, scramble the eggs in a medium bowl.
4b7372ee-9dd5-4ca3-ab42-02a94b0c041a Reduce heat to medium-low. Pour eggs into the skillet and cook, pulling to the center with a silicone spatula as the set underneath, until just cooked through. Divide between two plates and top with cheese, cilantro, hot sauce to taste as well as more salt if you like and some freshly ground black pepper.
03d8954a-1b24-472a-a735-1402974598b4 In a medium mixing bowl, stir together the flour, corn meal, cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda, salt and pepper.
03d8954a-1b24-472a-a735-1402974598b4 In a small bowl or glass measuring cup, whisk together the buttermilk and eggs. Pour into bowl with dry ingredients and mix gently but thoroughly. Pour in the melted butter and stir to incorporate. Then stir in the cheddar and chives.
03d8954a-1b24-472a-a735-1402974598b4 Preheat oven to 200°F with a rack in the center. Preheat waffle iron to medium or medium-dark setting. (Waffle irons vary tremendously, so you may have to experiment a little.) Pour in as much batter as your waffle iron's instructions recommend and cook until golden. Gently remove each waffle from iron and place directly on oven rack. The waffles will still be slightly soft when they come out of the iron but will crisp up on the outside and stay tender on the inside while they rest in the oven.
03d8954a-1b24-472a-a735-1402974598b4 When all waffles are cooked and have had a couple of minutes in the oven, serve with fried eggs on top and a dollop of sour cream if you like.
a30c0280-9dc2-42c4-99d9-e908848998b3 Fit a food processor with the slicing disk. Feed Brussels sprouts through the feed tube to shred. (If you don't have a food processor, you can carefully...and tediously...use a mandoline or slice sprouts with a knife.)
a30c0280-9dc2-42c4-99d9-e908848998b3 Dice the bacon and place in a 12-inch skillet set over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until bacon is just about cooked to your liking. Spoon out and discard all but 2 tablespoons of fat from the pan. Add shallot and cook for two minutes or so, until becoming translucent. Stir in shredded Brussels sprouts and cook, stirring from time to time, until wilted and just tender. Off the heat, add 1 tablespoon of the vinegar and some freshly ground black pepper.
a30c0280-9dc2-42c4-99d9-e908848998b3 Meanwhile, bring a pan of water to the gentlest simmer with the remaining two tablespoons of vinegar. Carefully crack eggs into the water, leaving plenty of space in between, and cook for 4 minutes. Divide hash between two shallow bowls and top with eggs. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and serve immediately.
1c7c4834-3c30-4fd9-922c-d9ea4900e8b3 Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center. Cut potatoes into cubes of about 3/4-inch. Place in a 12-inch cast iron skillet. Toss with the olive oil, salt, a few good grinds of pepper, the garlic, rosemary and thyme. Roast for 30 minutes, stirring after 20.
1c7c4834-3c30-4fd9-922c-d9ea4900e8b3 Meanwhile, remove stems from kale and tear leaves into bite-sized pieces. After 30 minutes, stir kale into pan and roast 10 minutes more.
1c7c4834-3c30-4fd9-922c-d9ea4900e8b3 Remove rosemary and thyme sprigs. Sprinkle feta over skillet contents, then crack in eggs. Bake for about 15 minutes, checking after 10, until eggs are set to your liking.
1c7c4834-3c30-4fd9-922c-d9ea4900e8b3 Sprinkle with parsley and serve.
c456469a-6e45-4f42-9e4f-63ea84b7df3e Preheat oven to 350°F with a rack in the center.
c456469a-6e45-4f42-9e4f-63ea84b7df3e Warm the olive oil in a 10-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add shallot, garlic and a good pinch of salt and cook, stirring constantly, for a minute, until very fragrant. Add spinach and cook, stirring, until wilted and dramatically reduced in volume but still bright green, about two minutes more. Off the heat, stir in the quinoa and feta and set aside.
c456469a-6e45-4f42-9e4f-63ea84b7df3e Cut the butter into 12 pieces and place one into each muffin cup. Place muffin tin in oven for 5 minutes to melt butter. Meanwhile, scramble the eggs in a medium bowl with the cream, 1/4 teaspoon salt and a few good grinds black pepper.
c456469a-6e45-4f42-9e4f-63ea84b7df3e Working quickly and carefully, brush melted butter to coat the bottoms and sides of the muffin cups. Pour eggs evenly into muffin cups, filling each about halfway. Spoon a roughly even amount of spinach-quinoa mixture into each muffin cup. Bake for 20-25 minutes, until eggs are set. Cool slightly before gently removing from pan. Serve immediately or cool completely on a rack before storing tightly covered in the fridge for up to a week.
b1a400b9-439e-4784-9239-ea3b385d7804 Heat olive oil over medium heat in a heavy 12-inch frying pan with tall sides and a lid (which you'll use later). Add onion and red bell pepper along with a good pinch of the salt and some freshly ground black pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes, until somewhat tender. Add garlic, cumin, paprika and pepper flakes and cook, stirring frequently, two minutes more. Add tomatoes and remaining salt and simmer until slightly thickened, about 15 minutes. Stir in feta.
b1a400b9-439e-4784-9239-ea3b385d7804 Reduce heat to medium-low and, working one at a time, use a spoon to make a small well for each egg and crack egg into it. Cover pan and simmer for 10-15 minutes, until whites are set. (See note.) Remove from heat and sprinkle with parsley and more salt and pepper. Serve with crusty bread or pita.
864c9602-8dbe-4a80-bff4-3c3cd239264c Melt the butter in the braiser or skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion, peppers, and shiitakes all at once, along with 1/2 teaspoon of the salt. Cook, stirring from time to time, for about 10 minutes, until the vegetables have softened, browned a bit, and decreased in volume by at least half. Remove from heat.
864c9602-8dbe-4a80-bff4-3c3cd239264c While the other vegetables cook, place the defrosted broccoli on a thick layer of paper towels and cover with another thick layer. When the veggies in the skillet have cooked as noted above, press down gently on the paper towels to remove moisture from the broccoli. The add broccoli to the skillet and stir to incorporate.
864c9602-8dbe-4a80-bff4-3c3cd239264c Crack the eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat well with a fork. Stir in milk, nutmeg, cayenne, and a few good grinds black pepper. Add bread cubes and stir to moisten. Then stir in all the vegetables, half the gruyere and half the parmesan or pecorino. Pour the whole mixture back into the braiser or into the baking pan and sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Cover and refrigerate overnight or for at least a few hours before proceeding. Remove from fridge about an hour before baking if possible.
864c9602-8dbe-4a80-bff4-3c3cd239264c An hour before serving time, preheat oven to 375°F with a rack in the center. Bake uncovered for about 40 minutes, until puffed and golden. Serve hot or even at room temperature.
2dc51121-3c71-48bf-bd31-73df580fc671 Heat the oil over medium-high heat in a nonstick frying pan. Add the pepper, onion and tortilla strips and cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender and everything is browned in spots, about five minutes.
2dc51121-3c71-48bf-bd31-73df580fc671 Beat eggs in a small bowl. Pour into skillet, add cheese and salsa, and give it all a quick scramble, lifting from heat as necessary to cook gently, until the eggs are set.
2dc51121-3c71-48bf-bd31-73df580fc671 Place migas on a plate and garnish with cilantro and hot sauce to taste. Serve immediately.
512e3cfd-798a-4096-8899-88de742565eb I mean...put 'er in a bowl and eat 'er, right?
512e3cfd-798a-4096-8899-88de742565eb Bye.
ec28992e-28b8-4a52-8108-84d5e9848d10 Preheat the oven to 400°F with a rack in the center. In a 12-inch frying pan, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion along with a sprinkle of salt and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the shiitakes and cook until lightly browned and reduced in volume, about 5 minutes more. Add the capers and broccoli and cook until warmed through.
ec28992e-28b8-4a52-8108-84d5e9848d10 Beat the eggs and cream in a bowl and pour evenly over the vegetables in the frying pan. Sprinkle with the cheese.
ec28992e-28b8-4a52-8108-84d5e9848d10 Transfer to oven and bake until set, about 15 minutes. Cut into wedges and serve warm or at room temperature.
8ade783f-383f-433f-82cb-a2aa23123bc1 In a medium bowl, whisk together the sugar, cocoa powder and salt. Add about half of the milk and whisk until the cocoa and sugar are incorporated and not lumpy. Whisk in the rest of the milk along with the eggs and vanilla.
8ade783f-383f-433f-82cb-a2aa23123bc1 Pour the mixture into a shallow baking dish. Add as many of the bread slices as will fit in a single layer. Let them sit and soak up the liquid for a minute or two, then flip and soak the other side.
8ade783f-383f-433f-82cb-a2aa23123bc1 Melt a generous pat of butter in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add as many soaked bread slices as will fit without crowding. Cook for a few minutes until browned on the underside, then flip and continue cooking for a few minutes more, until browned and cooked through. (Adjust heat as necessary and keep a sharp eye out for burning since the sugar and cocoa in the egg mixture can go quickly from good to bad.)
8ade783f-383f-433f-82cb-a2aa23123bc1 Repeat the soaking and cooking process with all 8 slices of bread.
8ade783f-383f-433f-82cb-a2aa23123bc1 Serve topped with fresh berries and stone fruit, along with a dollop of whipped cream if you like.
37d3081d-9ce3-41f1-9efe-8c7a3994a72f Preheat oven to 350° F with a rack in the center.
37d3081d-9ce3-41f1-9efe-8c7a3994a72f Melt one tablespoon of the butter in a large, oven-safe nonstick frying pan set over medium-high heat. Add the sliced garlic scapes and a pinch of salt and cook, stirring once or twice, for two minutes. Add the sliced shiitakes and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. Scrape skillet contents into a bowl and set aside.
37d3081d-9ce3-41f1-9efe-8c7a3994a72f Melt another tablespoon of the butter in the same frying pan. Add the grated potatoes in a single layer and sprinkle with salt. Leave them alone for a few minutes to develop a bit of browning on the bottom, then stir or flip and cook a few minutes more to brown the other side. Add potatoes to bowl with scapes and shiitakes.
37d3081d-9ce3-41f1-9efe-8c7a3994a72f Crack the eggs into a separate bowl, pour in cream, grind in some black pepper, and scramble.
37d3081d-9ce3-41f1-9efe-8c7a3994a72f Melt the final tablespoon of butter in the frying pan. Return potatoes, scapes and shiitakes to frying pan along with capers, distributing it all evenly around the pan. Pour in the eggs. Sprinkle cheese evenly overtop.
37d3081d-9ce3-41f1-9efe-8c7a3994a72f Cook for a minute on the stovetop, then transfer to oven. Bake until eggs are set, 15-20 minutes. Cool slightly before cutting into wedges to serve.
d2f25f64-9112-41e5-aa8f-55b0e1c98e32 Spoon the tomato sauce into a ramekin with a lid and pop it into the toaster oven (or, fine, oven) while it preheats to 375° F.
d2f25f64-9112-41e5-aa8f-55b0e1c98e32 When preheated (or after about 10 minutes), crack the eggs gently into the ramekin. Sprinkle on the grated cheese and some pepper. Bake covered for 10 minutes, then uncovered until the whites are set, about 10 minutes more.
d2f25f64-9112-41e5-aa8f-55b0e1c98e32 Place spinach in a bowl and drizzle with balsamic.
b248f6dd-7811-48cc-9d13-5e657f05b461 Toast the bread to your liking.
b248f6dd-7811-48cc-9d13-5e657f05b461 Scoop out the avocado half and mix it with the lime juice and a pinch of salt. Schmear it onto the toast.
b248f6dd-7811-48cc-9d13-5e657f05b461 Heat the butter in a frying pan and fry the eggs as you like, sprinkling with smoked paprika and salt while cooking. Slide the eggs onto the toast.
b248f6dd-7811-48cc-9d13-5e657f05b461 Top with the salsa and dig in.
349fd25e-a5aa-4a08-9d8c-e28435ae7c76 Using a clean spice or coffee grinder, pulse the flax seed until it is very finely ground. Place in a small bowl and stir in the water. Let sit for 15 minutes or so, until the flax has soaked up some of the water and turned a little bit gelatinous.
349fd25e-a5aa-4a08-9d8c-e28435ae7c76 In a large bowl, stir together the flours, baking soda, baking powder, brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt.
349fd25e-a5aa-4a08-9d8c-e28435ae7c76 Mash the bananas and add them to the dry ingredients along with the flax mixture, milk and vanilla. Stir gently until combined. Then pour in the melted butter or oil and stir until combined.
349fd25e-a5aa-4a08-9d8c-e28435ae7c76 Melt some vegan butter or coconut oil on a skillet over medium-high heat. Dollop batter onto the skillet a scant 1/4 cup at a time, leaving plenty of space between pancakes. Cook until tiny bubbles begin to pop on the tops of the pancakes and they are lightly browned on the underside. Flip and cook a minute or two more. Continue cooking pancakes in batches until batter is gone.
349fd25e-a5aa-4a08-9d8c-e28435ae7c76 Serve immediately with maple syrup.
949a26b9-1f6b-4877-a3ef-c54a458470c7 Preheat the oven to 375°F or the broiler to high. Place a rack 6 to 12 inches from the heat source.
949a26b9-1f6b-4877-a3ef-c54a458470c7 Warm the oil or butter in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the onion along with a good sprinkle of salt and cook until starting to soften, about 5 minutes. Adjust the heat as necessary to prevent too much browning.
949a26b9-1f6b-4877-a3ef-c54a458470c7 Add the corn (straight from frozen is fine) and the capers and cook for a few minutes until warmed through.
949a26b9-1f6b-4877-a3ef-c54a458470c7 Stir in the spinach a little at a time, adding more as it wilts. Sprinkle with a little more salt and cook until spinach is just wilted.
949a26b9-1f6b-4877-a3ef-c54a458470c7 Scramble the eggs and pour them evenly into the pan. Place the cheddar on top.
949a26b9-1f6b-4877-a3ef-c54a458470c7 Transfer frittata to oven and bake or broil until set (or a little longer if you prefer a brown top and firmer eggs).
949a26b9-1f6b-4877-a3ef-c54a458470c7 Cut into wedges and serve warm or at room temperature.
45116821-d182-4200-90ec-34bf9823e096 Combine the oats, milk, water, maple syrup, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a small pot. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce to a gentle simmer. Cook, stirring occasionally, for a few minutes, until the porridge is soft and a little thinner than you'd like it. It will thicken quickly as it cools.
45116821-d182-4200-90ec-34bf9823e096 To serve, divide oatmeal between two bowls and top with berries, a spoonful of peanut butter, and a sprinkling of flaxseed and coconut.
09609764-d589-46d2-8c26-705883b0c1a8 In a medium pot, combine the oats, water, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
09609764-d589-46d2-8c26-705883b0c1a8 Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
09609764-d589-46d2-8c26-705883b0c1a8 Cover and reduce heat to low or medium-low, to maintain a gentle simmer. Cook until water is absorbed and oats are tender but still chewy, 40 to 45 minutes.
09609764-d589-46d2-8c26-705883b0c1a8 Remove from heat and stir in maple syrup and flaxseeds.
09609764-d589-46d2-8c26-705883b0c1a8 Spoon into bowls and top with fruit, nuts, and a splash of almond milk.
887e9f60-e1c0-44fe-8353-626ae3f85ba8 Combine all ingredients in a 3- to 4-quart heavy pot.
887e9f60-e1c0-44fe-8353-626ae3f85ba8 Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring occasionally.
887e9f60-e1c0-44fe-8353-626ae3f85ba8 Reduce the heat to maintain a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally, until the oatmeal is creamy and a little thinner than you like it (about ten minutes, give or take).
887e9f60-e1c0-44fe-8353-626ae3f85ba8 Cool for a few minutes and serve topped with fresh or dried fruit, chocolate chips, or nuts.
304030dd-c464-4222-8f80-c3940d75d04a Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
304030dd-c464-4222-8f80-c3940d75d04a Combine the oats, coconut, and almonds in a large bowl and mix well.
304030dd-c464-4222-8f80-c3940d75d04a Add the oil and honey to the bowl, and mix gently until all ingredients are coated.
304030dd-c464-4222-8f80-c3940d75d04a Add the cinnamon, nutmeg and salt, and mix gently to combine.
304030dd-c464-4222-8f80-c3940d75d04a Spread the mixture onto two rimmed baking sheets (half-sheet pans) and bake for about 25 minutes, until golden brown. Watch carefully toward the end, since all ovens are different, and it can go from perfect to burned quickly. (If you have a convection oven, this is a great time to use it. The granola will brown more quickly, so watch carefully after about 10 to 15 minutes.)
304030dd-c464-4222-8f80-c3940d75d04a Sprinkle half the cherries over each pan, then cool completely before storing in an airtight container. Granola will keep for weeks stored this way at room temperature.
03b0dd72-2f3c-4e6c-a94d-8f2d7f82bfca Heat a cast-iron skillet over medium heat for two minutes. Open the hamburger buns and brush each inside face with some of the melted butter. Place buns buttered side down (probably in two batches, depending on your skillet) and toast for a couple of minutes, until light golden brown on the underside. Place buns on serving plates.
03b0dd72-2f3c-4e6c-a94d-8f2d7f82bfca Raise heat to medium-high. Divide beef into four hockey pucks and sprinkle both sides generously with salt and pepper.
03b0dd72-2f3c-4e6c-a94d-8f2d7f82bfca Place pucks onto skillet and use a sturdy metal spatula to firmly smash each puck into a patty that's about 1/3-inch thick. After this, absolutely ignore the burgers for about three minutes, until the undersides are brown and crisp at the edges and the juices on the surface are hot and bubbly. Scrape up each patty and any brown bits with the spatula and flip it. Cook one to two minutes more. Place a slice of cheese on top of each burger at the very end of cooking to melt just enough.
03b0dd72-2f3c-4e6c-a94d-8f2d7f82bfca To make the sauce, stir together all sauce ingredients in a small bowl until well combined.
03b0dd72-2f3c-4e6c-a94d-8f2d7f82bfca Transfer patties to buns. Layer each burger with two tomato slices and a piece of lettuce. Spoon 1/4 of the sauce onto each top bun half. Serve immediately.
9757899b-f12c-480e-a630-1cb5265685f5 Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a half sheet pan with foil. To make the bacon weave, start by laying four bacon slices next to each other, long sides touching, in the middle of the pan. Then, one by one starting at the top, lay each of the remaining pieces crosswise. Weave the first piece over, under, over, under the original slices. Weave the second piece under, over, under, over, etc. (If you learned a different weaving method in elementary school, go for it.) Bake bacon until done to your liking -- 15 minutes plus depending on the thickness of the cut. Drain on paper towels, reserving the grease in the pan. When cooled enough, cut weave into four squares.
9757899b-f12c-480e-a630-1cb5265685f5 Meanwhile, form four burger patties from the ground beef. Use your thumb to create a nice big divot in the middle of each patty to ensure even cooking. Sprinkle generously with salt and pepper immediately before cooking. You can grill the burgers or cook in a cast-iron pan with a couple tablespoons of the bacon grease. To grill, prepare a hot side and a cooler side of the grill with a little oil on the grates. Start burgers over direct heat, flipping once, to form a nice crust on both sides. This should take about three minutes per side. Transfer burgers to indirect heat to cook through to your liking (125°F for medium-rare, 130°F for medium on an instant-read thermometer). For cast iron, preheat a 12-inch cast iron pan over high heat until very hot. Pour in two tablespoons of bacon grease, then set burgers into pan. Cook on high heat to form a crust on both sides, flipping once, then reduce heat to medium and continue cooking according to internal temperature instructions above. Let burgers rest for at least 5 minutes before continuing.
9757899b-f12c-480e-a630-1cb5265685f5 While burgers rest, add another two tablespoons of bacon grease into the hot pan, pile in the onions and sprinkle generously with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring frequently, until browned and wilted. Add marsala and cook until evaporated.
9757899b-f12c-480e-a630-1cb5265685f5 To assemble the burgers, toast the buns for a minute or two if you like, then layer on some spinach leaves, a burger patty, bacon, onions, and some crumbled blue cheese.
2418e5b4-87ea-4106-a002-c3f74d50d459 In a medium pot, combine the lentils, rice, salt, herbes de Provence and three cups of water. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer until water is absorbed and rice and lentils are cooked, about 40 minutes.
2418e5b4-87ea-4106-a002-c3f74d50d459 Meanwhile, warm the oil in a 12-inch frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the onion and celery and cook, stirring occasionally, until beginning to soften, about five minutes. Stir in garlic and cook one minute more. Add the shiitakes as they fit into the pan and cook, stirring frequently, until browned in spots and about halved in volume, 10 minutes or so.
2418e5b4-87ea-4106-a002-c3f74d50d459 Preheat oven to 450°F with two racks as near the center as possible. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
2418e5b4-87ea-4106-a002-c3f74d50d459 Into a full-size food processor fitted with the blade, place the walnuts and the mushroom mixture. Pulse until finely chopped. Stir in the cooked rice and lentils and pulse a few times to combine. Transfer mixture to a large mixing bowl. Add the ketchup, tamari, flaxseed, mustard, marmite and black pepper and mix together thoroughly. Stir in the cornmeal.
2418e5b4-87ea-4106-a002-c3f74d50d459 Form into 10 patties and place on baking sheets.
2418e5b4-87ea-4106-a002-c3f74d50d459 Bake for 15 minutes, then flip each patty, rotate locations of pans and bake 15 minutes more.
2418e5b4-87ea-4106-a002-c3f74d50d459 Serve 'er like a burger. (Sorry, I just had to.) These patties keep well in the fridge for up to a week and can be reheated in the microwave. Or you should be able to freeze cooked patties, though I haven't tried this yet because they always disappear within the week.
8c77ddd1-bf61-4e17-b4ca-a973447da81f Preheat oven to 450°F with a rack in the center. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a light layer of oil.
8c77ddd1-bf61-4e17-b4ca-a973447da81f Into food processor fitted with the blade, place the onion, garlic, sweet potato and walnuts. Process until finely chopped. Add the cooked rice and lentils and pulse until well combined. Transfer into a large mixing bowl. Add the ketchup, mustard, flax, salt, cayenne and black pepper and mix together thoroughly.
8c77ddd1-bf61-4e17-b4ca-a973447da81f Stir in the cornmeal. The mixture should be thick enough that you can easily form patties in your hands. If not, add a bit more cornmeal. Divide into eight patties and place on a the baking sheet.
8c77ddd1-bf61-4e17-b4ca-a973447da81f Bake for 20 minutes, then flip each patty and bake 15 minutes more. Serve as you like.
086ac784-cee6-4d4c-a791-ad7be2103ae8 Peel the sweet potatoes and cut lengthwise into quarters. Peel and quarter the onion.
086ac784-cee6-4d4c-a791-ad7be2103ae8 Set up a food processor with the grating blade. Grate the sweet potatoes in two batches and add them to a very large mixing bowl. (Alternatively, grate on a box grater.)
086ac784-cee6-4d4c-a791-ad7be2103ae8 Grate the onion and place on paper towels to absorb excess moisture. Then add to mixing bowl.
086ac784-cee6-4d4c-a791-ad7be2103ae8 Mix in beaten eggs, scallions, flour, matzo meal, melted butter, salt, pepper, and baking powder.
086ac784-cee6-4d4c-a791-ad7be2103ae8 Pour safflower oil into a large frying pan to a depth of about 1/8 inch. Heat oil over medium-high until it thins and becomes shimmery. Use a soup spoon to scoop little mounds of the sweet potato mixture into the skillet (3 tablespoons at a time makes nice, diminutive latkes). Gently flatten the pancakes. Don't crowd the skillet — leave an inch or so between latkes.
086ac784-cee6-4d4c-a791-ad7be2103ae8 Fry until the underside is crispy and golden brown, then flip and fry until the second side is crispy and golden brown, about 5 minutes total. Remove cooked latkes to paper towels to drain. Continue cooking, adding more oil as necessary and adjusting the heat to keep oil hot but not smoking, until you've used all of the sweet potato mixture.
086ac784-cee6-4d4c-a791-ad7be2103ae8 Sprinkle with additional sliced scallions and some flaky sea salt and serve with sour cream.
39a5460f-e71f-407f-8ba8-970076303085 Peel the potatoes and cut lengthwise into quarters. Contrary to what you might normally do, don't put the peeled potatoes in a bowl of water, because you want to keep all the starch. Just leave them on the counter. Don't worry if they brown a bit.
39a5460f-e71f-407f-8ba8-970076303085 Peel and quarter the onion.
39a5460f-e71f-407f-8ba8-970076303085 Set up a food processor with the grating blade. Grate the potatoes and onions in two batches and add them to a strainer set over a large mixing bowl. Squeeze out as much moisture as you can with your hands, then let the mixture rest and drain for three minutes or so.
39a5460f-e71f-407f-8ba8-970076303085 Pour off all the liquid from the bowl, but leave the layer of starch that's accumulated at the bottom. Add grated potatoes and onions to the bowl.
39a5460f-e71f-407f-8ba8-970076303085 Mix in beaten eggs, matzo meal, melted butter, salt, pepper, and baking powder.
39a5460f-e71f-407f-8ba8-970076303085 Pour safflower oil into a large frying pan to a depth of about 1/8 inch. Heat oil over medium-high until it thins and becomes shimmery. Use a soup spoon to scoop little mounds of the potato mixture into the skillet (3 tablespoons at a time makes nice, diminutive latkes). Gently flatten the pancakes. Don't crowd the skillet — leave an inch or so between latkes.
39a5460f-e71f-407f-8ba8-970076303085 Fry until the underside is crispy and golden brown, then flip and fry until the second side is crispy and golden brown, about 5 minutes total. Remove cooked latkes to paper towels to drain. Continue cooking, adding more oil as necessary and adjusting the heat to keep oil hot but not smoking, until you've used all of the potato mixture.
39a5460f-e71f-407f-8ba8-970076303085 Serve with applesauce, sour cream, and smoked salmon if you like.
80dea3a6-4197-4f75-93af-d8b0c3537c3a Shred the zucchini with the shredding disc of a food processor or on the large holes of a box grater. Place the shredded zucchini in a colander in the sink or over a bowl and sprinkle with the salt. Toss to combine. Let drain while you prepare the rest of the ingredients.
80dea3a6-4197-4f75-93af-d8b0c3537c3a Crack the eggs into a large bowl and scramble lightly. Cut the kernels from the corn cobs and add the kernels to the bowl along with the diced onion, sliced scallions, chopped cilantro, flour, grated cheese and pepper.
80dea3a6-4197-4f75-93af-d8b0c3537c3a Pick up the shredded zucchini in small handfuls and squeeze out and discard as much liquid as you can. Add the zucchini to the bowl. Mix well to combine.
80dea3a6-4197-4f75-93af-d8b0c3537c3a Pour the oil into a large frying pan to a depth of about 1/4-inch. Heat the oil over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Drop batter by the 1/4-cupful into the pan and press lightly to form disc-shaped fritters. Cook in batches without crowding (about 3 or 4 at a time, depending on the size of your pan) until golden brown on the underside (about 2 minutes) and then flip and cook until golden brown on the second side. Remove to paper towels to drain. Add a bit more oil between batches if necessary.
80dea3a6-4197-4f75-93af-d8b0c3537c3a Serve warm or at room temperature with sour cream.
41f65ca0-f6ce-499a-9ef4-75d1d0ef322b In a medium pot, cover the potatoes with cold water by an inch or two, add the tablespoon of salt, and bring to a boil. Turn down the heat to maintain a brisk simmer and cook until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes give or take depending on how big the pieces are. Drain potatoes in a colander and set aside.
41f65ca0-f6ce-499a-9ef4-75d1d0ef322b While the potatoes cook, prepare the shallots and cabbage.
41f65ca0-f6ce-499a-9ef4-75d1d0ef322b Return the same pot to the stove and heat the butter and olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the shallots and cabbage and cook, stirring frequently (tongs are useful here), until cabbage is wilted and somewhat tender, about 5 minutes.
41f65ca0-f6ce-499a-9ef4-75d1d0ef322b Add the milk, raise heat to high, and warm until gently simmering. Remove pot from heat. Return the potatoes to the pot, add the teaspoon of salt and the pepper, and mash well with a potato masher. Stir in the cheddar.
41f65ca0-f6ce-499a-9ef4-75d1d0ef322b At this point the mixture will need to cool slightly — so either turn it out into a mixing bowl to speed the process or leave it in the pot to spare a dirty dish and wait a few minutes longer.
41f65ca0-f6ce-499a-9ef4-75d1d0ef322b Make a well in the center of the potatoes and crack the eggs into it. Beat them well, then stir completely into the mix. Sprinkle the flour over the whole thing and mix in thoroughly.
41f65ca0-f6ce-499a-9ef4-75d1d0ef322b Heat a thin layer of oil over medium-high heat in a 12-inch nonstick skillet. When it shimmers, spoon about three tablespoons of the mixture into the pan to form a reasonably round cake. You should be able to fit 4 cakes in the skillet at a time without crowding. Cook undisturbed for a few minutes, until the underside is nicely browned. Flip gently with a spatula and cook until the second side is browned, a few minutes more. You may need to adjust the heat so the cakes cook through in the same amount of time they take to brown.
41f65ca0-f6ce-499a-9ef4-75d1d0ef322b Set on a paper towel-lined plate or in a 200°F oven while you cook the remaining batches. Serve warm or at room temperature.
7630ff74-e3a3-4215-a942-3a83308b5ad1 Squeeze out as much water from the spinach as possible and place spinach in a large mixing bowl.
7630ff74-e3a3-4215-a942-3a83308b5ad1 Fill a medium pot halfway with water and bring to a boil over high heat. Add the fava beans and cook for two minutes. Drain. Place fava beans (including skins, if you like) in a food processor and pulse until a coarse puree forms. Add the puree to the mixing bowl.
7630ff74-e3a3-4215-a942-3a83308b5ad1 Add the quinoa, garlic, salt, cumin, coriander, paprika, turmeric, and pepper to the bowl. Mix with a wooden spoon or with your hands to combine thoroughly. Taste for seasoning.
7630ff74-e3a3-4215-a942-3a83308b5ad1 Form the mixture into small patties, 2 to 3 tablespoons each, and place on a baking sheet. Refrigerate for about 30 minutes.
7630ff74-e3a3-4215-a942-3a83308b5ad1 Coat the bottom of a wide, heavy skillet with olive oil and warm over medium heat until it shimmers. Cook the cakes in batches, without crowding, until golden brown on the underside, and then flip and cook until the second side is golden as well. Place on a paper towel-lined plate.
7630ff74-e3a3-4215-a942-3a83308b5ad1 Serve warm or at room temperature with lemon slices.
09757ec0-4071-43d6-8a4a-d0f5814da92c Place chickpeas in a large bowl and cover with water by at least 1 inch. Soak for 24 hours. Drain well.
09757ec0-4071-43d6-8a4a-d0f5814da92c Half at a time, pour chickpeas into a food processor fitted with the blade attachment. Process, stopping to scrape down the sides as necessary, until chickpeas begin to form a very coarse paste. It should just hold together when you squeeze it in your palm but still be made up of thousands of little chickpea bits. Scrape the chickpea paste back into the large bowl. Add the onion, garlic, cilantro, parsley, baking powder, coriander, cumin, cayenne, salt, and pepper. Mix well but gently with your hands (as you would for meatballs). Refrigerate until firm, about an hour.
09757ec0-4071-43d6-8a4a-d0f5814da92c Using a measuring tablespoon if you wish, or just your hands, shape batter into 1-inch balls. The balls should stick together well, but try not to work the batter too much. Divide the balls between two half-sheet pans or cookie trays lined with parchment, and refrigerate for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, make a sauce, such as tahini (click and then scroll down for recipe) or yogurt sauce.
09757ec0-4071-43d6-8a4a-d0f5814da92c Pour oil into a large, heavy pot to a depth of about 1 inch (I use a 5-1/2 quart Dutch oven). Insert a candy/deep fry thermometer and heat oil over medium heat until it reaches 350°F. Carefully drop balls one by one into the hot oil. Don't crowd them—you'll fry in batches of about 8 at a time, depending on the size of your pot. Fry until golden brown on all sides, about 3 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Keep warm in a 250°F oven if you like. Serve with pita, tahini or yogurt sauce, raw onions, cucumber, parsley, and tomato—or any or none of the above.
b868117b-0ccc-4553-a2aa-ab7e18ce381c Preheat oven to 425°F with a rack in the center. Grease a standard 12-muffin tin or line with paper liners.
b868117b-0ccc-4553-a2aa-ab7e18ce381c In a large bowl, whisk together the cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
b868117b-0ccc-4553-a2aa-ab7e18ce381c Measure the buttermilk into a 2-cup liquid measure, then crack in the eggs and beat to combine.
b868117b-0ccc-4553-a2aa-ab7e18ce381c Pour the buttermilk mixture into the bowl with the dry ingredients and stir gently until there are no dry pockets.
b868117b-0ccc-4553-a2aa-ab7e18ce381c Pour in the melted butter and stir until combined.
b868117b-0ccc-4553-a2aa-ab7e18ce381c Divide batter among 12 muffin cups. I like to fill my 1/4-cup measure generously with batter and use it as a scoop. Bake 10-12 minutes, until a tester comes out clean. Remove to a rack to cool slightly before serving, or cool completely and keep for up to a day or two.
cbd05572-96c5-48c2-a058-e7317e3decf0 Preheat the oven to 350°F with a rack in the center. Grease a medium (8-cup/9 x 5 x 3 inch) loaf pan.
cbd05572-96c5-48c2-a058-e7317e3decf0 In a large bowl, mash the bananas with a fork.
cbd05572-96c5-48c2-a058-e7317e3decf0 Mix in the melted butter.
cbd05572-96c5-48c2-a058-e7317e3decf0 Crack the egg into the bowl near one of the sides, tilt the bowl slightly, and use the fork to lightly beat the egg.
cbd05572-96c5-48c2-a058-e7317e3decf0 Add the brown sugar, vanilla, and coffee to the bowl and mix with the fork to combine well.
cbd05572-96c5-48c2-a058-e7317e3decf0 Sprinkle the baking soda and salt over the batter.
cbd05572-96c5-48c2-a058-e7317e3decf0 Add the flour and mix with the fork until just combined.
cbd05572-96c5-48c2-a058-e7317e3decf0 Add the chocolate and walnuts and mix just until they're well distributed in the batter.
cbd05572-96c5-48c2-a058-e7317e3decf0 Scrape the batter into the loaf pan and bake for 45 minutes to one hour, until a tester inserted in the center comes out cleanish. It's fine if it has some banana or chocolate on it, but lots of wet batter ain't right.
cbd05572-96c5-48c2-a058-e7317e3decf0 Cool in the pan on a rack for ten minutes (before unmolding to cool completely, if you're positively made of steel).
0103e0a4-3576-46af-bd8d-e1968909d954 Preheat oven to 425°F with a rack in the center. Grease 16 two standard 12-muffin tins or line with paper liners.
0103e0a4-3576-46af-bd8d-e1968909d954 In a small bowl, stir together the cherries and 1/4 cup of the sugar. Set aside.
0103e0a4-3576-46af-bd8d-e1968909d954 In a large bowl, whisk together the cornmeal, flour, the remaining 1/4 cup of sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
0103e0a4-3576-46af-bd8d-e1968909d954 Measure the buttermilk into a 2-cup liquid measure, then crack in the eggs and beat to combine.
0103e0a4-3576-46af-bd8d-e1968909d954 Pour the buttermilk mixture into the bowl with the dry ingredients and stir gently until there are no dry pockets.
0103e0a4-3576-46af-bd8d-e1968909d954 Pour in the melted butter and stir until combined.
0103e0a4-3576-46af-bd8d-e1968909d954 Drain any liquid from the cherries and stir cherries into batter.
0103e0a4-3576-46af-bd8d-e1968909d954 Divide batter among 16 muffin cups. Bake 10-12 minutes, until a tester comes out clean. Remove from oven and let cool in pans for 5 minutes, then turn muffins out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
90550d4c-5267-4ace-8a12-d5a4d053ea65 Preheat the oven to 350°F with a rack in the center. Grease three 1-pound loaf pans (8.5-by-4.25-by-2.75 inches) or 16 mini loaf pans with olive oil or spray with cooking spray. If you don’t have three pans, you can bake the bread in batches.
90550d4c-5267-4ace-8a12-d5a4d053ea65 In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs with a fork. Add the olive oil, water, sugar and pumpkin purée and whisk with a fork to combine thoroughly.
90550d4c-5267-4ace-8a12-d5a4d053ea65 Sift the flour together with the salt, nutmeg, cinnamon, cloves, and baking soda into the mixing bowl. Stir dry ingredients into wet ingredients until just combined. Stir in nuts, if using.
90550d4c-5267-4ace-8a12-d5a4d053ea65 Divide batter evenly among prepared pans, about three cups of batter (with nuts) per pan large loaf pan.
90550d4c-5267-4ace-8a12-d5a4d053ea65 For large pans, bake for 45 minutes to an hour, until a cake tester inserted into the center comes out clean. For mini loaf pans, bake 25 minutes.
90550d4c-5267-4ace-8a12-d5a4d053ea65 Cool on a rack for 10 minutes before removing from pan to cool completely.
7dd95fb6-bcc7-4ba8-92fe-34b776d0a8eb Preheat the oven to 350° F with a rack in the center. Grease a 9 x 5-inch (8-cup) loaf pan.
7dd95fb6-bcc7-4ba8-92fe-34b776d0a8eb In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and pepper.
7dd95fb6-bcc7-4ba8-92fe-34b776d0a8eb Add the zucchini, cheeses, shallot, and herbs and toss to separate and coat with flour.
7dd95fb6-bcc7-4ba8-92fe-34b776d0a8eb In a small bowl or glass measuring cup, whisk together the eggs, buttermilk, and melted butter.
7dd95fb6-bcc7-4ba8-92fe-34b776d0a8eb Pour wet ingredients into the bowl with the flour mixture and mix until just combined.
7dd95fb6-bcc7-4ba8-92fe-34b776d0a8eb Bake for 55-60 minutes, until a cake tester inserted in the center comes out clean.
7dd95fb6-bcc7-4ba8-92fe-34b776d0a8eb Let cool in the pan on a rack for 5 to 10 minutes before unmolding to cool completely on a rack.
aceb9441-de0f-4668-842b-1e2f94baf3ca Preheat oven to 350°F with a rack in the center. Line 18 standard muffin cups with paper liners or grease the pan well with oil or cooking spray, including the top.
aceb9441-de0f-4668-842b-1e2f94baf3ca In a medium bowl, stir together the 2 cups flour, baking powder, baking soda and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
aceb9441-de0f-4668-842b-1e2f94baf3ca In a small bowl, stir together the yogurt and vanilla extract.
aceb9441-de0f-4668-842b-1e2f94baf3ca In the bowl of a stand mixer (or a large bowl), beat together the 4 tablespoons butter and the 1 cup sugar until lightened in color and texture, about 3 minutes. Add the eggs and beat to incorporate. Then add half the flour mixture and beat on low until just incorporated. Follow with half the yogurt mixture and then the remaining halves of the flour and yogurt, beating on low after each addition. Fold blueberries into the batter. Spoon by the scant 1/4-cupful into paper-lined muffin cups.
aceb9441-de0f-4668-842b-1e2f94baf3ca To make the crumble topping, stir together the flour, brown sugar, nuts, cinnamon and salt in a small bowl. Pour the melted butter overtop and stir to incorporate into the dry ingredients. Cover the surface of each muffin with topping and press lightly.
aceb9441-de0f-4668-842b-1e2f94baf3ca Bake for about 24 minutes, until a tester comes out almost clean. Remove muffins to a wire rack to cool.
8e21c3f4-a1cb-4eb2-8f41-55769d8172a4 Preheat oven to 375° Fahrenheit with one rack about 1/3 of the way up from the oven's bottom and another about 1/3 of the way down from the oven's top. Place a total of 22 (or 24, if using walnuts) paper muffin cups in two standard 12-muffin tins.
8e21c3f4-a1cb-4eb2-8f41-55769d8172a4 In a large bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, brown sugar, granulated sugar, baking soda, baking powder, salt, nutmeg, cinnamon, allspice, and cloves.
8e21c3f4-a1cb-4eb2-8f41-55769d8172a4 In a medium bowl, whisk together the pumpkin puree, oil, maple syrup, and water.
8e21c3f4-a1cb-4eb2-8f41-55769d8172a4 Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and use a spatula to fold the ingredients together. Fold just until there are no pockets of flour that haven't been incorporated into the batter, and then stop. Fold in the chopped walnuts, if using.
8e21c3f4-a1cb-4eb2-8f41-55769d8172a4 Use a medium ice cream scoop to fill each muffin cup a little more than halfway. Bake for 15 minutes with one muffin tin on each oven rack. Then switch the positions of the tins and bake for about 10 minutes more, until a tester inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean. Cool muffins in tins on a wire rack for about 20 minutes, then remove muffins from tins and cool completely. Frost with cream cheese frosting (or a vegan frosting of your choice), if desired.
a52fcd96-e299-4c72-b378-6ebf82a8f925 Preheat the oven to 375°F with the top rack in the center. Lightly grease two popover or muffin pans.
a52fcd96-e299-4c72-b378-6ebf82a8f925 In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and water. Slowly drizzle in the melted butter while whisking. Add the flour and salt and mix until well combined but still slightly lumpy. Divide the batter among the pans, filling each well only about 1/3 full.
a52fcd96-e299-4c72-b378-6ebf82a8f925 Bake for 45 minutes without opening the oven. Then cut a small slit in the top of each popover to release the steam and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Serve immediately.
4f0fb126-14b2-480d-8c8a-f2833090042a Preheat the oven to 375° F. Line two standard muffin pans with paper liners. In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the wire whisk, combine the bananas, yogurt, sweet potatoes, brown sugar and white sugar. Mix on high speed until lightened in color and texture, about 3 minutes. Add the butter, eggs and vanilla and mix until well-combined, stopping to scrape down the sides of the bowl when necessary.
4f0fb126-14b2-480d-8c8a-f2833090042a In a medium bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, white whole wheat flour, salt, baking soda, cinnamon and nutmeg. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix on low speed until just combined.
4f0fb126-14b2-480d-8c8a-f2833090042a Spoon the batter into the muffin cups, filling them a little more than halfway. Bake for 18-20 minutes, until a tester inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
51498f2b-55e9-44c1-9ebd-234f5870f26a Preheat oven to 375°F with a rack in the center.
51498f2b-55e9-44c1-9ebd-234f5870f26a Spray a standard 12-muffin pan with baking spray or lightly oil the cups.
51498f2b-55e9-44c1-9ebd-234f5870f26a In a small microwave-safe bowl, warm the butter in the microwave for 1 ½ to 2 minutes on medium power until just melted. (Seriously, don’t use high power unless you like licking butter off the microwave door.) Alternatively, you can melt the butter over low heat in a small pot on the stove.
51498f2b-55e9-44c1-9ebd-234f5870f26a Add the egg, yolk, milk and vanilla to the bowl with the melted butter and whisk thoroughly to combine.
51498f2b-55e9-44c1-9ebd-234f5870f26a In a medium bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt and mix thoroughly.
51498f2b-55e9-44c1-9ebd-234f5870f26a Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix gently until just combined. Do not overmix. The batter will be very thick.
51498f2b-55e9-44c1-9ebd-234f5870f26a Gently fold in the fruit, nuts or other additions.
51498f2b-55e9-44c1-9ebd-234f5870f26a Divide the batter among the 12 muffin cups. Bake for 18-22 minutes, until lightly browned on top. Cool on a rack for 10 minutes before removing muffins from the pan. Serve warm or at room temperature.
7de8d796-e104-4f3d-b690-51ab91e20a23 In a large mixing bowl (or right in the bowl of a stand mixer, if you like), stir together the flour, yeast, salt, and sugar.
7de8d796-e104-4f3d-b690-51ab91e20a23 Pour in the water and mix well (by hand or with a wooden spoon or silicone spatula) until all the flour is hydrated.
7de8d796-e104-4f3d-b690-51ab91e20a23 Pour in olive oil and mix until incorporated.
7de8d796-e104-4f3d-b690-51ab91e20a23 Knead dough for 10 minutes. I like to use a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook, but you can do it by hand if you like.
7de8d796-e104-4f3d-b690-51ab91e20a23 Divide dough into two equal pieces and form each piece into a ball. Lightly oil and place into two separate sealed containers. Lidded glass food storage bowls or quart-sizes takeout containers works well.
7de8d796-e104-4f3d-b690-51ab91e20a23 Let dough rise in the fridge for at least 24 hours, up to 72 hours.
7de8d796-e104-4f3d-b690-51ab91e20a23 An hour before you you want to bake the pizzas, remove dough from refrigerator. Set a pizza stone or steel on a rack in the center of the oven and preheat oven to 500°F (260°C) or higher if your oven goes higher.
7de8d796-e104-4f3d-b690-51ab91e20a23 When ready to bake, remove dough from container. If you're a newer pizza maker and would like the extra security of a less sticky dough, feel free to flour it generously.
7de8d796-e104-4f3d-b690-51ab91e20a23 Stretch the dough into a rough 14-inch round. You do not need to do a perfect job to end up with good pizza.
7de8d796-e104-4f3d-b690-51ab91e20a23 Top the pizza judiciously. For cheese pizza, I use a not-obscene amount of thick tomato sauce, grated pecorino cheese, and low-moisture whole-milk mozzarella that I shred right before topping.
7de8d796-e104-4f3d-b690-51ab91e20a23 Slide the pizza into the oven and bake for 10 minutes, until cheese is melted and bubbly and crust is cooked and browned in spots.
d6dcc66d-9fb1-4ccd-a954-0ddbe1f19596 Preheat oven to 500°F with a pizza stone, upside down-sheet pan or 12-inch cast iron skillet on a rack in the center.
d6dcc66d-9fb1-4ccd-a954-0ddbe1f19596 To make the pesto, fit a food processor with the blade. Place half the watercress in the bowl along with the spinach, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, pecorino, salt and half the walnuts. Pulse until finely minced and well combined, stopping to scrape down the sides once or twice.
d6dcc66d-9fb1-4ccd-a954-0ddbe1f19596 Divide the dough into two equal portions and stretch each into a 12-inch circle. If you like, place each prepared dough round on a piece of parchment paper to make it easier to slide in and out of the oven.
d6dcc66d-9fb1-4ccd-a954-0ddbe1f19596 Spread half the pesto onto each piece of dough and top with the mozzarella. Bake for about 10 minutes, until browned and bubbly. Sprinkle with the remaining walnuts and the blue cheese and return to the oven for one minute more.
d6dcc66d-9fb1-4ccd-a954-0ddbe1f19596 Drizzle pizzas with balsamic glaze and top with remaining watercress. Cut into slices and serve right away.
f628ae0b-37e4-4bb5-b07b-d950854085c2 Preheat oven to 500°F with a rack in the center. If you have a pizza stone, preheat it on the center rack. (If not, you can use an overturned half sheet pan.)
f628ae0b-37e4-4bb5-b07b-d950854085c2 In a 12-inch nonstick frying pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add mushrooms, garlic and salt and raise heat to high. Toss mushrooms to coat with butter. Cook for 5 to 10 minutes, until they are beginning to brown in spots and have significantly reduced in volume. Add wine and cook until all the liquid is gone. Stir in heavy cream, asparagus and tarragon, reduce the heat to simmer briskly, and cook for an addition couple of minutes, until the cream has thickened to coat the vegetables without dripping.
f628ae0b-37e4-4bb5-b07b-d950854085c2 Rub pizza dough with olive oil and divide into two equal portions. Stretch each portion into a 12-inch round. I like to place each round on a piece of parchment to make transfer to and from the oven much easier. Top each with half the vegetable mixture, half the gruyere and half the pecorino. Bake for about 1o minutes, until dough is crisp on the underside and cheese is bubbly. (I bake one pizza at a time, putting the second one in the oven as we sit down to eat the first.) Sprinkle with parsley and pepper. Cut into slices and serve.
4849e057-ff0a-4964-8c70-2c9731b6631e Preheat oven to 500°F with a rack in the center. Preheat a pizza stone on the center rack if you have one.
4849e057-ff0a-4964-8c70-2c9731b6631e In a 12-inch skillet, cook bacon until crispy. Remove bacon from pan and set aside.
4849e057-ff0a-4964-8c70-2c9731b6631e Drain off all but 1 tablespoon fat from pan.
4849e057-ff0a-4964-8c70-2c9731b6631e Return pan to medium heat and add onion and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, until beginning to soften, about 5 minutes.
4849e057-ff0a-4964-8c70-2c9731b6631e Stir in cauliflower along with 1/4 cup water. Cover and cook until just tender. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
4849e057-ff0a-4964-8c70-2c9731b6631e Meanwhile, rub the olive oil over the pizza dough and stretch dough to cover a half sheet pan.
4849e057-ff0a-4964-8c70-2c9731b6631e Spread sauce over dough and sprinkle with mozzarella and rosemary.
4849e057-ff0a-4964-8c70-2c9731b6631e Spread cauliflower mixture evenly over pizza and sprinkle with pecorino.
4849e057-ff0a-4964-8c70-2c9731b6631e Bake for 12-15 minutes, until crust is done and cauliflower has some nice charred spots.
4849e057-ff0a-4964-8c70-2c9731b6631e Sprinkle pizza with reserved bacon and some flaky sea salt and freshly ground black pepper. Drizzle with balsamic glaze.
4849e057-ff0a-4964-8c70-2c9731b6631e Cut into rectangles and serve right away.
4541b590-0a3d-4281-8e12-67c27cf74259 Place a pizza stone (or, in a pinch, an upside-down baking sheet) on a rack in the center of the oven. Preheat oven to 500°F.
4541b590-0a3d-4281-8e12-67c27cf74259 Divide the pizza dough into two portions and stretch each into a 12-inch round. If you like, place each on a sheet of parchment just slightly larger than the dough. Top each dough round with 1/2 cup tomato sauce and spread well. Sprinkle each with half the mozzarella. Bake for about 10 minutes, until browned and bubbly. (I bake one at a time -- the first right before we're ready to eat and the second while we eat the first.)
4541b590-0a3d-4281-8e12-67c27cf74259 Meanwhile, toss the arugula with the olive oil, lemon juice, flaky salt and plenty of freshly ground black pepper.
4541b590-0a3d-4281-8e12-67c27cf74259 When each pizza is done, tear the prosciutto slices in half and arrange on top of pizza. Heap arugula salad in the center, then shower with curls of Parmigiano cheese. Top with more black pepper if you like, and drizzle with balsamic glaze. Cut into slices and serve immediately.
9efa2ba0-018d-4eeb-9e71-6577b5a12efc Warm olive oil over medium heat in a medium pot. Add garlic and cook until very fragrant, about a minute. Add broccoli along with 1/4 cup water, 1/4 teaspoon salt and the red pepper flakes. Stir, cover and adjust heat to maintain a gentle simmer. Cook until broccoli breaks down easily when pressed with a spatula or wooden spoon, about 30 minutes. Off the heat, stir in lemon juice and mash to a coarse puree.
9efa2ba0-018d-4eeb-9e71-6577b5a12efc Meanwhile, preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center. Brush naan lightly with olive oil. Spread 1/4 of the ricotta on each naan. Top each naan with a scant 1/4 of the broccoli puree (use your judgment, there may be some left over), a sprinkle of the parmesan (reserve some to sprinkle when removed from oven) and 1/4 of the chopped olives.
9efa2ba0-018d-4eeb-9e71-6577b5a12efc Bake directly on the oven rack for about 10 minutes, until naan is crisp on the underside and ricotta is heated through. Sprinkle with black pepper and remaining parmesan, cut into wedges and serve.
88e37fe0-5bd8-4e3c-8a7e-6bc2796ea493 Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center.
88e37fe0-5bd8-4e3c-8a7e-6bc2796ea493 Brush olive oil over the surface of the naan. In a small bowl, stir together the tomato paste and tomato sauce. Spread sauce over naan.
88e37fe0-5bd8-4e3c-8a7e-6bc2796ea493 Sprinkle 2/3 of the pecorino over tomato sauce. Arrange mozzarella overtop.
88e37fe0-5bd8-4e3c-8a7e-6bc2796ea493 Place pizzas directly on oven rack and bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Remove from oven and sprinkle with remaining pecorino, some pepper and basil if desired. Serve immediately, cut into slices of whatever size and shape you like you like.
5d6c3983-2eef-403e-81df-e17cc6630b47 Preheat the oven to 550°F (or as high as your oven will go up to 550°F), with a pizza stone if you have one. Prepare your pizza pan or baking sheet by brushing with the olive oil and sprinkling evenly with the cornmeal. Roll or stretch the dough to cover the surface of the pan.
