5d6c3983-2eef-403e-81df-e17cc6630b47 Slice the zucchini as thinly as possible, on a mandoline if you have one or with a very sharp knife. Place zucchini slices in a bowl and toss with half the pesto. Spread the remaining pesto evenly over the dough and top with overlapping slices of zucchini. Sprinkle the feta and olives overtop. Bake until the dough is cooked through and the zucchini is tender, 8 to 15 minutes, depending on thickness. Slice and serve hot or at room temperature.
ea299416-bf6c-49d5-bb3b-da65f54d3a2c Warm the olive oil over medium heat in a 12-inch nonstick frying pan. Add the sliced onions along with a good pinch of salt.
ea299416-bf6c-49d5-bb3b-da65f54d3a2c Cook, stirring often, until the onions are soft, lightly brown, and reduced to about 1/3 of their raw volume. You may need to reduce the heat gradually as the onions shrink. This process will take about 30 minutes.
ea299416-bf6c-49d5-bb3b-da65f54d3a2c Meanwhile, in a small bowl, toss the strawberry slices with 1 teaspoon of the balsamic vinegar.
ea299416-bf6c-49d5-bb3b-da65f54d3a2c Wash the dandelion greens in several changes of water and dry thoroughly. Cut into bite-sized pieces if you like.
ea299416-bf6c-49d5-bb3b-da65f54d3a2c When the onions are nearly done, add the remaining 1 tablespoon + 2 teaspoons balsamic vinegar to the pan and continue cooking until it has thickened to coat the onions, a minute or two.
ea299416-bf6c-49d5-bb3b-da65f54d3a2c Remove the onions from the heat and stir in the Dijon mustard.
ea299416-bf6c-49d5-bb3b-da65f54d3a2c In a salad bowl, combine the greens, onions and strawberries with all their juices, scraping down the onion pan with a rubber spatula to incorporate all the oil and vinegar into the salad.
ea299416-bf6c-49d5-bb3b-da65f54d3a2c Sprinkle with salt and pepper and toss.
eb9a7a3a-9102-49b8-8ad4-51b7490f5e60 Trim the fennel: Cut a thin slice off the root end of the bulb to remove any tough, dry parts. Cut off the fronds and green stems.
eb9a7a3a-9102-49b8-8ad4-51b7490f5e60 Halve the fennel bulbs: You should now have just the white part of the fennel left. Cut each bulb in half from top to bottom.
eb9a7a3a-9102-49b8-8ad4-51b7490f5e60 Use a mandoline slicer to thinly slice each half. If you don't have a mandoline, you can use a chef's knife or the slicing disk of a food processor. Cut as thinly as possible.
eb9a7a3a-9102-49b8-8ad4-51b7490f5e60 Wash the fennel slices well and dry them well. We use a salad spinner for this.
eb9a7a3a-9102-49b8-8ad4-51b7490f5e60 Arrange the fennel on a serving plate.
eb9a7a3a-9102-49b8-8ad4-51b7490f5e60 To dress the salad, sprinkle it with the oil, caper brine, lemon juice, minced shallots, minced capers, fennel fronds, lemon zest, and salt and pepper.
c694b058-15ef-42dd-a511-552a250b0072 Drain water or oil from tuna and place into a medium mixing bowl. Break up any large pieces of tuna with a fork.
c694b058-15ef-42dd-a511-552a250b0072 Add celery, shallot, mustard, mayonnaise, salt, and pepper, along with any of the optional additions. Stir to combine well.
c694b058-15ef-42dd-a511-552a250b0072 Serve with salad or on a sandwich or tuna melt. For salads and sandwiches, I like to add a little freshly squeezed lemon juice right before serving.
77236f52-a370-43f3-8b90-69547d584fef Trim the ends off the zucchini and cut into noodles according to the instructions on your spiralizer. Line two rimmed sheet pans with thick layers of paper towels. Spread half of the zucchini noodles onto each pan and sprinkle with the salt. Cover with another thick layer of paper towels and press gently. Leave noodles to dry while you prepare the rest of the dish.
77236f52-a370-43f3-8b90-69547d584fef Warm olive oil over medium heat in a very large pan or wide, shallow pot. (A 5-quart Dutch oven, a 12-inch frying pan with high sides, or even a wok would all work well.) Add shallot, garlic, and capers, and cook, stirring frequently, for two minutes. Stir in tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, until most of them have burst.
77236f52-a370-43f3-8b90-69547d584fef While tomatoes cook, cut the kernels from the corn cobs. Add corn kernels and chickpeas to pan and cook for about two minutes, until warmed through.
77236f52-a370-43f3-8b90-69547d584fef Pat zucchini noodles dry with the paper towels and stir noodles into the vegetable mixture in the pan. (Tongs work really well if you have them.) Cook until noodles are crisp-tender, just a couple of minutes. The tomatoes and zucchini will create a bit of delicious sauciness in the bottom of the pan. Stir this to coat the noodles. Remove pan from heat and divide noodles and saucy vegetables among wide, shallow serving bowls.
77236f52-a370-43f3-8b90-69547d584fef Cut slices of Bayonne Ham into long, thin strips, about four per slice. Divide strips among serving bowls. The residual heat from the noodles will warm the ham just enough to be beautifully tender and flavorful, without cooking it.
77236f52-a370-43f3-8b90-69547d584fef Garnish each bowl with some basil, freshly ground black pepper, and grated cheese.
45aa71d6-3aeb-4a25-965b-a8f450cf7a06 Slice the goat cheese into four rounds and place them in a small, shallow bowl in a single layer. Don't worry if they're not gorgeous, since you'll be spreading them on the croutons later anyway.
45aa71d6-3aeb-4a25-965b-a8f450cf7a06 Pour 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over top and sprinkle evenly with the thyme and pepper. Ideally, you should marinate these in the fridge for a few hours, but if you don't have the time, just set it aside at room temperature while you prepare the rest of the salad.
45aa71d6-3aeb-4a25-965b-a8f450cf7a06 Preheat the oven or a toaster oven to 400°F.
45aa71d6-3aeb-4a25-965b-a8f450cf7a06 Rub the baguette slices with the cut sides of the garlic clove, and brush them with the remaining teaspoon olive oil.
45aa71d6-3aeb-4a25-965b-a8f450cf7a06 Bake in a small, shallow baking pan until lightly browned around the edges, about 5 minutes.
45aa71d6-3aeb-4a25-965b-a8f450cf7a06 Let cool slightly. Then spread each crouton with one round of goat cheese; drizzle a bit of the marinade on top. Return to oven for about 5 minutes, until goat cheese is warm.
64a40dbc-3d06-468d-b2b2-461f785beea9 Cut each slice of bacon crosswise into about eight pieces. (They'll shrink to bite-sized as they cook.) Protip: we like to cut them with kitchen shears rather than dirtying a cutting board.
64a40dbc-3d06-468d-b2b2-461f785beea9 In a 10-inch frying pan, cook bacon, stirring frequently, until just crisp.
64a40dbc-3d06-468d-b2b2-461f785beea9 While the bacon cooks, make the dressing in the bottom of a large mixing bowl. Whisk together the minced shallot, mustard, a big pinch of fine sea salt, and the olive oil.
64a40dbc-3d06-468d-b2b2-461f785beea9 When bacon is cooked, drain on paper towels. Whisk two tablespoons of the hot bacon fat into the dressing and discard the rest.
64a40dbc-3d06-468d-b2b2-461f785beea9 To poach the eggs, fill a wide sauté pan halfway with water. (A pan like this is ideal.) Add vinegar and bring water to a brisk simmer, then reduce heat so the water is virtually still. Crack each egg into a small bowl and tip carefully into the water, submerging the bowl a bit as you pour. I like to add the eggs in a clockwise circle starting near the handle so I remember in which order to remove them for even cooking. Cook undisturbed for four minutes, until whites are set and yolks are runny. Remove eggs from pan with a strainer spoon (something like this). Gently place eggs on a paper towel-lined plate and dab the tops to remove excess water. Cut away any scraggly whites if you like.
64a40dbc-3d06-468d-b2b2-461f785beea9 Tear the greens into bite-sized pieces, add to mixing bowl, and toss to coat with dressing.
64a40dbc-3d06-468d-b2b2-461f785beea9 Divide greens among four plates, top each with a poached egg, and sprinkle with some of the bacon. Serve immediately.
e0deb7f3-1fd8-4e2b-b0fd-1bd35448564a Prepare lentils according to our easy recipe for a perfect pot of lentils.
e0deb7f3-1fd8-4e2b-b0fd-1bd35448564a Trim ends from broccolini. Bring 1 inch of water and 1 teaspoon fine sea salt to a boil in a 12-inch lidded pan. Add broccolini and cook until it reaches your desired tenderness. We like it crisp-tender, about 5 minutes' cooking time. Drain.
e0deb7f3-1fd8-4e2b-b0fd-1bd35448564a Dice halloumi into 1/2-inch pieces. Heat oil in another 12-inch pan over medium heat until shimmering. (Or dry and reuse the same pan if the broccolini is done). Add halloumi and cook, turning a few times, until golden brown on several sides and warmed through.
e0deb7f3-1fd8-4e2b-b0fd-1bd35448564a Drain roasted red peppers.
e0deb7f3-1fd8-4e2b-b0fd-1bd35448564a Divide ingredients among four bowls, or let diners serve themselves, and drizzle everything with magic blender dressing.
b43053e9-c0dd-4cc8-82a6-539a775876ac Place lettuce in a wide serving bowl (or plate salads individually in wide bowls like these or these). Halve or quarter tomatoes depending on size and place in a strip across serving bowl. Quarter the hard-boiled eggs lengthwise and arrange next to tomatoes.
b43053e9-c0dd-4cc8-82a6-539a775876ac Halve, pit, and slice avocados but leave slices in shells until ready to serve.
b43053e9-c0dd-4cc8-82a6-539a775876ac Chop bacon into bite-sized pieces and place in a 10-inch nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring frequently, until browned and crisp. Remove bacon to paper towels to drain and pour off all but two tablespoons or so of the bacon fat from the pan.
b43053e9-c0dd-4cc8-82a6-539a775876ac Season chicken breasts well with salt and pepper and place in pan. Reduce heat to medium. Cook uncovered until nicely browned on the underside, about five minutes. Then flip, pour in about two tablespoons of water, and cover pan. Continue cooking until chicken breasts are just opaque all the way through.
b43053e9-c0dd-4cc8-82a6-539a775876ac Arrange bacon, avocado slices and blue cheese on salad. Dice chicken and place onto salad.
b43053e9-c0dd-4cc8-82a6-539a775876ac Sprinkle some fine sea salt over both the eggs and the avocado, and then hit the whole salad with some freshly ground black pepper and flaky sea salt. Drizzle with dressing and serve with more dressing to pass at the table.
a1dd3550-6cac-4977-a316-76953ebc1144 Heat oven to 400° F with a 12-inch cast-iron skillet (or a rimmed sheet pan) on a rack in the center. When preheated, carefully toss potato cubes with two tablespoons of the olive oil and a generous pinch of salt in the skillet. Spread potatoes evenly over the pan surface to avoid crowding. Roast for about 20 minutes, turning with a spatula halfway through, until crisp on the outside and tender on the inside. Set aside to cool.
a1dd3550-6cac-4977-a316-76953ebc1144 While potatoes roast, prepare corn (microwaving from frozen is fine!) Strip washed and dried kale from its stems and tear into small bite sized-pieces. Place in a large bowl. Pour in about 1/4 cup of dressing and, using your hands, massage dressing into kale. This process will tenderize the kale and reduce its volume by almost half. Add chickpeas and olives to the bowl.
a1dd3550-6cac-4977-a316-76953ebc1144 Place a 12-inch nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat and warm the remaining tablespoon of olive oil. Add the halloumi cubes and cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned on most sides and warmed through. Add the cheese and potatoes to the salad bowl.
a1dd3550-6cac-4977-a316-76953ebc1144 Pour a little more vinaigrette onto the salad and toss all ingredients together gently. Sprinkle on the nutritional yeast and toss once more. Serve immediately.
4325a769-dbe8-4f33-979a-fd696706c9ef Preheat oven to 375°F with a rack in the center. Cut the sweet potatoes into 1/2-inch dice. Place on a sheet pan and toss with olive oil and some salt and pepper. Roast until lightly crisp on the outside and tender on the inside, 25-30 minutes.
4325a769-dbe8-4f33-979a-fd696706c9ef Meanwhile, place freekeh in a small pot along with three cups water and a big pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, covered, for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and let rest for five minutes. Drain any remaining water.
4325a769-dbe8-4f33-979a-fd696706c9ef In a separate small pot, place lentils, herbs and a big pinch of salt. Cover with water by an inch. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, until tender, about 25 minutes. Drain remaining water.
4325a769-dbe8-4f33-979a-fd696706c9ef Strip kale from stems and break leaves into bite-sized pieces. Toss well with a few tablespoons of dressing.
4325a769-dbe8-4f33-979a-fd696706c9ef Place some kale salad into each serving bowl. Arrange sweet potatoes, freekeh and lentils on top. Drizzle with extra dressing and sprinkle with nutritional yeast if you like.
a7b9d148-6556-4721-9e55-88226f1500f3 In a large zip-top bag or a 9x12 glass baking dish, stir together the vegetable oil, lime juice, sherry vinegar, garlic, shallot, chili powder, soy sauce and salt. Place steak in bag or dish and coat well with marinade. Marinate for two hours at room temperature or 8 hours in the fridge, flipping once if possible to ensure even coverage.
a7b9d148-6556-4721-9e55-88226f1500f3 Heat a gas grill to high (the hotter the better) or prepare a charcoal grill for direct heat. Remove steak from marinade and shake off any excess liquid, then grill each side for just a few minutes, until outside is nicely seared in spots and internal temperature reaches 130°F (check with an instant-read thermometer) for medium-rare. Skirt, flatiron and flank steak are best at medium-rare.
a7b9d148-6556-4721-9e55-88226f1500f3 Remove steak to a cutting board and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes. Place baguette slices on the grill in the coolest spot and toast very briefly, flipping once, to crisp the outside and get some grill marks. Set aside.
a7b9d148-6556-4721-9e55-88226f1500f3 Arrange some greens, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion and avocado in each of four bowls. Slice the steak thinly against the grain and top each bowl with a generous serving. Drizzle salads with olive oil and balsamic glaze. Sprinkle with flaky salt and pepper and serve.
5a2301d1-cc44-4dc6-a729-d8608d113383 Hard boil the eggs, peel when cool enough to handle, and set aside. You can do this well in advance if you like.
5a2301d1-cc44-4dc6-a729-d8608d113383 Preheat grill to high (about 400-500°F). Place the salmon skin-side down on a double layer of aluminum foil. Sprinkle generously with salt and pepper and lay the lemon slices over the flesh. Grill salmon until done to your liking, about 8-10 minutes for just barely opaque in the center, depending on thickness. Place salmon in the center of a large serving platter with the lemon slices off to the side.
5a2301d1-cc44-4dc6-a729-d8608d113383 Rub asparagus with two tablespoons of the olive oil, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and grill until nicely charred, 2-3 minutes per side, flipping once. Add asparagus to platter.
5a2301d1-cc44-4dc6-a729-d8608d113383 Trim tough ends from green beans and boil or steam until crisp-tender. If you like, plunge into a large bowl of ice water to stop cooking and preserve bright green color.
5a2301d1-cc44-4dc6-a729-d8608d113383 In a small bowl, combine the remaining olive oil, vinegar, mustard and plenty of salt and pepper. Whisk to emulsify.
5a2301d1-cc44-4dc6-a729-d8608d113383 Add arugula and olives to platter. Halve hard-boiled eggs lengthwise and add them to the platter too.
5a2301d1-cc44-4dc6-a729-d8608d113383 Sprinkle everything with a bit of flaky sea salt. Serve with dressing.
67a18423-31ac-46ff-adc9-5d9b3703e2d1 In a medium bowl, stir together the beans, celery, shallot, olives and parsley.
67a18423-31ac-46ff-adc9-5d9b3703e2d1 Add the oil, vinegar, lemon juice and zest, paprika if using, and salt and pepper.
67a18423-31ac-46ff-adc9-5d9b3703e2d1 Stir to combine well.
67a18423-31ac-46ff-adc9-5d9b3703e2d1 Serve at room temperature.
4cd0dee4-171a-4f92-abfc-843df02f3367 Place the chickpeas in a large bowl.
4cd0dee4-171a-4f92-abfc-843df02f3367 In a small skillet, heat the oil until shimmering.
4cd0dee4-171a-4f92-abfc-843df02f3367 Add the mustard seeds, partially cover the skillet and cook over medium-high heat until the mustard seeds almost stop popping, about a minute.
4cd0dee4-171a-4f92-abfc-843df02f3367 Add the cumin and fennel seeds and cook for another minute.
4cd0dee4-171a-4f92-abfc-843df02f3367 Pour the hot oil and spices over the chickpeas.
4cd0dee4-171a-4f92-abfc-843df02f3367 Stir in the yogurt, lemon zest and juice, scallions, cilantro and salt. Serve at room temperature.
6dfb1274-0a87-46a0-b37c-48faa31377dd Preheat oven to 425°F with a rack in the center.
6dfb1274-0a87-46a0-b37c-48faa31377dd Toss the cauliflower florets and the chickpeas with the olive oil on a rimmed baking sheet. Sprinkle generously with salt and pepper.
6dfb1274-0a87-46a0-b37c-48faa31377dd Roast, turning once halfway through, until the cauliflower is tender and browned in spots, about 35 minutes.
6dfb1274-0a87-46a0-b37c-48faa31377dd Meanwhile, combine the sour cream, mayonnaise, vinegar, and blue cheese in a small bowl. Stir all ingredients together with a fork, breaking up any large chunks of blue cheese as you go.
6dfb1274-0a87-46a0-b37c-48faa31377dd Mix together the melted butter and Frank's Red Hot in a small bowl.
6dfb1274-0a87-46a0-b37c-48faa31377dd Pour over the cauliflower and chickpeas and toss to combine. Serve immediately, either on a platter with the dressing on the side or tossed with the greens and tomatoes.
afb9c24e-11f2-4e41-81c4-3016c1282dc2 Fit a standard 12-cup food processor with the slicing disk. Feed Brussels sprouts through the feed tube to slice. Place sliced sprouts into a salad bowl.
afb9c24e-11f2-4e41-81c4-3016c1282dc2 Place pine nuts in a small, dry pan over medium heat. Cook for a few minutes, tossing once or twice, until fragrant and lightly browned. Add to salad bowl along with cheese, capers, pepper and dressing. Toss well and serve.
0304e192-764b-4ef2-b0a2-3098178dac79 Dry tofu well between several layers of paper towels. Cut into approximate 1/2-inch cubes and dry again. Place in a mixing bowl and sprinkle with cornstarch, salt and pepper. Toss gently to coat evenly.
0304e192-764b-4ef2-b0a2-3098178dac79 Warm 2 tablespoons of the oil over medium-high heat in a 12-inch nonstick skillet. Add tofu in a single layer and cook until golden brown on the bottom, then stir once in a while and continue cooking until most sides are golden. This will take about 10 minutes total. Slide tofu out onto a plate.
0304e192-764b-4ef2-b0a2-3098178dac79 In the same pan, heat the remaining tablespoon oil. Add bell pepper and mushrooms and cook for a few minutes, stirring only occasionally, until mushrooms have browned in spots and peppers are slightly tender. Add cabbage, tamari and vinegar and cook, stirring, until cabbage is tender and reduced in volume by at least half, which will take only a couple of minutes.
0304e192-764b-4ef2-b0a2-3098178dac79 There will be some tasty liquid at the bottom of the pan. Depending on your sauce preferences, you can remove the vegetables from the skillet with tongs or a strainer to avoid the liquid, go with the flow and serve it as-is, or remove the vegetables and then simmer the liquid down into a thicker sauce. (The cornstarch from the tofu will aid this process.)
0304e192-764b-4ef2-b0a2-3098178dac79 Place vegetables on serving plates (alongside rice or other grains if you like) and top with reserved tofu. Sprinkle with chili sesame oil and cilantro as well as sauce if you like. Serve immediately.
07ec13fe-1bdb-4301-9eee-e7ea57087741 Combine rice, water and salt in a medium pot. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer until tender but still nice and chewy, usually 30 to 40 minutes. (Check package instructions for timing, since brands may vary.) When possible, I like to do this a little bit ahead of time and leave the covered pot sitting on a cold stove for a while after cooking, since the rice steams a little more. It's totally not necessary though.
07ec13fe-1bdb-4301-9eee-e7ea57087741 Warm the oil over medium-high heat in a 12-inch nonstick skillet. Drain, rinse and pat dry chickpeas with paper towels. Add chickpeas to skillet in a single layer and leave undisturbed for a few minutes to brown. Toss once or twice and repeat to brown on another other side or two. Reduce heat to medium, sprinkle with onion powder, garlic powder and dill, and cook, stirring occasionally, for a few minutes more.
07ec13fe-1bdb-4301-9eee-e7ea57087741 Remove and discard kale stems and tear leaves into bite-sized pieces. In a large bowl, combine kale and about three tablespoons of the dressing. Toss well or massage dressing into kale with your hands (I like this method).
07ec13fe-1bdb-4301-9eee-e7ea57087741 For each serving, arrange some kale salad, rice, chickpeas, peppers, cucumbers, snow or snap peas and avocado (if using) in little piles in a nice big bowl. Drizzle with dressing, sprinkle with pepitas, and serve. The bowls are great with warm rice and chickpeas but equally good at room temperature.
18ade029-174d-4b9e-9e3c-51b835112e88 Arrange the zoodles on a double layer of paper towels. Sprinkle with a little bit of salt. Cover with a double layer of paper towels and press gently. Leave while you make the sauce.
18ade029-174d-4b9e-9e3c-51b835112e88 In a 12-inch frying pan, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion, garlic and turkey and sprinkle with 1 teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring from time to time to break up the meat into bite-sized pieces, until turkey is cooked through and nicely browned in spots, about five minutes.
18ade029-174d-4b9e-9e3c-51b835112e88 Add tomatoes, fennel, basil, thyme, oregano and red pepper flakes to pan and stir to incorporate. Reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes, until nice and thick.
18ade029-174d-4b9e-9e3c-51b835112e88 When ready to serve, give the zoodles a gentle squeeze between paper towels to remove as much moisture as possible. Warm the remaining teaspoon olive oil in a second frying pan. Add zoodles to frying pan and cook, tossing with tongs or a rubber spatula, for about a minute. They should retain a nice bite but not look raw.
18ade029-174d-4b9e-9e3c-51b835112e88 Divide zoodles among four bowls and top with sauce. Garnish with pepper, cheese and parsley, and serve.
7b3731d4-7ffb-4e41-91e3-5a50fb5feb9a Arrange the zoodles on a thick layer of paper towels. Sprinkle with a little bit of salt. Cover with another thick layer of paper towels and press gently. Leave while you make the sauce, longer if possible (20 minutes or so is ideal).
7b3731d4-7ffb-4e41-91e3-5a50fb5feb9a In a 12-inch frying pan, warm the butter and olive oil over medium-high heat. When butter melts, add shallot, garlic and capers and cook, stirring from time to time, until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
7b3731d4-7ffb-4e41-91e3-5a50fb5feb9a When ready to serve, roll up the paper towels and give the zoodles a squeeze to remove as much moisture as possible. Add zoodles to frying pan and cook, tossing with tongs or a rubber spatula, for about a minute. They should retain a nice bite but not look raw. Turn off the heat and stir in the lemon juice, parsley and some pepper.
7b3731d4-7ffb-4e41-91e3-5a50fb5feb9a Divide among four bowls, sprinkle with cheese, and serve.
66b0135d-041d-4200-aad7-43af241051e3 Quarter and core the radicchio. Cut each quarter into long, thin shreds. Place in a large mixing bowl and if you're plating individual salads, toss with 1 teaspoon each olive oil and balsamic vinegar and a nice pinch of salt. Divide among four serving plates.
66b0135d-041d-4200-aad7-43af241051e3 Wash, trim and peel the beets. Slice them as thin as possible, then stack the slices and cut in half to make half-moons. A mandoline is great to use here if you have one. Place in the same large bowl and toss with another teaspoon each of oil and vinegar and a sprinkle of salt. Divide dressed slices among the serving plates and arrange as you like. Slice the avocado, squeeze lime juice overtop and arrange a few slices on each plate.
66b0135d-041d-4200-aad7-43af241051e3 Slice the red onion as thin as you can and toss with remainder of vinegar. Sprinkle some onion slices over each plate. Slice the celery stalk into thin half-moons and divide among plates. Sprinkle walnuts over salads, along with feta if using.
66b0135d-041d-4200-aad7-43af241051e3 Drizzle balsamic glaze over each salad along with the remaining teaspoon of olive oil. Sprinkle with flaky salt and pepper.
48eba73b-4d4f-455b-967d-a8d64d94cd53 Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center.
48eba73b-4d4f-455b-967d-a8d64d94cd53 Cut the squash into 1/4-inch thick rings (remove seedy centers with a biscuit cutter) or half-rings (halve squash first from stem to bottom and scoop out seeds with a spoon). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, arrange squash slices on parchment, and brush tops with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast until lightly browned and tender, about 25 minutes total. Flip slices with a spatula halfway through.
48eba73b-4d4f-455b-967d-a8d64d94cd53 Strip the kale leaves from their stems and discard stems. Tear leaves into bite-sized pieces. Wash and dry thoroughly and place in a large salad bowl along with the onion and cabbage. Add two tablespoons olive oil, the cider vinegar and a good sprinkle of salt and pepper. Use your hands to massage the dressing into the veggies. This will ensure the kale and cabbage are nice and tender and the onions surrender a bit of their bite. Let sit while you prepare the rest of the salad.
48eba73b-4d4f-455b-967d-a8d64d94cd53 Set a small pan over medium heat and add walnuts and sugar. Keep a close eye on the pan as you cook, stirring occasionally at first and more frequently as you go along, to melt the sugar onto the nuts and lightly toast the nuts. Stop when nuts are nicely toasted, even if there's still some unmelted sugar. They'll be delicious either way.
48eba73b-4d4f-455b-967d-a8d64d94cd53 To serve the salad, gently toss in most of the walnuts and pomegranate arils. Arrange the squash slices overtop and sprinkle with a few more nuts and arils.
2f975115-631c-4c50-afb3-33b6e492e434 Cook the broccoli in the microwave according to package directions. To save time, you can use a bowl large enough to accommodate the broccoli and the corn and add the corn when the correct amount of cooking time remains. Drain vegetables and place in separate bowls.
2f975115-631c-4c50-afb3-33b6e492e434 While the vegetables cook, combine the shallot, vinegar, oil, mustard and salt in a small jar and shake to emulsify (or whisk together in a small bowl).
2f975115-631c-4c50-afb3-33b6e492e434 We like to put all the ingredients in separate small serving bowls in the middle of the table, stick a spoon or fork in each, and let everyone assemble their own dinner. You could assemble each person's serving beforehand if it's easier to manage -- just arrange a bit of everything in its own little pile in each bowl.
2c385179-e57d-452f-8ace-19d59e0d3e65 Rinse the rice under running water until some of the milkiness of the runoff subsides. Place rice in a medium pot along with 2 1/2 cups cold water. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a simmer. Cook for about 20 minutes, until water is absorbed. Remove from heat and let rest for a few minutes, then stir in seasoned rice vinegar.
2c385179-e57d-452f-8ace-19d59e0d3e65 Meanwhile, dry the tofu with paper towels and cut into 1/2-inch cubes. Place in a bowl or large resealable plastic bag. Sprinkle with cornstarch, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper and toss to coat well. In a large nonstick frying pan, warm the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add tofu and cook until golden on one side, then flip and continue to cook until golden and crispy on most sides. This will take about 10 minutes total. Drain on paper towels.
2c385179-e57d-452f-8ace-19d59e0d3e65 Place the edamame, avocado, cucumber, pomegranate seeds and nori into small serving bowls on the table along with gomasio and dressing.
2c385179-e57d-452f-8ace-19d59e0d3e65 To serve, give each person a bowl with some rice in it and let them arrange the rest of the ingredients on top as they like. Alternatively, you can pre-make each bowl if, let's say, you don't trust your kids to choose vegetables.
84234238-83f7-4689-b8c6-8d52122898ca We like to put all the ingredients in separate bowls in the middle of the table, stick a spoon or fork in each, and let everyone assemble their own taco bowl. You could make the bowls before serving if it's easier to manage -- just arrange a bit of everything in its own little pile in each bowl.
6a518ac4-aee3-49a7-a961-4cfc2af280d0 Shuck the corn and cut the kernels off the cobs. Reserve the cobs to make soup (recipe coming soon).
6a518ac4-aee3-49a7-a961-4cfc2af280d0 Heat the oil over medium-high heat in a cast iron or other heavy skillet. When it shimmers, add the corn kernels and let sit for a few minutes to start browning. Stir and let sit again. Repeat this process until there is nice browning in lots of spots, 10 to 15 minutes total.
6a518ac4-aee3-49a7-a961-4cfc2af280d0 Add the minced garlic to the skillet and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds. Remove from heat and let cool for at least 10 minutes, until just warm. (Place in a bowl if you like to speed cooling.)
6a518ac4-aee3-49a7-a961-4cfc2af280d0 In a small bowl, mix together the mayonnaise, chili powder, and some salt and pepper. Stir into the corn. Add the scallions, cilantro, lime juice and cotija and toss. Taste for seasoning and add more of anything you like. Salud!
f4671b99-58d9-4e85-bd26-1e9be9752d8f Cut the heirloom tomatoes and nectarines into wedges and halve the cherry tomatoes. Distribute among four plates or arrange on a single platter for sharing.
f4671b99-58d9-4e85-bd26-1e9be9752d8f Tear the burrata into pieces and scatter over the salads, or place the whole ball in the middle of the platter and dig into it with a serving spoon if you like.
f4671b99-58d9-4e85-bd26-1e9be9752d8f Garnish with basil leaves, a drizzle of olive oil and balsamic and some flaky sea salt. Serve immediately.
c00d5755-3b9f-4566-9b3d-dd59eaea5278 Remove the tough outer leaves from the cabbage.
c00d5755-3b9f-4566-9b3d-dd59eaea5278 Cut the head into quarters and remove the core from each piece.
c00d5755-3b9f-4566-9b3d-dd59eaea5278 Using a sharp chef's knife or a mandoline, slice the cabbage into long, thin shreds and place in a large bowl.
c00d5755-3b9f-4566-9b3d-dd59eaea5278 Slice the onion as thinly as possible and add to the bowl.
c00d5755-3b9f-4566-9b3d-dd59eaea5278 Pour the vinegar and oil overtop and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
c00d5755-3b9f-4566-9b3d-dd59eaea5278 Toss together (hands work just fine!) until well combined.
c00d5755-3b9f-4566-9b3d-dd59eaea5278 Taste for seasoning, adjust as you like, and serve. It's great right away and also good the next day.
35043c57-6586-472d-ba7f-f1be1dd38ec7 Tear the kale leaves from their stems and break into bite-sized pieces. Wash and dry thoroughly. (Discard stems or save for juicing or pesto.)
35043c57-6586-472d-ba7f-f1be1dd38ec7 Sprinkle the oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper over the kale and use your hands to massage the dressing into the leaves. Do this however you like -- you really can't go wrong. In a minute or two, you'll have a tender, delicious salad.
35043c57-6586-472d-ba7f-f1be1dd38ec7 If you like, sprinkle with a generous amount of nutritional yeast for a pop of umami that beautifully complements the earthy kale, fruity olive oil and tangy lemon juice.
65d52876-608f-4afb-a38b-2bcbf42fed71 Assemble all salad ingredients in a large bowl.
65d52876-608f-4afb-a38b-2bcbf42fed71 Whisk the dressing ingredients together in a small bowl.
65d52876-608f-4afb-a38b-2bcbf42fed71 Pour the dressing over the salad and give it a gentle toss.
65d52876-608f-4afb-a38b-2bcbf42fed71 Serve right away with some good bread.
59b24ea2-01b2-4894-904a-32644e02e43a Steam the cauliflower until crisp-tender and place in a large bowl.
59b24ea2-01b2-4894-904a-32644e02e43a In a small pot, combine lentils, stock, herbes de Provence and a generous pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer until liquid is almost absorbed and lentils are barely tender, about 20 minutes. Let rest, covered, for 10 minutes more.
59b24ea2-01b2-4894-904a-32644e02e43a Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until it shimmers. Add the onion along with a generous sprinkle of salt and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and browned in spots. Add garlic and capers and cook until very fragrant. Stir in cooked quinoa and heat through.
59b24ea2-01b2-4894-904a-32644e02e43a Tip lentils and onion mixture into the bowl with the cauliflower. Sprinkle with the lemon juice, walnuts and pepper and toss gently to combine. Serve warm, with Pecorino to pass if desired.
f3eb2045-4ae7-4bef-b844-5f999f2bda7e Rinse the quinoa very well, then place in a medium lidded pot with 1 1/2 cups water.
f3eb2045-4ae7-4bef-b844-5f999f2bda7e Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to maintain a gentle simmer.
f3eb2045-4ae7-4bef-b844-5f999f2bda7e Simmer for 15 minutes or until nearly all the water is absorbed.
f3eb2045-4ae7-4bef-b844-5f999f2bda7e Remove from heat and keep in covered pot to steam for 5 minutes, until all water is absorbed.
f3eb2045-4ae7-4bef-b844-5f999f2bda7e While the quinoa cooks, chop the vegetables and set aside.
f3eb2045-4ae7-4bef-b844-5f999f2bda7e In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar, soy sauce, mirin, and sesame oil with a fork.
f3eb2045-4ae7-4bef-b844-5f999f2bda7e Spoon the quinoa into a serving bowl while still warm and mix together thoroughly with the dressing.
f3eb2045-4ae7-4bef-b844-5f999f2bda7e After it cools a bit, stir in the chopped vegetables.
f3eb2045-4ae7-4bef-b844-5f999f2bda7e Serve cold or at room temperature.
fa8a3736-8695-4aee-990a-3fa6a32354a8 If using canned chickpeas, drain, rinse, and dry them thoroughly. In a large bowl, combine the chickpeas, shallots, and cilantro.
fa8a3736-8695-4aee-990a-3fa6a32354a8 In a small pan, toast the sesame and cumin seeds over medium-low heat until the sesame seeds begin to turn golden brown and the seeds are very fragrant. Add the warm seeds to the bowl.
fa8a3736-8695-4aee-990a-3fa6a32354a8 In a blender, combine the lemon juice and zest, olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper. Blend until smooth.
fa8a3736-8695-4aee-990a-3fa6a32354a8 Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine well. Serve immediately or store in the fridge for up to three days.
56888d12-3a6e-466a-b085-68a7335ca9e2 Preheat the oven to 450°F. Cut the squash into quarters. Scoop out and discard the seeds and stringy pulp. Cut each squash quarter into 1/4-inch-thick wedges. Place squash wedges on a baking sheet and toss with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt. Spread the wedges in a single layer in the pan. Roast for about 30 minutes, until tender and slightly browned. Set aside to cool slightly. (Alternatively, if you have a convection oven, it's great to use here, at 400°F.)
56888d12-3a6e-466a-b085-68a7335ca9e2 Meanwhile, place the quinoa in a 4-quart pot over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring, until lightly toasted, about two minutes. Add 2 cups of water and bring to a boil over high heat. Simmer, uncovered, until quinoa turns translucent and water is almost absorbed, about 10 minutes. Then stir in the baby spinach all at once, place a lid on the pot, and cook over low heat for 5 minutes more.
56888d12-3a6e-466a-b085-68a7335ca9e2 To make the dressing, whisk together the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil, the lime zest and juice, the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
56888d12-3a6e-466a-b085-68a7335ca9e2 In a large bowl, place the roasted squash, quinoa-spinach mixture, chopped cilantro, and pumpkin seeds. Drizzle with the dressing and toss gently to coat. Serve warm or at room temperature. Keeps well in the fridge for up to three days.
13a1f920-e31b-4317-aeec-9ef50c0bec41 Bring two cups of water to a boil in a small pot. Add the rice and 1/4 teaspoon salt, cover, and cook at a gentle simmer for 40 minutes or until water is absorbed. Cool slightly.
13a1f920-e31b-4317-aeec-9ef50c0bec41 Meanwhile, preheat oven to 375°F with a rack in the middle. On a large rimmed baking sheet, place the diced eggplant, onion, and garlic. Sprinkle with two Tablespoons of the olive oil, the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, and the pepper. Roast for about 30 minutes, until tender.
13a1f920-e31b-4317-aeec-9ef50c0bec41 Pour the rice, roasted eggplant mixture, olives, feta (if using), basil, and chickpeas (if using) into a large bowl. Sprinkle with the lemon juice and toss gently to combine. Serve warm or at room temperature.
203c24a3-52d5-4473-b66e-73044012cad7 Wash the greens in several changes of water and dry thoroughly. Strip the greens from their stems and tear into large bite-size pieces. If the stems are tender (yes for beets, chard, dandelion, mustard / no for kale and collards), chop them into 1-inch segments.
203c24a3-52d5-4473-b66e-73044012cad7 Start with a skillet that is wide enough to embarrass you at the thought of using it to cook lunch for one. Heat it on the stovetop over medium-high heat. Chop the bacon into 1-inch pieces and add to the heated skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the bacon is just shy of as crisp as you would like it and has given off plenty of fat. If there is more than 1 to 2 tablespoons of fat in the pan, remove the rest.
203c24a3-52d5-4473-b66e-73044012cad7 If you will be cooking your stems, add them to the skillet now, along with the garlic. If not, just add the garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, for two minutes.
203c24a3-52d5-4473-b66e-73044012cad7 Add the greens to the skillet and stir (preferably with tongs) to coat all the greens with a bit of bacon fat. For relatively tender greens (all but collards and kale): Cook uncovered until the greens are just shy of desired tenderness. Add the cider vinegar and cook for one minute more. For collards and kale: Cook uncovered for a few minutes, then add the stock or water and cider vinegar. Cover, lower the heat to maintain a simmer, and cook to desired tenderness, probably about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
203c24a3-52d5-4473-b66e-73044012cad7 Place the greens in a bowl, crumble the feta cheese overtop, and serve.
c3e81821-5a20-4817-a50d-f65709384d28 In a large bowl, whisk together the garlic paste, lime zest and juice, orange juice, cumin, Sriracha, and olive oil.
c3e81821-5a20-4817-a50d-f65709384d28 Add the corn, bell pepper, beans, jicama, avocado, scallions, and cilantro, and toss gently to combine.
c3e81821-5a20-4817-a50d-f65709384d28 Taste for seasoning and add additional salt, pepper, and Sriracha to taste.
c3e81821-5a20-4817-a50d-f65709384d28 Serve as a light meal or a side dish.
0f8ab2a8-ce59-424d-a3aa-491e3e310ee4 Preheat the oven or toaster oven to 400° F. Drizzle one tablespoon of the olive oil over the breadcrumbs and toss, kneading slightly with your fingers, to distribute. Spread the breadcrumbs on a sheet pan or toaster oven pan and bake for 6 minutes (or a bit longer in the toaster oven) or until golden in spots, tossing once or twice if necessary. Cool completely.
0f8ab2a8-ce59-424d-a3aa-491e3e310ee4 In a small bowl, combine the remaining olive oil, vinegar, anchovies, shallot, and salt and pepper to taste.
0f8ab2a8-ce59-424d-a3aa-491e3e310ee4 Remove any wilted outer leaves from the radicchio. Wash, dry, quarter and core each head. Slice each quarter crosswise into 1/8-inch slices. Place in a salad bowl, tossing to separate slices. Toss in the breadcrumbs. Drizzle the vinaigrette over the salad and toss.
0f8ab2a8-ce59-424d-a3aa-491e3e310ee4 Either grate the egg on the finest holes of a box grater or press it through a mesh sieve. Toss gently into the salad. Taste and adjust seasonings if necessary. Serve immediately.
4925fd66-f7c1-4f30-8eb2-532a4ac4370c Wash kohlrabi well, trim ends, and peel thickly with a paring knife. Using the julienne blade of a mandoline or the large holes on a box grater, cut or shred the kohlrabi.
4925fd66-f7c1-4f30-8eb2-532a4ac4370c Crush the garlic with the side of a chef's knife, remove the skin, and sprinkle with the salt. Smash the garlic and salt to a paste with the knife.
4925fd66-f7c1-4f30-8eb2-532a4ac4370c In a medium bowl, combine the mayonnaise, mustards, lemon juice, vinegar, garlic paste, tarragon and pepper. Whisk with a fork to combine. Add the julienned kohlrabi to the bowl and toss. Serve cold or at room temperature as an accompaniment to grilled fish, shellfish or meat.
3b38d247-0f35-4fc6-a80f-8e0b19dee0c1 Trim and peel the beets. Cut beets and onion on the julienne blade of a mandoline slicer, or grate them on a box grater if you don't have a mandoline.
3b38d247-0f35-4fc6-a80f-8e0b19dee0c1 In a small, dry frying pan, toast the walnuts over medium heat for a few minutes, tossing occasionally, until fragrant and lightly browned in spots.
3b38d247-0f35-4fc6-a80f-8e0b19dee0c1 Place beets, onion, walnuts, and orange zest in a medium mixing bowl. Add the oil, vinegar, orange juice, mustard, salt, and pepper, and toss to combine.
3b38d247-0f35-4fc6-a80f-8e0b19dee0c1 Plate salad in a large serving bowl or individual bowls and top with crumbled goat cheese and microgreens.
52d531c3-fa90-4209-b4e0-b42c594c5eac Cut the bacon slices in half and place in a cold frying pan. Set over medium heat and cook, turning occasionally, until crisped to your liking. Drain on paper towels.
52d531c3-fa90-4209-b4e0-b42c594c5eac If you like, lightly toast the bread.
52d531c3-fa90-4209-b4e0-b42c594c5eac Layer the turkey slices onto one slice of the bread. Top with an even layer of bacon.
52d531c3-fa90-4209-b4e0-b42c594c5eac Onto the other slice of bread, spread the mayo and then the sriracha. Sprinkle with scallions. Layer on the avocado slices. Sprinkle the avocado with the salt and pepper.
52d531c3-fa90-4209-b4e0-b42c594c5eac Close the sandwich by tipping the avocado-topped slice of bread onto the turkey-topped slice. Cut in half and serve right away.
31fec2a2-75bb-471c-9a47-087d0596edd3 In a 9x13-inch baking dish or other large, shallow dish, whisk together the marinade ingredients: olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, dill, oregano, and pepper.
31fec2a2-75bb-471c-9a47-087d0596edd3 Cut each chicken breast in half across the middle and pound with a mallet if necessary to make each piece about an inch thick and a little bigger than a hamburger bun. Or, if using chicken tenders, see prep note below.
31fec2a2-75bb-471c-9a47-087d0596edd3 Place chicken pieces into the dish with the marinade and coat well., Leave to marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes or in the fridge for anywhere between 2 and 24 hours.
31fec2a2-75bb-471c-9a47-087d0596edd3 Cut bell peppers in half from stem end to tip and remove stems, ribs and seeds. Cut a slit of about an inch at both the top and bottom of each pepper half to help it relax into a flatter shape as it grills.
31fec2a2-75bb-471c-9a47-087d0596edd3 Cut halloumi into four slices, not super-thin or they might get too floppy on the grill.
4db75faf-0a10-48b8-a098-46a1cc16996a Prep the collard greens. Cut off the part of the stem that extends below the leaf. Then shave down the remaining thick stem with a knife so that it's not much thicker than the leaf.
4db75faf-0a10-48b8-a098-46a1cc16996a Blanch the greens: Fill a large pot halfway with water and bring it to a boil. Meanwhile, fill a large bowl halfway with ice and cold water. Add the collard greens to the pot and cook for one minute. Then immediately plunge into the ice water. When cold, remove and dry very well.
4db75faf-0a10-48b8-a098-46a1cc16996a Place leaves front-side-down on a work surface. (You'll fill the back side of the leaf.)
4db75faf-0a10-48b8-a098-46a1cc16996a On the bottom third of the leaf, centered from left to right, place about two tablespoons of hummus. Layer on the other ingredients, dividing equally among leaves. Be judicious with toppings, otherwise the leaves will be too hard to roll.
4db75faf-0a10-48b8-a098-46a1cc16996a To fold, see the detailed instructions in the post and video. Fold up the bottom over the fillings. Then fold in the left side and the right side. Then roll the leaf away from you.
4db75faf-0a10-48b8-a098-46a1cc16996a Cut in half crosswise and serve.
5784d089-b8fb-45fb-9c97-98fc4b8a07b9 Prepare a batch of sushi rice and let it cool to body temperature (or room temperature if you prefer) while you prepare the fillings.
56b79da2-bb01-48ad-8f26-00f390763df2 Using a mallet or rolling pin, pound chicken breast until it's about 1/4-inch thick.
56b79da2-bb01-48ad-8f26-00f390763df2 Heat a cast-iron skillet or a grill to medium-high. Slice the baguette in half lengthwise. Cook cut sides of bread until nicely charred, then flip bread and cook a minute or two more to warm through. Place on a plate.
56b79da2-bb01-48ad-8f26-00f390763df2 Pour one tablespoon of the oil into the pan or use it to coat the chicken breast if grilling. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Cook, flipping once, until nicely browned and just cooked through, 2-3 minutes per side depending on thickness and cooking method.
56b79da2-bb01-48ad-8f26-00f390763df2 Drizzle remaining oil and balsamic vinegar onto both cut sides of the bread.
56b79da2-bb01-48ad-8f26-00f390763df2 Onto the bottom piece of bread, layer the chicken, mozzarella, tomatoes (and a pinch of salt), prosciutto if using, and basil.
56b79da2-bb01-48ad-8f26-00f390763df2 Top with other half of bread and serve.
08e605ec-139d-484b-bdeb-1458816cb3ab In a small mixing bowl, use a fork to mix together the gruyere, cheddar, pecorino or parmesan, salt and pepper, and caramelized onions. You can gently tease the onions apart with the fork to make sure everything is mixed well.
08e605ec-139d-484b-bdeb-1458816cb3ab Spread the mustard onto the inside faces of the bread slices.
08e605ec-139d-484b-bdeb-1458816cb3ab Spread the cheese and onion mixture evenly onto one slice of bread and top with the other slice.
08e605ec-139d-484b-bdeb-1458816cb3ab In a small frying pan, melt the butter over medium heat.
08e605ec-139d-484b-bdeb-1458816cb3ab Place the sandwich into the pan and let the bottom slice of bread soak up some of the melted butter. Then carefully flip the sandwich and swipe it around the pan to mop up the remaining melted butter.
08e605ec-139d-484b-bdeb-1458816cb3ab From this point on, the name of the game is to regulate the heat so that the cheese mixture melts in the same timeframe that the bread becomes golden-brown. You'll have to use your judgment based on your own stovetop and pan, but this typically means keeping the burner on a medium-low setting.
08e605ec-139d-484b-bdeb-1458816cb3ab From time to time, use your spatula to press down on the grilled cheese to make sure it's melting and browning evenly. During cooking (which should take a total of about five minutes), flip the sandwich at least once more to brown the top side. You're welcome to flip it more if it helps you achieve even melting and browning, but it shouldn't really be necessary. Toward the end of cooking, you can lower the heat and place a lid on the pan to aid in melting if you like. Don't leave it on for more than a minute or so, to ensure that the bread remains crisp and doesn't steam.
08e605ec-139d-484b-bdeb-1458816cb3ab When cheese is melted and bread is golden-brown, remove the grilled cheese to a cutting board or plate, cut in half and serve.
413bd789-9f89-4187-938a-0f11cc3b212f Preheat the oven to 450° F with two racks close to the middle.
413bd789-9f89-4187-938a-0f11cc3b212f Slice the eggplants 1/4-inch thick. Spray a baking sheet generously with cooking spray and arrange the eggplant slices in a single layer. Spray tops of slices with cooking spray, sprinkle generously with salt, and place in preheated oven. Bake for 30 minutes, flipping the slices at the halfway point.
413bd789-9f89-4187-938a-0f11cc3b212f While the eggplant begins to bake, prepare the portobellos. Remove stems and, using a small spoon, scrape the gills off the underside of the mushroom caps. Slice caps 1/4-inch thick. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, smoked paprika, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. On a second baking sheet, toss the portobello slices with the dressing. Arrange in a single layer and add to oven. Bake for 20 minutes.
413bd789-9f89-4187-938a-0f11cc3b212f Cut across the beltline of the boule and remove the top half. Use your hands to tear most of the soft insides out of both halves of the bread, leaving about 1/2 inch barrier before the crust. (Tear the soft parts into small chunks and freeze for use later as fresh breadcrumbs -- just give them a whirl in the food processor when you need them.) Spread the olive tapenade inside the bottom half of the bread and the pesto inside the top half. Spread giardiniera in a thick layer on top of pesto.
413bd789-9f89-4187-938a-0f11cc3b212f Arrange the portobello pieces in a compact layer on the bottom of the bread. Layer on the roasted peppers, eggplant, and cheese. Replace the top half of the bread and press down firmly a few times to make it nice and compact. Let sit for at least an hour, or wrap and store for up to 12 hours if desired, then slice into wedges and serve.
fbb66d10-558b-42ef-9149-2601c3b65e2d Sprinkle the flour onto a plate and dredge each crab lightly in the flour.
fbb66d10-558b-42ef-9149-2601c3b65e2d Heat butter and oil in a heavy 12-inch skillet over medium heat.
fbb66d10-558b-42ef-9149-2601c3b65e2d Add the crabs belly up in a single layer. Cook for four minutes on the first side, then flip and cook for three minutes on the other side.
fbb66d10-558b-42ef-9149-2601c3b65e2d Lightly toast brioche buns. I like to do this in the toaster oven, but you could do it right in the pan after removing the crabs if you like.
fbb66d10-558b-42ef-9149-2601c3b65e2d Spread some Kewpie mayo (or regular mayo if you insist) onto the inside of the top bun. Layer tomato, soft shell crab, and lettuce onto bottom bun.
fbb66d10-558b-42ef-9149-2601c3b65e2d Close sandwich and serve.
68a1fdfb-96af-4c63-8d23-baf58441305c You guys know how to make a sandwich, but I'll tell you anyway, okay?
68a1fdfb-96af-4c63-8d23-baf58441305c Spread some of the bean dip onto each slice of bread, reserving the rest for another use. I like to put most of it on the bottom slice and just enough on the top slice to give everything a fighting chance of sticking together.
68a1fdfb-96af-4c63-8d23-baf58441305c Evenly layer the vegetables onto one of the slices in the order listed.
68a1fdfb-96af-4c63-8d23-baf58441305c Top with the other slice of bread and press gently.
68a1fdfb-96af-4c63-8d23-baf58441305c Slice in half if you like and serve immediately.
81431253-d426-40f6-a5ac-aea4944c751b Split each roll lengthwise, leaving attached at the bottom.
81431253-d426-40f6-a5ac-aea4944c751b In a small bowl, stir together mayonnaise, minced pickle, lemon juice and black pepper.
81431253-d426-40f6-a5ac-aea4944c751b Spread sauce over inside bun faces.
81431253-d426-40f6-a5ac-aea4944c751b Place three warm baked chicken tenders in each roll and top with lettuce and hot sauce.
81431253-d426-40f6-a5ac-aea4944c751b Serve right away.
bf6d2fda-9b90-44e3-a946-1413c30be3d5 Cut each roll in half and butter the halves.
bf6d2fda-9b90-44e3-a946-1413c30be3d5 Lay a slice of prosciutto on each half.
bf6d2fda-9b90-44e3-a946-1413c30be3d5 Top the bottom half with a slice of frittata and some greens.
bf6d2fda-9b90-44e3-a946-1413c30be3d5 Close the sandwiches, wrap in foil or parchment if you're picnicking, and serve at room temperature.
ccc20037-4267-49fe-b8bb-4b8a11ca6fa9 Place the cut vegetables into a shallow bowl.
ccc20037-4267-49fe-b8bb-4b8a11ca6fa9 Pour the 1/2 cup vinegar overtop and stir to coat.
ccc20037-4267-49fe-b8bb-4b8a11ca6fa9 Let sit until ready to assemble sandwiches, stirring occasionally.
ccc20037-4267-49fe-b8bb-4b8a11ca6fa9 Before using, drain off excess vinegar.
4d0d6637-b497-4856-9882-815ac41dc1fc Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment or a silpat, or spray with cooking spray.
4d0d6637-b497-4856-9882-815ac41dc1fc Into a large bowl place the bread crumbs, milk, onion, garlic, parsley, cheese, fennel seed, oregano, salt, egg, and pepper. Mix together well with a fork.
4d0d6637-b497-4856-9882-815ac41dc1fc Add ground turkey and use fork to mix well but without overworking.
4d0d6637-b497-4856-9882-815ac41dc1fc Use two spoons or a small ice cream scoop to portion the mixture into 12 roughly equal parts. Then roll each meatball gently between your palms to make it spherical.
4d0d6637-b497-4856-9882-815ac41dc1fc Space the meatballs evenly on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes, then flip with a spatula and bake 5 minutes more, until just cooked through.
4d0d6637-b497-4856-9882-815ac41dc1fc Heat tomato sauce in a medium pan, then add meatballs and simmer for a minute or two.
284fe2b0-cc9d-49ec-a59a-1c4f7abdd9f5 Cut or tear the lobster meat into bite-sized pieces and place in a medium bowl.
284fe2b0-cc9d-49ec-a59a-1c4f7abdd9f5 In a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, lemon juice, capers, chives and salt and pepper. Pour the dressing over the lobster and toss gently to coat all the meat.
284fe2b0-cc9d-49ec-a59a-1c4f7abdd9f5 Melt the butter on a skillet over medium-high heat. Set the buns down on the skillet on one of their side edges. Cook for a minute or two until golden brown, then flip and cook the opposite side.
284fe2b0-cc9d-49ec-a59a-1c4f7abdd9f5 Divide the lobster meat among the buns and serve immediately.
2473a574-ec24-4583-ad0b-56167bfcad9d Preheat oven to 450°F with a rack in the center. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a light layer of oil.
2473a574-ec24-4583-ad0b-56167bfcad9d Into food processor fitted with the blade, place the onion, garlic, sweet potato and walnuts. Process until finely chopped. Add the cooked rice and lentils and pulse until well combined. Transfer into a large mixing bowl. Add the ketchup, mustard, flax, salt, cayenne and black pepper and mix together thoroughly.
2473a574-ec24-4583-ad0b-56167bfcad9d Stir in the cornmeal. The mixture should be thick enough that you can easily form patties in your hands. If not, add a bit more cornmeal. Divide into eight patties and place on a the baking sheet.
2473a574-ec24-4583-ad0b-56167bfcad9d Bake for 20 minutes, then flip each patty and bake 15 minutes more. Serve as you like.
98d7a95c-422c-44fe-9d23-6c6794dad7c2 Spread some mustard on the inside of each slice of bread. Arrange one slice of American and half the cheddar in a single layer on each slice of bread, making sure to distribute the cheddar like a cheese boss who gets what she wants out of every bite. Lay the sauerkraut on the bottom slice and top with the top slice. Spread half the butter over the outside of the top slice of bread.
98d7a95c-422c-44fe-9d23-6c6794dad7c2 Place the sandwich buttered side down in a skillet over medium-high heat. Butter the outside of the top slice with the remaining butter. Cook, adjusting heat as necessary, until bread is golden brown and cheese is melted, flipping once halfway through. Cut and serve immediately.
dd27d60a-fbd3-46df-bfc1-00daefa4dfad To make the salmon filling, combine the salmon, mayonnaise, cream cheese, dill, horseradish, eggs, and pepper in a medium bowl and stir to combine well.
dd27d60a-fbd3-46df-bfc1-00daefa4dfad To make the shrimp filling, combine the shrimp, dill, mayonnaise, cream cheese, and pepper in a medium bowl and stir to combine well.
dd27d60a-fbd3-46df-bfc1-00daefa4dfad To assemble the Smörgåstårta, lay 1 1/2 bread slices on a cutting board to form a long rectangle. Top with half the salmon or herring filling. Layer another 1 1/2 bread slices on top, and top with half the shrimp filling. Repeat with the remaining bread and fillings, ending with a layer of bread. You will have half a slice of bread left over. Press gently on the sandwich from the top and sides to compress the layers a bit.
dd27d60a-fbd3-46df-bfc1-00daefa4dfad To "frost" the Smörgåstårta, spread the top and sides with a thin layer of cream cheese. (Stir in up to a couple of tablespoons of milk or cream if the cream cheese is too thick, since texture varies by brand.) Sprinkle with the chopped parsley, cut into slices, and serve. Can be refrigerated for up to a day, either before or after frosting.
0c1daade-c2e2-440f-bdf2-2c8269f3454f Peel the eggs and mash them well in a small bowl with a fork.
0c1daade-c2e2-440f-bdf2-2c8269f3454f Add mayonnaise, salt, and pepper, and continue mashing until nicely combined.
0c1daade-c2e2-440f-bdf2-2c8269f3454f Spread mixture evenly over one slice of bread.
0c1daade-c2e2-440f-bdf2-2c8269f3454f Top with watercress and the other bread slice. Cut sandwich in half and serve immediately.
79aba88e-cadb-42da-8008-515532aac7d0 Pan-fry the bacon until just crisp. Drain on paper towels.
79aba88e-cadb-42da-8008-515532aac7d0 Toast the bread lightly.
79aba88e-cadb-42da-8008-515532aac7d0 Spread the mayonnaise on one slice of bread and the avocado on the other (or slice the avocado to layer on top).
79aba88e-cadb-42da-8008-515532aac7d0 Layer the bacon, tomato and lettuce or arugula on top of one slice of bread and top with the other slice of bread.
79aba88e-cadb-42da-8008-515532aac7d0 Cut sandwich in half on the diagonal and serve immediately.
379f5cb5-853d-4703-9fc6-39060942feda Melt the butter in a medium pot over medium-high heat.
379f5cb5-853d-4703-9fc6-39060942feda Add the minced shallot and cook for a minute or so, whisking once or twice. Place the turkey neck into the pot and continue cooking, turning occasionally, until lightly browned.
379f5cb5-853d-4703-9fc6-39060942feda Add the flour and cook, whisking, for one minute.
379f5cb5-853d-4703-9fc6-39060942feda Pour in the stock and whisk well. Whisk in soy sauce, marmite or vegemite, and a few grinds of pepper.
379f5cb5-853d-4703-9fc6-39060942feda Bring stock to a boil.
379f5cb5-853d-4703-9fc6-39060942feda Reduce heat and simmer for one hour. You can control the thickness by covering the pot for part of the cooking time.
379f5cb5-853d-4703-9fc6-39060942feda Taste for seasoning and add salt and additional pepper if desired. Remove turkey neck before serving.
9423c8f6-054a-493a-828d-0ff332d4e13d Use a microplane to zest the orange.
9423c8f6-054a-493a-828d-0ff332d4e13d Cut the orange in half and juice it. You should end up with somewhere around 1/2 cup of orange juice. A little more or less is 100% fine. If it's a lot less, add more juice from another orange or — if you don't have one — add a little more apple cider than called for.
17978913-ece8-4aeb-a7fa-923e0a57efc4 Place egg yolks, lemon juice, salt, Tobasco, and water in a 2-cup glass measuring cup or the tall container that came with your stick blender. In a small pot, heat butter until fully melted and very hot and bubbly. Transfer butter to the 1-cup measuring cup for easy pouring.
17978913-ece8-4aeb-a7fa-923e0a57efc4 Place the blender into the 2-cup measuring cup or the tall blender container, touching the bottom, and turn it on. Drizzle in the very hot butter in a slow, steady stream until it's gone. This should take 30 seconds to a minute and leave you with a beautifully emulsified Hollandaise sauce. Taste for salt.
17978913-ece8-4aeb-a7fa-923e0a57efc4 Serve over vegetables, fish, chicken, or steak or with Eggs Benedict or Florentine. And hey, maybe use those egg whites for a Pavlova, another great party trick.
96ba3a0b-feb4-480a-a635-3e9f608236c9 Shred zucchini or yellow squash on the large holes of a box grater or in a food processor with the shredding disc.
96ba3a0b-feb4-480a-a635-3e9f608236c9 Set a 10- or 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat. Melt butter (or heat olive oil). Add shallot, garlic, shredded squash, salt, and pepper.
96ba3a0b-feb4-480a-a635-3e9f608236c9 Cook, stirring frequently, for about 20 minutes, until reduced to a soft, spreadable, silky consistency. You may need to lower the heat about halfway through to prevent browning.
96ba3a0b-feb4-480a-a635-3e9f608236c9 Spread is ready to use right away, or let cool and transfer to an airtight container.
85dba1f4-fe8f-43ba-a502-c7313b4280b6 In a small mixing bowl, stir together the vinegar, garlic, oregano, salt, red pepper flakes, and black pepper. Let sit for five minutes while the vinegar mellows the bite of the garlic.
85dba1f4-fe8f-43ba-a502-c7313b4280b6 Stir in minced greens.
85dba1f4-fe8f-43ba-a502-c7313b4280b6 Drizzle in olive oil while stirring constantly. That's it!
1672b365-2275-4fdb-bb77-1e74e48e1086 If you'll be canning the jam, prepare the jars and hot water canner according to the instructions below.
1672b365-2275-4fdb-bb77-1e74e48e1086 In a wide pot, stir together strawberries, rhubarb, butter, cardamom, pepper, and calcium water.
1672b365-2275-4fdb-bb77-1e74e48e1086 Cook, stirring frequently, over medium heat until the fruit starts to release its juices.
1672b365-2275-4fdb-bb77-1e74e48e1086 Raise heat to high and bring to a full boil. Then reduce heat again and simmer, stirring frequently to prevent burning, until fruit has softened completely and largely broken down, about 15 minutes.
1672b365-2275-4fdb-bb77-1e74e48e1086 In a small bowl, whisk the sugar and pectin together thoroughly.
1672b365-2275-4fdb-bb77-1e74e48e1086 Add sugar mixture to pan and whisk constantly while mixture returns to a full boil. Simmer briskly for one to two minutes.
1672b365-2275-4fdb-bb77-1e74e48e1086 Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.
1672b365-2275-4fdb-bb77-1e74e48e1086 Funnel into jars, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Refrigerate once cool or proceed to canning instructions.
2c4767ac-1f46-4a95-b752-ed057f3200cf Toast the walnuts in a small, dry pan over medium heat until they are fragrant and a little darker brown than they started out (3 to 5 minutes).
2c4767ac-1f46-4a95-b752-ed057f3200cf Let cool slightly and pour into the bowl of a food processor fitted with the blade attachment.
2c4767ac-1f46-4a95-b752-ed057f3200cf Add the garlic scapes or cloves, basil, salt, pepper, and lemon juice and pulse just until a thick paste forms. Stop to press any stray or stubborn basil leaves into the whirling action of the blade as necessary.
2c4767ac-1f46-4a95-b752-ed057f3200cf With the motor running, pour the olive oil through the feed tube in a slow stream. Transfer pesto to a mixing bowl and stir in the grated cheese.
e49ac4ab-a29f-4110-b95b-a1c9e375b7c4 Place all ingredients in a medium pot.
e49ac4ab-a29f-4110-b95b-a1c9e375b7c4 Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat and simmer briskly, uncovered, until thickened, about 20 minutes.
e49ac4ab-a29f-4110-b95b-a1c9e375b7c4 Cool slightly (or completely if you like) before serving.
3b29e560-9078-4851-ae81-18e075294c5c Place the shallot, balsamic vinegar, and red wine vinegar into the jar and stir to ensure shallot is covered with vinegar. Let the shallot marinate for a few minutes (two to five is enough) to let the vinegar work its magic and take the bite out of the shallots.
3b29e560-9078-4851-ae81-18e075294c5c Add the salt, sugar, pepper, mustard, and olive oil to the jar.
3b29e560-9078-4851-ae81-18e075294c5c Close the lid and shake well until dressing is completely emulsified.
3b29e560-9078-4851-ae81-18e075294c5c The dressing is ready to use right away and will keep well in a nice cold fridge for a week or two. If it solidifies in the fridge (as olive oil can do at colder temperatures), bring to room temperature before using. (You can pop the lidless jar into the microwave for about 10 seconds and give it a stir to hasten the process if you like.)
1cf703e0-d944-4f7f-bc8a-e34599974bb3 Peel and trim ends from onions. Halve onions from root to tip, then slice thinly from root to tip. See step-by-step photos and video for visual cues. Cutting from root to tip (as opposed to crosswise) is the way to ensure the onion slices will hold enough of their shape while caramelizing, rather than dissolving into mush.
1cf703e0-d944-4f7f-bc8a-e34599974bb3 Heat oil and melt butter together over medium heat in a 10-inch frying pan with a heavy bottom.
1cf703e0-d944-4f7f-bc8a-e34599974bb3 Add onions and stir well to coat with oil and butter. Add rosemary, thyme, and salt, and stir again.
1cf703e0-d944-4f7f-bc8a-e34599974bb3 For the first 20 minutes or so, the onions will sweat a lot and reduce in volume substantially. Stir occasionally during this time to keep them cooking evenly, and adjust the heat as necessary to prevent burning. Don't expect to see too much color on the onions during this time.
1cf703e0-d944-4f7f-bc8a-e34599974bb3 During the next 20 to 40 minutes, the onions will really start to caramelize. Your job during this time is to stir the onions not too little but not too much. Allow them to get a little bit browned on the bottom without burning, and then scrape up the browned bits while stirring the onions with a metal spoon or spatula. Typically the heat should be in the medium to medium-low range, but your mileage may vary.
1cf703e0-d944-4f7f-bc8a-e34599974bb3 Over time you'll learn exactly how dark you like your caramelized onions. Our favorite point to stop is when they're a gorgeous mahogany brown and just on the cusp of jammy. At this stage they're super sweet and savory and not at all burned.
1cf703e0-d944-4f7f-bc8a-e34599974bb3 Remove any large herb stems before using these babies in whatever recipes you like (or just spooning over all your hopes and dreams).
13f0408a-909e-4432-8af9-8547d05eba46 In a small lidded jar, shake all ingredients together (or whisk together in a bowl). Pass at the table with sushi bowls.
9dd5d724-9757-4d74-b478-3f44c4881a95 Stir all ingredients together and serve as a sauce or salad dressing.
9dd5d724-9757-4d74-b478-3f44c4881a95 Store leftovers tightly sealed in the fridge for up to a week.
36cc9d16-ebe2-44df-bc77-d24994cdb873 Combine all ingredients in a blender and process on high until smooth and creamy. Keeps well in a jar the fridge for up to two weeks. If not pourable, bring to room temperature before using. (If you're in a rush, 10-15 seconds in the microwave and a quick stir does the trick.)
20095981-99b4-4fe3-9515-900b6c68e341 Use a mortar and pestle, the side of a chef's knife, or a fork to mash the garlic to a paste. Stir well into the mayo. Spread onto any sandwich that could use a little kick. A good old summer tomato sandwich schmeared with this stuff is BOMB.
9eaf8365-2c56-4fe7-8277-4525a45f5239 Place the pine nuts in a small, dry pan over medium heat and toast until lightly browned in spots, stirring or tossing in the pan occasionally, about five minutes. Keep a close eye on them so they don't burn. Let cool slightly and pour into a food processor fitted with the blade.
9eaf8365-2c56-4fe7-8277-4525a45f5239 Trim any roots from the ramps and chop the bulbs, stems and leaves into bite-sized pieces. Add to food processor along with basil, spinach, salt and lemon juice. Pulse until finely chopped.
9eaf8365-2c56-4fe7-8277-4525a45f5239 With the machine running, pour in the olive oil and process until oil is incorporated.
9eaf8365-2c56-4fe7-8277-4525a45f5239 With the machine off, stir in cheese with a spoon.
9eaf8365-2c56-4fe7-8277-4525a45f5239 Use immediately or store tightly covered in the fridge for up to a few days.
14067e82-1e0b-4f96-8bb0-bb14eff7f363 Pour the sugar into in a large bowl.
14067e82-1e0b-4f96-8bb0-bb14eff7f363 Slit the vanilla beans lengthwise with a small, sharp knife and scrape out the seeds. Add the seeds to the bowl.
14067e82-1e0b-4f96-8bb0-bb14eff7f363 Sprinkle in the cinnamon, cardamom and nutmeg and stir well to distribute all the spices evenly. If there are any clumps, break them up and pass the mixture through a sieve.
14067e82-1e0b-4f96-8bb0-bb14eff7f363 Divide spiced sugar among 12 small jars such as these wide-mouth half pint jars — about 6 heaping tablespoons per jar plus a little extra for good luck.
dec83bda-01b7-4b65-a69a-c7578f935880 Preheat oven to 200°F.
dec83bda-01b7-4b65-a69a-c7578f935880 Pick the rosemary needles and sage and thyme leaves from the stems and discard stems. Place the herbs in the bowl of a standard food processor (about 12-cup capacity) fitted with the blade. Add the garlic, lemon zest and salt. The bowl will be quite full, but don't worry.
dec83bda-01b7-4b65-a69a-c7578f935880 Process until the herbs are finely chopped and well-distributed throughout the salt.
dec83bda-01b7-4b65-a69a-c7578f935880 Spread the herb salt onto two rimmed baking sheets and place in the oven for 20 minutes. The salt will form a solid slab on each sheet.
dec83bda-01b7-4b65-a69a-c7578f935880 Break up the slab with your hands, a fork or spoon, a potato masher, whatever you like. Then pass the mixture through a sieve into a large bowl until there are no clumps left.
dec83bda-01b7-4b65-a69a-c7578f935880 Divide the herb salt among 12 small jars such as these wide-mouth half pint jars. Label and give!
9b3c97e1-479d-42cb-9842-5040e7118b7e Preheat oven to 375°F with two racks close to the center. Brush any dirt off shiitakes. Remove stems and slice caps very thinly.
9b3c97e1-479d-42cb-9842-5040e7118b7e Place sliced shiitakes into a medium mixing bowl. Add the oil, smoked paprika, and salt. Toss thoroughly to coat.
9b3c97e1-479d-42cb-9842-5040e7118b7e Divide shiitake slices between two rimmed cookie sheets. Spread in a single layer without crowding. Bake for about 20 minutes, until some bits are quite crispy and others a little softer. Let cool slightly before serving. I rarely have leftovers, but if you do, store tightly covered in the fridge for several days and pop in the toaster oven to re-crisp.
345b726c-4019-47ce-ba00-069db9451e51 Roughly chop cilantro. Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth, stopping to push cilantro down into the blades as necessary.
52390629-21f4-48c8-99e6-c7a3f036fe6e Pour the vegetable stock into a medium pot and drop in the shiitakes. Bring stock to a boil over high heat, then remove from heat and let mushrooms steep for 30 minutes. Pour stock and mushrooms into large spouted measuring cup or bowl, and wipe out the pot with a paper towel.
52390629-21f4-48c8-99e6-c7a3f036fe6e Add the butter to the empty pot and melt over medium-high heat. If using the shallot, add and cook for a minute or so, whisking once or twice. Add the flour and cook, whisking, until it turns very lightly golden, about two minutes.
52390629-21f4-48c8-99e6-c7a3f036fe6e Pour in the stock with the mushrooms in a stream, whisking the whole time. Add soy sauce, marmite, and a few grinds of pepper.
52390629-21f4-48c8-99e6-c7a3f036fe6e Bring stock back to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, until gravy is reduced by almost half, about 20 minutes. Taste for seasoning and add salt and additional pepper if desired. Remove mushrooms before serving.
d2a1eb12-44c1-4bf2-aa49-5883995cda59 Peel the onions and halve from tip to root. Very thinly slice each half from tip to root.
d2a1eb12-44c1-4bf2-aa49-5883995cda59 In a quart-size mason jar or medium bowl with a lid, combine the lime juice, red wine vinegar, white vinegar, sugar, and salt. Stir (or put a lid on the jar and shake gently) to completely dissolve sugar and salt.
d2a1eb12-44c1-4bf2-aa49-5883995cda59 Add the sliced onions and the herbs to the jar or bowl. Stir and press a bit to submerge all the onions and herbs in the liquid. Top off with an extra splash of vinegar if necessary.
d2a1eb12-44c1-4bf2-aa49-5883995cda59 Pickle these babies in the fridge for 24 hours or simply on the counter at room temperature for an hour or two before serving as a condiment for tacos, sandwiches, salads — you name it. They keep very well in the fridge for up to a month.
b3b1ed60-049c-4a03-a038-c498090dc45f Into the bowl of a food processor fitted with the blade, place the egg yolk, mustard, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
b3b1ed60-049c-4a03-a038-c498090dc45f Measure the oil into a liquid measuring cup with a spout. Turn on the food processor. Pour about half of the oil into the white plunger in the feed tube. The tiny hole at the bottom of the plunger will dribble the oil into the bowl of the processor, allowing the mayo to emulsify. When the oil level in the plunger gets low, pour in the remaining oil. The whole process should take about two to three minutes. When all the oil has dribbled into the bowl, stop the processor. Stir with a rubber spatula to incorporate any last bits of oil. Taste mayo for seasoning, adding more salt, pepper or lemon juice to taste. Store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to a week.
e6f775f2-ee81-4852-a0ab-cce82f5dfec4 Quarter the apples and slice out the cores. Leave the skins on.
e6f775f2-ee81-4852-a0ab-cce82f5dfec4 Add apples to a large pot (8 quart minimum).
e6f775f2-ee81-4852-a0ab-cce82f5dfec4 Add water and salt and bring to a boil.
e6f775f2-ee81-4852-a0ab-cce82f5dfec4 Cover and reduce the heat, adjusting to maintain a simmer. Cook until apples have softened completely and yield their shape easily when stirred.
e6f775f2-ee81-4852-a0ab-cce82f5dfec4 Set a food mill over a very large bowl and begin by pouring some of the apple mixture into the top of the mill. Turn the handle of the food mill clockwise to force the pulp through the holes. Reverse the direction of the blade occasionally to clear the mill.
e6f775f2-ee81-4852-a0ab-cce82f5dfec4 Continue adding apples and rotating the blade until all the apples have gone through and only the peel remains in the top portion of the mill.
e6f775f2-ee81-4852-a0ab-cce82f5dfec4 Add the sugar and cinnamon and stir thoroughly. When cool, divide into storage containers and refrigerate or freeze as desired.
3a336371-d891-4251-a281-ffb7d5b13402 Place peppercorns, mustard seeds, and coriander seeds into a small pan and set over medium heat.
3a336371-d891-4251-a281-ffb7d5b13402 Cook, stirring occasionally, until fragrant, adjusting heat as necessary to ensure spices don't burn. Keep lid handy in case seeds pop. Cool slightly before proceeding.
3a336371-d891-4251-a281-ffb7d5b13402 Pour pan contents into a mortar crush with pestle.
3a336371-d891-4251-a281-ffb7d5b13402 Combine crushed seeds with other spices and mix thoroughly.
3a336371-d891-4251-a281-ffb7d5b13402 Store in a tightly sealed container for up to a few months.
437adac1-edff-4e47-a554-946d77efcfcc Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center. Trim the bottoms from the asparagus, discarding as much as necessary to be left with only tender parts. Fill a large mixing bowl halfway with ice water.
437adac1-edff-4e47-a554-946d77efcfcc In a 12-inch pan with a lid, bring an inch of water to a boil. Add asparagus, cover, and cook for two minutes. Remove asparagus from pan and plunge immediately into the bowl of ice water to set the bright green color.
437adac1-edff-4e47-a554-946d77efcfcc Dry asparagus well. Divide into 12 even bundles, with all tips facing the same direction.
437adac1-edff-4e47-a554-946d77efcfcc Wrap each bundle tightly with a slice of prosciutto. Line up bundles seam-side down on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
437adac1-edff-4e47-a554-946d77efcfcc Melt the butter and stir in the garlic. Spoon some of the mixture over each bundle and brush it all over the surface of the asparagus and prosciutto. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
437adac1-edff-4e47-a554-946d77efcfcc Roast for 12 minutes, until beautifully fragrant and sizzling. Squeeze the lemon half all over the bundles before serving.
801a86f1-8a7a-4380-b2a0-1ea6dc758df9 Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add rice noodles and cook according to package instructions, usually just a few minutes (ours cook for 3).
801a86f1-8a7a-4380-b2a0-1ea6dc758df9 While the noodles cook: Into a serving bowl, pour the safflower oil, toasted sesame oil, tamari, and sriracha. Whisk to combine well.
801a86f1-8a7a-4380-b2a0-1ea6dc758df9 Drain noodles and add to sauce. You can rinse them before adding to the sauce if you like to reduce the starchiness, but I don't bother. Toss with tongs to coat well.
801a86f1-8a7a-4380-b2a0-1ea6dc758df9 Add scallions and a big squeeze of fresh lime juice and toss. Serve warm or at room temperature with additional lime wedges.
9f3eb0b9-fb2c-426d-b019-882d026df22c Preheat oven to 400° F with a rack in the center.
9f3eb0b9-fb2c-426d-b019-882d026df22c Wash and dry the Brussels sprouts. Trim off and discard a little bit of the stem end from each sprout and slice each sprout in half lengthwise.
9f3eb0b9-fb2c-426d-b019-882d026df22c In a small bowl, whisk together the miso paste, tamari, hot water, and maple syrup.
9f3eb0b9-fb2c-426d-b019-882d026df22c Heat a 12-inch cast-iron skillet for a few minutes on medium-high. Pour in safflower oil and spread to coat bottom of pan.
9f3eb0b9-fb2c-426d-b019-882d026df22c Add Brussels sprouts and arrange cut-sides down. Cook without stirring until seared on the underside, 1 to 3 minutes depending on your stove.
9f3eb0b9-fb2c-426d-b019-882d026df22c Remove pan from heat and pour miso glaze over sprouts. Stir to coat. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
9f3eb0b9-fb2c-426d-b019-882d026df22c Transfer pan to oven and roast for about 15 minutes, until cooked to your liking.
9f3eb0b9-fb2c-426d-b019-882d026df22c Drizzle sprouts with sesame oil and toss well, scraping up any delicious browned bits from the bottom of the pan, and serve in a bowl or straight from the pan.
8f5d2a9a-6543-4d89-9baa-c7877ae5683a In a braiser or 12-inch lidded pan, bring 1/2-inch of water to a boil with a good pinch of salt. Add broccolini and cook until tender but crisp and vibrant green, about 5 minutes. Drain and plunge into a bowl of ice water if you like to stop cooking and preserve bright color. (You don't have to do this, but it's a cool and reliable trick.) Arrange broccolini on a platter.
8f5d2a9a-6543-4d89-9baa-c7877ae5683a While the broccolini cooks, finely chop the parsley. Using a microplane, grate the garlic and then the zest of both lemons onto the parsley. Sprinkle 1/8 teaspoon salt overtop and then mix it all together well.
8f5d2a9a-6543-4d89-9baa-c7877ae5683a Spoon gremolata over broccolini, drizzle with olive oil and the juice from 1/2 a lemon and sprinkle with flaky sea salt and pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature.
97c1ab87-b18e-48e1-8d3c-755a5312b46e To prepare the greens, cut out and discard the stems. Halve the leaves lengthwise and then cut crosswise into short strips. Wash the cut collards in several changes of water until perfectly clean.
97c1ab87-b18e-48e1-8d3c-755a5312b46e Set a 6-quart Instant Pot to the sauté function. Add bacon and cook, stirring frequently, until it's rendered a few tablespoons of fat.
97c1ab87-b18e-48e1-8d3c-755a5312b46e Add onion and garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until beginning to soften (just a minute or two). Turn off the heat.
97c1ab87-b18e-48e1-8d3c-755a5312b46e Pour in the apple cider vinegar and stir, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pot.
97c1ab87-b18e-48e1-8d3c-755a5312b46e Add collards, salt, red pepper flakes, paprika, and black pepper.
97c1ab87-b18e-48e1-8d3c-755a5312b46e Position the lid, set vent to sealing position, and set pot to manual, high pressure, 12 minutes. The pot will take a few minutes to come to pressure before starting to count down the cooking time.
97c1ab87-b18e-48e1-8d3c-755a5312b46e At the end of cooking, carefully perform an instant pressure release.
97c1ab87-b18e-48e1-8d3c-755a5312b46e When steam has fully released, you can open the pot and give the greens a stir to coat them with the bit of silky liquid at the bottom of the pot. They're ready to serve right away.
5d4a089b-0728-44b4-ac13-07858745d01a Wash collard greens. Carefully cut leaves from stems and discard stems.
5d4a089b-0728-44b4-ac13-07858745d01a Stack leaves one on top of the next. Roll leaves from stem end to tip into a cigar shape.
