5d4a089b-0728-44b4-ac13-07858745d01a Cut cigar crosswise into strips 1/8-inch thick (as you would to chiffonade herbs, but a little thicker).
5d4a089b-0728-44b4-ac13-07858745d01a Cut bacon crosswise into 1/4-inch batons. Place a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat and cook bacon until crisp, stirring occasionally.
5d4a089b-0728-44b4-ac13-07858745d01a Add garlic and collard greens to pan and cook, stirring constantly until collards are just wilted and bright green, one to two minutes.
5d4a089b-0728-44b4-ac13-07858745d01a Off the heat, add lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
dc685ece-8479-4832-b8cc-818a08420be1 Preheat oven to 425°F with a rack in the center, or heat grill to medium-high.
dc685ece-8479-4832-b8cc-818a08420be1 Wash, dry and trim off the woody bottom portion of the asparagus.
9e0fc248-a5c2-459f-a0b8-7f883f9fc01d Peel, halve, and slice the onions from root to tip.
9e0fc248-a5c2-459f-a0b8-7f883f9fc01d Quarter the peppers, discard seeds and ribs, and slice.
9e0fc248-a5c2-459f-a0b8-7f883f9fc01d Heat olive oil over medium-high heat in a 12-inch frying pan.
9e0fc248-a5c2-459f-a0b8-7f883f9fc01d Add peppers, onions, salt, and plenty of freshly ground pepper.
9e0fc248-a5c2-459f-a0b8-7f883f9fc01d Cook, stirring from time to time, for 15 to 20 minutes, until peppers are as soft as you like and onions have softened and browned in spots.
d89728cb-c223-445f-89f6-2cdecb72591c Preheat oven to 350°F with a rack in the center.
d89728cb-c223-445f-89f6-2cdecb72591c Warm the olive oil (or melt the vegan butter) over medium-high heat in a large frying pan. Add onion and celery and sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon of the salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until beginning to soften and turn translucent, about 5 minutes. Adjust heat as necessary to prevent browning.
d89728cb-c223-445f-89f6-2cdecb72591c Add apple, chestnuts, thyme, and sage, and continue cooking until apple has softened, about 5 minutes more.
d89728cb-c223-445f-89f6-2cdecb72591c Place bread cubes into a large mixing bowl and scrape the contents of the frying pan overtop. Pour in the broth. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and a few generous grinds of pepper. Mix gently until everything is well-distributed, then let the mixture sit for a few minutes so the bread cubes absorb the wet ingredients.
d89728cb-c223-445f-89f6-2cdecb72591c Transfer stuffing to a large baking dish such as an extra-deep 9x13-inch pan or a 5-quart braiser. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes, until crisp on top and tender inside.
acfc3fd2-d144-40a7-b0b4-7966029e87c4 In a small pot, stir together sake, mirin, soy sauce, and sugar. Warm over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until sugar is dissolved.
acfc3fd2-d144-40a7-b0b4-7966029e87c4 Off the heat, add one heaping cup of ice to the pot to both dilute and chill the marinade. (Alternatively, you can place the ice in a 4-cup glass measuring cup or nonreactive bowl and pour the marinade overtop.)
acfc3fd2-d144-40a7-b0b4-7966029e87c4 Place peeled seven-minute eggs into marinade, cover tightly, and refrigerate for about 24 hours, turning once or twice if you think of it.
acfc3fd2-d144-40a7-b0b4-7966029e87c4 For less intense flavor, you can remove the eggs at any point after about eight hours. For more intense flavor you can let the eggs marinate a bit longer. However, the salt and sugar in the marinade will make the eggs tough eventually, so don't leave them for more than about 36 hours.
9e73f4b6-ce50-46a7-9568-82c4e1ffff1a Melt butter in a 12-inch frying pan — the bigger the better since raw spinach is huuuuuge — over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened but not browned, about 5 minutes.
9e73f4b6-ce50-46a7-9568-82c4e1ffff1a Add spinach by the handful, letting it wilt just enough to make room before adding more. Cook, stirring almost constantly, just until all spinach is wilted. Stir in salt, nutmeg, red pepper flakes, heavy cream, cream cheese, and pepper to taste. Simmer briefly to heat through, and serve.
96ec0be1-238a-427f-8229-86a4832aa317 Preheat oven to 400°F. Place a rack in the center and a rack at the bottom with a rimmed baking sheet to catch any drips.
96ec0be1-238a-427f-8229-86a4832aa317 Scrub potatoes clean and dry them well. Poke shallow holes all around each potato with the tines of a fork to let some steam escape during baking.
96ec0be1-238a-427f-8229-86a4832aa317 Rub each potato with a little bit of oil and sprinkle with salt.
96ec0be1-238a-427f-8229-86a4832aa317 Place potatoes directly onto middle oven rack and bake until very tender throughout. Baking time will vary with the size of your potatoes, but should be around an hour for medium-sized potatoes.
96ec0be1-238a-427f-8229-86a4832aa317 Potatoes are done when they yield easily to a fork or give readily when you squeeze them.
26b46f0a-78a3-4443-8371-e843d2566537 Trim the coarse end from each green bean.
26b46f0a-78a3-4443-8371-e843d2566537 Meanwhile, fill a wide, lidded pot or pan with 1 inch of water and two teaspoons of and bring to a boil over high heat. Add the trimmed beans, replace lid and cook until just tender, about 5 minutes.
26b46f0a-78a3-4443-8371-e843d2566537 While the water comes to a boil, place the minced shallot in a wide, shallow serving bowl large enough to accommodate the green beans and pour in the vinegar. Stir to combine. Wait five minutes for the vinegar to take the bite out of the shallots. Then whisk in the mustard, salt, pepper and olive oil until well combined.
26b46f0a-78a3-4443-8371-e843d2566537 Drain green beans and add to the serving bowl. Toss to coat green beans with dressing and serve warm.
ecfee7ae-96db-4a80-97d0-c787c5fdd52e Fill a very large pot halfway with cold water and two tablespoons of fine sea salt. Place potato pieces into the pot as you peel and chop them.
ecfee7ae-96db-4a80-97d0-c787c5fdd52e Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat and and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain potatoes in a colander.
ecfee7ae-96db-4a80-97d0-c787c5fdd52e Heat the butter and milk together in a small pot over medium-low heat until butter is melted. Either press the potatoes through a ricer or food mill back into the pot, or return them to the pot straightaway and use a masher to mash them until smooth. Pour in hot buttery milk in a slow stream, stirring to incorporate. Taste and adjust for salt and pepper.
7ff8c1b9-bb65-4c12-8391-baeb5221d462 Peel the potatoes and cut into rough 1-inch cubes. Place in a medium pot and fill with water to cover by an inch. Add 1 tablespoon salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until tender but not waterlogged, about 15 minutes. Drain and place back in pot. Mash with potato masher until reasonably smooth. (I prefer to mash before adding liquid so the potatoes don't get gummy.)
7ff8c1b9-bb65-4c12-8391-baeb5221d462 Place milk and butter in a microwave-safe bowl or liquid measure and heat until just shy of boiling. Pour liquid into pot with potatoes, add remaining 1 teaspoon salt and some pepper, and stir together until creamy.
3eabe52d-325c-48e6-8a22-f3c074d7985c Cut potatoes into 1-inch pieces. Place in a medium pot with two tablespoons fine sea salt and cold water to cover by two inches. Bring to a boil, then cook until as tender as you like, 10-15 minutes after boiling.
3eabe52d-325c-48e6-8a22-f3c074d7985c While potatoes boil, cook bacon until crispy, drain on paper towels and finely chop or crumble.
3eabe52d-325c-48e6-8a22-f3c074d7985c In a small bowl, whisk together oil, vinegar, mustard, sugar, fine sea salt and pepper.
3eabe52d-325c-48e6-8a22-f3c074d7985c When potatoes are done, drain and place into a large mixing bowl. Add dressing and toss to coat. Stir in bacon, herbs, and shallot. Place in a serving bowl and sprinkle with flaky salt if you like. Serve warm or at room temperature.
982c18fc-fd1c-4a77-87b0-100c7ab13bd1 Fill a medium pot halfway with water, add 2 tablespoons salt, and bring to a boil. Add orzo, give it one big stir, and then cook undisturbed to al dente according to package instructions. Adjust heat as necessary to maintain a boil or very brisk simmer without letting the pot overflow.
982c18fc-fd1c-4a77-87b0-100c7ab13bd1 Drain pasta, place back into pot, and toss with butter and lemon juice until butter is melted. Stir in pecorino and plenty of freshly ground black pepper and serve.
3e126348-69ad-425d-9f3c-ecd3e3ba18fa Heat olive oil over medium heat in a medium pot.
3e126348-69ad-425d-9f3c-ecd3e3ba18fa Add shallot, garlic and thyme and cook, stirring occasionally, for about two minutes.
3e126348-69ad-425d-9f3c-ecd3e3ba18fa Stir in beans and stock. Simmer for 5 minutes.
3e126348-69ad-425d-9f3c-ecd3e3ba18fa Remove thyme sprigs and puree with an immersion blender until perfectly smooth.
3e126348-69ad-425d-9f3c-ecd3e3ba18fa Stir in lemon juice.
3e126348-69ad-425d-9f3c-ecd3e3ba18fa In a small skillet over medium heat, melt butter and then cook until foaming subsides and butter solids turn brown at bottom of pan. Swirling the pan gently can help you see what’s going on under there.
3e126348-69ad-425d-9f3c-ecd3e3ba18fa When butter is golden brown and smells spectacularly nutty, remove pan from heat.
3e126348-69ad-425d-9f3c-ecd3e3ba18fa Stir brown butter into bean puree.
60a922e2-0405-4dba-996a-711094fbd14c Preheat a 12-inch cast iron skillet on the stovetop for five minutes over high heat. Meanwhile, wipe any dirt off the mushrooms with a paper towel and, if you like (and your mushrooms are whole), rinse under running water and spin dry. Remove stems from shiitakes and oyster mushrooms and trim a slice of the stem end off the baby bellas. Slice baby bellas and shiitakes about 1/4-inch thick and cut oyster mushrooms into small bite-sized pieces.
60a922e2-0405-4dba-996a-711094fbd14c Add butter to pan. When melted and bubbly, add mushrooms and toss to coat. Cook, stirring only occasionally, for about 10 minutes, until well browned in plenty of spots. Stir in salt and pepper to taste and garnish with parsley if you like.
fec8f71c-c504-47e9-9887-434b0c070135 Preheat grill to about 400°F. Place shucked corn on grates and grill until nicely browned but still tender, about 3 minutes per "side," 10-ish minutes total. Place on a serving platter to cool slightly.
fec8f71c-c504-47e9-9887-434b0c070135 In a small bowl, stir together the mayonnaise, crema or sour cream, chili powder, garlic, lime juice and zest, cilantro and salt.
fec8f71c-c504-47e9-9887-434b0c070135 Spread sauce over corn with a spoon. Sprinkle with Cotija and with extra cilantro and chili powder. Garnish with lime wedges and serve warm.
8a2aa427-1975-42cb-a115-09ff7aef7fdd Set heavy 12-inch skillet over medium heat. Pour in hazelnuts. Cook, shaking the pan occasionally, until skins have turned dark brown in spots and begun to split, about 15 minutes.
8a2aa427-1975-42cb-a115-09ff7aef7fdd While hot, carefully pour hazelnuts into center of clean dishtowel. Rub together to remove skins. When hazelnuts are cool enough to handle, finely chop and set aside.
8a2aa427-1975-42cb-a115-09ff7aef7fdd Wipe out skillet to remove any hazelnut bits. Set over medium-high heat. Add butter and cook until bubbly and beginning to turn brown.
8a2aa427-1975-42cb-a115-09ff7aef7fdd Reduce heat to medium. Add cauliflower, sage, chopped hazelnuts, and a few generous pinches of salt and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until cauliflower is tender and has caramelized in spots, 10 to 15 minutes. Depending on how well your pan retains heat, you may find the nuts are in danger of burning before the cauliflower becomes tender. If that's the case, pour in a couple of tablespoons of water, cover the pan and reduce heat to low, cooking until cauliflower is tender, then proceed.
8a2aa427-1975-42cb-a115-09ff7aef7fdd Quarter and core pear and slice thinly. Add pear and parsley to cauliflower mixture, stir to distribute, and taste for seasoning. Serve warm.
24952c0b-8aee-46aa-bb4f-2fa76c54363d In a medium-sized pot, heat the bacon fat or oil over medium-high heat.
24952c0b-8aee-46aa-bb4f-2fa76c54363d Add the diced onion and pepper along with the salt, and cook, stirring occasionally, until starting to soften, about five minutes.
24952c0b-8aee-46aa-bb4f-2fa76c54363d Add the garlic, tomato paste, cumin, and chili powder. Cook, stirring, for one minute.
24952c0b-8aee-46aa-bb4f-2fa76c54363d Add the beans along with 1/2 cup bean cooking water, broth, or plain water.
24952c0b-8aee-46aa-bb4f-2fa76c54363d Bring to a boil.
24952c0b-8aee-46aa-bb4f-2fa76c54363d Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 minutes. Add up to 1/2 cup more water if the beans become too dry.
24952c0b-8aee-46aa-bb4f-2fa76c54363d Then, using a potato masher, the back of a wooden spoon, or an immersion blender, mash the beans until smooth.
24952c0b-8aee-46aa-bb4f-2fa76c54363d Stir in lime juice and taste for salt.
24952c0b-8aee-46aa-bb4f-2fa76c54363d Serve hot.
fd229d7b-5575-4288-8020-a602656e2dee Core and roughly chop the cauliflower and place in a large, heavy pot.
fd229d7b-5575-4288-8020-a602656e2dee Add shallot, salt and vegetable broth. Cover and bring to a boil.
fd229d7b-5575-4288-8020-a602656e2dee Reduce heat to simmer and cook until very tender, about 10 minutes.
fd229d7b-5575-4288-8020-a602656e2dee Spoon the entire contents of the pot into a food processor or high-speed blender, or leave it in the pot if you'd like to use an immersion blender.
fd229d7b-5575-4288-8020-a602656e2dee Add sour cream, butter, gouda, parmesan, nutmeg and a few good grinds black pepper and
fd229d7b-5575-4288-8020-a602656e2dee Process until very smooth.
677aa608-3366-4d92-9596-b7d13e1548df Preheat oven to 400°F with two racks close to the center.
677aa608-3366-4d92-9596-b7d13e1548df Peel and trim the carrots. Slice very thick carrots into quarters from root to tip, slice medium-sized carrots in half from root to tip, and leave any very thin carrots whole. The idea is to cut all pieces to a reasonably similar size so they will roast evenly.
677aa608-3366-4d92-9596-b7d13e1548df Place the carrots on one baking sheet and toss with half the oil, then move half the carrots to a second baking sheet and arrange in a roomy single layer. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and roast until tender and lightly browned, about 20-25 minutes depending on size.
677aa608-3366-4d92-9596-b7d13e1548df While the carrots roast, place the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of oil and the mustard and cumin seeds into your smallest pan. Warm over medium heat until the seeds start to pop vigorously, then remove from heat and let sit until ready to serve.
677aa608-3366-4d92-9596-b7d13e1548df When ready to serve, arrange carrots on a platter, drizzle with the cumin and mustard seed oil, sprinkle with cilantro or parsley and some flaky sea salt if you have it.
8fb05918-b35b-4a71-82ee-2bcc3693e4c0 Preheat oven to 450°F. Line two half sheet pans with baking and cooling racks if you have them and parchment if you don't (no worries).
8fb05918-b35b-4a71-82ee-2bcc3693e4c0 Fill a large bowl halfway with ice water. Cut the potatoes into french fry shape using a mandoline or a knife. Add cut potatoes to ice water as you work and let sit for 15 minutes. Drain and dry well with paper towels.
8fb05918-b35b-4a71-82ee-2bcc3693e4c0 Dry out the bowl and add potatoes, oil, and a few generous sprinkles of salt, probably more than you think. Toss gently until all potatoes are glistening.
8fb05918-b35b-4a71-82ee-2bcc3693e4c0 One by one, place the potatoes on the baking sheets in nice orderly rows so that they don't touch. This is my least favorite thing ever and is super-tedious, but it's worth it to get crispy, evenly cooked fries. You've come this far. Don't drop the ball (or all the fries into one crappy pile) now.
8fb05918-b35b-4a71-82ee-2bcc3693e4c0 Roast for 10 minutes, then rotate pans and their position in the oven and roast about 10 minutes more, depending on the size of the fries, until crisp on the outsides and tender inside. Sprinkle with more salt if you like and serve immediately.
2bb6ba28-0a68-4611-b83b-a95e674e244c Preheat oven to 200°F. If you have a convection oven, go for it. You'll need two racks, so, as they tell schoolchildren in England, be sensible.
2bb6ba28-0a68-4611-b83b-a95e674e244c Cut the baguettes into 3/4-inch cubes and distribute between two rimmed sheet pans without crowding. Bake for about an hour, peeking in and maybe shaking the pans occasionally, until the cubes are dry all the way through. You can do this up to a few days in advance if you like.
2bb6ba28-0a68-4611-b83b-a95e674e244c While the bread is drying, slice the white and light green parts of the leeks into thin half moons and wash thoroughly in several changes of water in a colander. (Leeks can be very sandy.) Cut the celery into a nice small dice — you'll want it small so it cooks as quickly as the leeks. Dust off the mushrooms with a damp paper towel and slice, removing any tough stems.
2bb6ba28-0a68-4611-b83b-a95e674e244c Heat the oil over medium-low heat in a wide, reasonably nonstick frying pan. Add the leeks, celery, and salt, and cook, stirring from time to time, until starting to soften, about five minutes. If you suspect a hint of browning, reduce the heat. Add the mushrooms and cook until they've released their moisture and it's mostly simmered away.
2bb6ba28-0a68-4611-b83b-a95e674e244c Add the chestnuts, soy sauce, wine, thyme, sage, raise heat to medium-high, and cook for three minutes more. Remove from heat.
2bb6ba28-0a68-4611-b83b-a95e674e244c Remove bread cubes from oven and raise heat to 375°F. Move a rack to the middle. Tip the bread cubes into a large mixing bowl. Add the contents of the frying pan and the stock, pepper, and parsley or chives. Toss gently to combine and allow the bread to soak up all the liquid. Taste and adjust seasoning if you like. (It's vegan...shh...so no food-safety worries.)
2bb6ba28-0a68-4611-b83b-a95e674e244c Spoon the stuffing into a baking dish. Shallow 9x13 is good if you want more crisp bits, lidded 3-quart casserole is good if you like a higher proportion of custardy deliciousness.
2bb6ba28-0a68-4611-b83b-a95e674e244c Bake, covered (with foil or the casserole lid) for 35 minutes. Then remove cover and bake 15 minutes more. Serve hot, with Umami Girl's Best Vegetarian Gravy.
fb5c015b-5a35-4e7d-b073-f5f668e9bda3 Bring about two inches of unsalted water to a boil in a medium pot.
fb5c015b-5a35-4e7d-b073-f5f668e9bda3 Rinse the samphire well and add it to the boiling water for one minute.
fb5c015b-5a35-4e7d-b073-f5f668e9bda3 Drain into a colander. (If you want the samphire to retain a bright green color and slightly crisper texture, you can shock it in a bowl of ice water and drain again.)
fb5c015b-5a35-4e7d-b073-f5f668e9bda3 Toss with the butter and serve.
98bf9d33-6e5a-4c98-8685-2de50e3d1d16 Preheat the oven to 375°F with the top rack in the center. Lightly grease two popover or muffin pans.
98bf9d33-6e5a-4c98-8685-2de50e3d1d16 In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and water. Slowly drizzle in the melted butter while whisking. Add the flour and salt and mix until well combined but still slightly lumpy. Divide the batter among the pans, filling each well only about 1/3 full.
98bf9d33-6e5a-4c98-8685-2de50e3d1d16 Bake for 45 minutes without opening the oven. Then cut a small slit in the top of each popover to release the steam and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Serve immediately.
bfa121a2-eb45-40cd-98d2-bb95a9e54ee7 Preheat the oven to 325°F with a rack in the middle. Melt half the butter in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onions and celery along with a generous sprinkle of salt and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened but not browned, 10 to 15 minutes. If necessary, reduce the heat to prevent browning. Transfer all the contents of the skillet to a large bowl.
bfa121a2-eb45-40cd-98d2-bb95a9e54ee7 In the same skillet, melt the remaining butter. Add the diced apples and raise the heat to high. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the apples are browned in spots but not mushy, 5 to 10 minutes. Add all the contents of the skillet to the mixing bowl with the onion mixture.
bfa121a2-eb45-40cd-98d2-bb95a9e54ee7 Add the cornbread, bread cubes, nuts, parsley, thyme, sage, and a generous sprinkle of salt and pepper to the bowl. Mix gently but well with your hands. Pour the beaten eggs and the stock over the contents of the bowl, and mix again with your hands to moisten all the bread.
bfa121a2-eb45-40cd-98d2-bb95a9e54ee7 Spoon the stuffing into a 9x13x2-inch baking dish. Bake, uncovered, for 45 minutes. Serve hot.
c897e020-9fe9-4a38-9d8c-53139f65966f Wash kale and shake to remove excess water, leaving some water clinging to leaves. Strip leaves from stems and discard stems. Cut leaves crosswise into bite-sized pieces.
c897e020-9fe9-4a38-9d8c-53139f65966f In large Dutch oven, heat 1/4 cup olive oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add stock and vinegar and raise heat to high. Begin adding kale by the handful, pausing to let it wilt as necessary, until all the kale is in the pot. Cover and reduce heat to medium-low. Cook, stirring occasionally, until kale is very tender, about 25 minutes.
c897e020-9fe9-4a38-9d8c-53139f65966f Meanwhile, in medium skillet, heat remaining 1/4 cup olive oil over medium heat until shimmering. Add onions along with pinch salt and cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned and reduced to half their original volume, about 20 minutes. Add chopped walnuts and cook 5 minutes more.
c897e020-9fe9-4a38-9d8c-53139f65966f Stir onions, walnuts and blue cheese into kale. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve hot.
15946ef4-2aac-42cb-bf5c-196df4740aa1 Preheat oven to 425°F with a rack in the center. Wash and thoroughly dry the cauliflower and cut into large florets.
15946ef4-2aac-42cb-bf5c-196df4740aa1 In a small bowl, combine the two tablespoons olive oil, chili powder, 1/4 teaspoon of the salt and some freshly ground black pepper. Place the cauliflower florets on a baking sheet and toss well with the oil mixture. Roast for 25 minutes, turning once with a spatula mid-roasting.
15946ef4-2aac-42cb-bf5c-196df4740aa1 While the cauliflower roasts, combine the extra-virgin olive oil, lime juice, cilantro, garlic, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt in a blender. Blend until smooth, stopping to scrape down sides as necessary.
15946ef4-2aac-42cb-bf5c-196df4740aa1 Serve roasted cauliflower as an appetizer/snack with dipping sauce, or drizzle it with sauce and serve as a side dish.
31b04a9f-6386-4bd4-a4fa-936e038641cd In a small pot, combine the potato slices and vinegar. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer until fork-tender, about 8 minutes. Let cool in liquid for 30 minutes. Then drain well and pat potatoes dry with paper towels.
31b04a9f-6386-4bd4-a4fa-936e038641cd Preheat the broiler with a rack about 6 inches below the heat source. Dump the potato slices onto a sheet pan, sprinkle very generously with olive oil, salt and pepper, and toss to coat. Arrange the potato slices in a single layer. Broil until lightly browned on top, about 7 minutes. Then flip the slices and broil until the underside is lightly browned, about 5 minutes more. Serve warm.
63cbc9d3-1ceb-4eb8-9c93-56c7847f8fba To char the eggplants, either set them directly on a lit gas burner or grill, or place in the oven a few inches below the heat source with the broiler on high. Allow the skin to turn completely black and flaky on the first side, then turn the eggplants with long-handled tongs to begin charring on the next side. Continue turning the eggplants every few minutes until all sides are charred.
63cbc9d3-1ceb-4eb8-9c93-56c7847f8fba When eggplants are cool enough to handle, remove the stems and peel away and discard as much of the skin as possible. You want to get rid of most of it, but don't worry if there are little bits left on here and there.
63cbc9d3-1ceb-4eb8-9c93-56c7847f8fba Add the eggplant flesh, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, salt, cumin, and pepper to a food processor fitted with the blade. Pulse to blend thoroughly. Taste and adjust seasoning.
63cbc9d3-1ceb-4eb8-9c93-56c7847f8fba Scrape baba ghanoush onto a serving plate, drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with parsley. Serve with pita wedges or crackers.
3b7125a4-68d3-4a4a-9c36-16cfaf9ef311 Peel the potatoes and cut lengthwise into quarters. Contrary to what you might normally do, don't put the peeled potatoes in a bowl of water, because you want to keep all the starch. Just leave them on the counter. Don't worry if they brown a bit.
3b7125a4-68d3-4a4a-9c36-16cfaf9ef311 Peel and quarter the onion.
3b7125a4-68d3-4a4a-9c36-16cfaf9ef311 Set up a food processor with the grating blade. Grate the potatoes and onions in two batches and add them to a strainer set over a large mixing bowl. Squeeze out as much moisture as you can with your hands, then let the mixture rest and drain for three minutes or so.
3b7125a4-68d3-4a4a-9c36-16cfaf9ef311 Pour off all the liquid from the bowl, but leave the layer of starch that's accumulated at the bottom. Add grated potatoes and onions to the bowl.
3b7125a4-68d3-4a4a-9c36-16cfaf9ef311 Mix in beaten eggs, matzo meal, melted butter, salt, pepper, and baking powder.
3b7125a4-68d3-4a4a-9c36-16cfaf9ef311 Pour safflower oil into a large frying pan to a depth of about 1/8 inch. Heat oil over medium-high until it thins and becomes shimmery. Use a soup spoon to scoop little mounds of the potato mixture into the skillet (3 tablespoons at a time makes nice, diminutive latkes). Gently flatten the pancakes. Don't crowd the skillet — leave an inch or so between latkes.
3b7125a4-68d3-4a4a-9c36-16cfaf9ef311 Fry until the underside is crispy and golden brown, then flip and fry until the second side is crispy and golden brown, about 5 minutes total. Remove cooked latkes to paper towels to drain. Continue cooking, adding more oil as necessary and adjusting the heat to keep oil hot but not smoking, until you've used all of the potato mixture.
3b7125a4-68d3-4a4a-9c36-16cfaf9ef311 Serve with applesauce, sour cream, and smoked salmon if you like.
849fcebe-196d-44a1-ab36-c79e783eade1 Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center.
849fcebe-196d-44a1-ab36-c79e783eade1 Slice baguette on the bias into 1/4-inch thick slices and brush with two tablespoons of the olive oil. Bake until lightly toasted, about 10 minutes.
849fcebe-196d-44a1-ab36-c79e783eade1 Meanwhile, warm butter and remaining two tablespoons olive oil over medium-high heat in a large pan.
849fcebe-196d-44a1-ab36-c79e783eade1 Add sage and thyme and cook for a minute, stirring frequently, until fragrant. Butter will brown.
849fcebe-196d-44a1-ab36-c79e783eade1 Add squash, salt and pepper and cook, stirring only occasionally, until squash is lightly browned in lots of spots, 5 to 10 minutes.
849fcebe-196d-44a1-ab36-c79e783eade1 Stir in walnuts and transfer pan to oven.
849fcebe-196d-44a1-ab36-c79e783eade1 Roast until squash is very tender and will fall apart when stirred, about 20 minutes.
849fcebe-196d-44a1-ab36-c79e783eade1 Remove from oven and stir in sherry vinegar.
849fcebe-196d-44a1-ab36-c79e783eade1 Spread some ricotta onto each toast and top with some butternut squash mixture.
849fcebe-196d-44a1-ab36-c79e783eade1 Press a few pomegranate seeds into squash mixture.
849fcebe-196d-44a1-ab36-c79e783eade1 Drizzle with balsamic glaze and sprinkle with flaky salt.
849fcebe-196d-44a1-ab36-c79e783eade1 Serve warm or at room temperature
47b5ddb0-b1b1-4d97-95d1-6e11d5ff29bf In a 12-inch cast iron skillet, warm the oil over medium heat until shimmering.
47b5ddb0-b1b1-4d97-95d1-6e11d5ff29bf Add peppers and cook, tossing frequently with tongs, until soft and blistered in many spots, about 10 minutes.
47b5ddb0-b1b1-4d97-95d1-6e11d5ff29bf Sprinkle with lots of flaky sea salt and serve (with spicy mayo if you like).
f2042ea5-f61b-4c45-95ed-bdfdfb592d14 Combine all ingredients in a high-speed blender, with the liquids on the bottom.
f2042ea5-f61b-4c45-95ed-bdfdfb592d14 Blend until completely smooth.
f2042ea5-f61b-4c45-95ed-bdfdfb592d14 If you like, you can dress it up for a party by swirling it with the back of a spoon and garnishing with some olive oil, flaky sea salt, paprika, and thinly sliced scapes (or herbs of your choice).
d21a8702-3964-4773-8f18-83768db22527 Bake fries according to package instructions (generally in a single layer on a baking sheet for about 30 minutes at 425°F).
d21a8702-3964-4773-8f18-83768db22527 Meanwhile, spoon sauces and truffle salt into small bowls and arrange on a big platter.
d21a8702-3964-4773-8f18-83768db22527 When fries are ready, arrange them on the platter. You can see this in action in the video.
d21a8702-3964-4773-8f18-83768db22527 Garnish platter with cilantro leaves and lime wedges, and serve.
d619ee2e-08bf-4462-b379-62a3092510e7 Preheat oven to 450°F with a rack in the center. Place a baking rack on a rimmed half-sheet pan.
d619ee2e-08bf-4462-b379-62a3092510e7 Cut each baked potato in half lengthwise. If there's a side that's flatter (which is often true for russet potatoes), cut so that the flatter sides will be on the bottom and the cut potatoes will be wide, shallow, and stable.
d619ee2e-08bf-4462-b379-62a3092510e7 From each potato half, scoop out some of the flesh, leaving about 1/4 inch of flesh attached to the skins. (Reserve extra flesh for another use, such as Colcannon Cheddar Skillet Cakes or simply mashing up with a little milk and butter.)
d619ee2e-08bf-4462-b379-62a3092510e7 Brush tops and bottoms of potato halves with melted butter and sprinkle with fine sea salt. Place potato halves skin-side up on baking rack.
d619ee2e-08bf-4462-b379-62a3092510e7 Bake for 20 minutes. Skins will be crisp and lightly browned and flesh will be very tender on the inside.
d619ee2e-08bf-4462-b379-62a3092510e7 Flip potato halves right-side up and spoon some caramelized onions into each. Top with Gruyere. Return potatoes to oven for 5 minutes or so, until cheese is melted.
d619ee2e-08bf-4462-b379-62a3092510e7 Top each potato skin with a dollop of sour cream if you like, along with some minced chives and a bit of flaky sea salt.
b0eb98a9-1988-4853-9bb0-9e12c36e2b44 Arrange one or two small bowls for the chocolate dip onto the serving platter. (You'll pour the dip in later.)
b0eb98a9-1988-4853-9bb0-9e12c36e2b44 Gently rinse and dry all fruit.
b0eb98a9-1988-4853-9bb0-9e12c36e2b44 To prepare the apples, quarter them, remove the core from each quarter by slicing it out diagonally, and then slice each quarter into four or five slices. Granny Smith apples don't brown quickly, so you can do this in advance without worrying about it.
b0eb98a9-1988-4853-9bb0-9e12c36e2b44 To prepare the grapes, snip the stems to form little bundles of 5 to 10 grapes.
b0eb98a9-1988-4853-9bb0-9e12c36e2b44 To prepare the star fruit, trim off and discard a thin slice from each end, then slice the star fruit crosswise into about 8 star-shaped slices.
b0eb98a9-1988-4853-9bb0-9e12c36e2b44 To prepare the dragon fruit, trim off and discard a thin slice from the stem end. Quarter the dragon fruit lengthwise and then cut each quarter crosswise into slices. The pink skin is not edible, but it's so beautiful that I like to leave it on. It's very easy for eaters to peel away from the edible flesh and gives them something to hold onto while eating.
b0eb98a9-1988-4853-9bb0-9e12c36e2b44 To prepare the kiwis, peel off the furry skin with a vegetable peeler or paring knife. Slice kiwis crosswise into rounds.
b0eb98a9-1988-4853-9bb0-9e12c36e2b44 To prepare the watermelon, cut a baby watermelon in half crosswise and reserve half for another use. Place the half watermelon cut side down and cut it into four quarters. Slice each quarter crosswise into triangular slices.
b0eb98a9-1988-4853-9bb0-9e12c36e2b44 To prepare the strawberries, either leave whole if they're smaller or remove leaves and cut into halves or quarters if they're large.
b0eb98a9-1988-4853-9bb0-9e12c36e2b44 To prepare cape gooseberries, remove papery hulls and wash well to remove as much of sticky exterior coating as is reasonable. You may not be able to remove it all, and that's okay.
bb6c29dc-e7e1-48b6-8431-4eef43d00881 In a small pot, stir together sake, mirin, soy sauce, and sugar. Warm over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until sugar is dissolved.
bb6c29dc-e7e1-48b6-8431-4eef43d00881 Off the heat, add one heaping cup of ice to the pot to both dilute and chill the marinade. (Alternatively, you can place the ice in a 4-cup glass measuring cup or nonreactive bowl and pour the marinade overtop.)
bb6c29dc-e7e1-48b6-8431-4eef43d00881 Place peeled seven-minute eggs into marinade, cover tightly, and refrigerate for about 24 hours, turning once or twice if you think of it.
bb6c29dc-e7e1-48b6-8431-4eef43d00881 For less intense flavor, you can remove the eggs at any point after about eight hours. For more intense flavor you can let the eggs marinate a bit longer. However, the salt and sugar in the marinade will make the eggs tough eventually, so don't leave them for more than about 36 hours.
97117da2-2d98-4543-8ab2-e221001221d6 To cook the spinach, place it and two tablespoons water in a microwave-safe, lidded container and cook on high until just hot, about four minutes depending on your microwave.
97117da2-2d98-4543-8ab2-e221001221d6 When cool enough to handle, place spinach in a fine-mesh strainer and press out all the liquid you can with a fork or spoon, or with your fingers.
97117da2-2d98-4543-8ab2-e221001221d6 In a mixing bowl, stir vegetable recipe mix into mayonnaise and sour cream. Stir in water chestnuts and then spinach, breaking up any clumps. We like to use a fork to mix in the spinach.
97117da2-2d98-4543-8ab2-e221001221d6 Chill, covered, for at least two hours.
97117da2-2d98-4543-8ab2-e221001221d6 Slice the top off of a sourdough boule and cut or tear out most of the soft insides, leaving about a 1/4- to 1/2-inch layer of bread inside the crust. You can cube the bread you removed and serve it for dipping, or pulse it in a food processor and use as fresh breadcrumbs in other recipes. (Fresh breadcrumbs freeze well.)
97117da2-2d98-4543-8ab2-e221001221d6 Fill bread bowl with dip place, in the center of a serving platter, and surround with fresh veggies for dipping.
545d1b34-e2e1-4e26-869c-d4c4686ddd2f Prepare one or two batches of classic deviled eggs, depending on the size of your party and what else you're serving. Figure on one to two whole eggs per person depending on circumstances. Set them out on a serving tray near the beginning of the buffet line.
545d1b34-e2e1-4e26-869c-d4c4686ddd2f Set out toppings in small bowls. Be thoughtful about grouping ingredients together so as not to give your guests analysis paralysis, and also about setting out serving utensils where needed. Sauces like sriracha can stay right in the bottle, as long as it's been reasonably well maintained.
545d1b34-e2e1-4e26-869c-d4c4686ddd2f Place a stack of small plates and a stack of napkins at the start of the buffet line. Depending on your toppings, you may want to include forks as well.
1c86d805-95bf-4e19-8133-7086cdcab3e3 Slice each egg in half lengthwise and carefully remove yolks to a medium bowl.
1c86d805-95bf-4e19-8133-7086cdcab3e3 Mash yolks well with a fork.
1c86d805-95bf-4e19-8133-7086cdcab3e3 Chop any large pieces of vegetables in the giardiniera into bite-sized pieces. Then take about 1/4 of the giardiniera and mince it finely.
1c86d805-95bf-4e19-8133-7086cdcab3e3 Add mayonnaise, mustard, salt, and pepper and continue mashing and blending with the fork until yolk mixture is creamy. Stir in shallot and finely minced giardiniera.
1c86d805-95bf-4e19-8133-7086cdcab3e3 Using a piping bag fitted with a plain tip, a resealable plastic bag with one of the bottom corners snipped off, or a spoon, pipe or spoon the yolk mixture back into the egg halves.
1c86d805-95bf-4e19-8133-7086cdcab3e3 Garnish each egg with a generous spoonful of additional giardiniera and serve.
bbae86b7-51e5-445b-9eb6-2fa3d7002a7c Cook bacon according to package instructions until crisp. (We love to make bacon in the oven.) Finely crumble or chop two slices. Cut each of the remaining 8 slices into 3 equal pieces.
bbae86b7-51e5-445b-9eb6-2fa3d7002a7c Slice each egg in half lengthwise and carefully remove yolks to a medium bowl.
bbae86b7-51e5-445b-9eb6-2fa3d7002a7c Mash yolks well with a fork.
bbae86b7-51e5-445b-9eb6-2fa3d7002a7c Add mayonnaise, mustard, salt, and pepper and continue mashing and blending with the fork until yolk mixture is creamy. Stir in shallot, minced sun-dried tomato and crumbled bacon.
bbae86b7-51e5-445b-9eb6-2fa3d7002a7c Using a piping bag fitted with a plain tip, a resealable plastic bag with one of the bottom corners snipped off, or a spoon, pipe or spoon the yolk mixture back into the egg halves.
bbae86b7-51e5-445b-9eb6-2fa3d7002a7c Garnish each egg with a piece of bacon, a piece of blue cheese, a piece of sun-dried tomato, a slice of black olive, and a spinach or arugula leaf.
5436155f-6cf2-4304-80d3-546bbb6e81aa Slice each egg in half lengthwise and carefully remove yolks to a medium bowl.
5436155f-6cf2-4304-80d3-546bbb6e81aa Mash yolks well with a fork.
5436155f-6cf2-4304-80d3-546bbb6e81aa Add mayonnaise, mustard, salt, and pepper and continue mashing and blending with the fork until yolk mixture is creamy. Stir in shallot.
5436155f-6cf2-4304-80d3-546bbb6e81aa Using a piping bag fitted with a plain tip, a resealable plastic bag with one of the bottom corners snipped off, or a spoon, pipe or spoon the yolk mixture back into the egg halves.
5436155f-6cf2-4304-80d3-546bbb6e81aa Garnish each egg with a piece of blue cheese, a generous amount of Frank's Red Hot, and a celery leaf, and serve.
214efd60-35a0-4434-9cdf-ce127f18209f Slice each egg in half lengthwise and carefully remove yolks to a medium bowl.
214efd60-35a0-4434-9cdf-ce127f18209f Mash yolks well with a fork.
214efd60-35a0-4434-9cdf-ce127f18209f Add mayonnaise, mustard, salt, and pepper and continue mashing and blending with the fork until yolk mixture is creamy. Stir in shallot.
214efd60-35a0-4434-9cdf-ce127f18209f Using a piping bag fitted with a plain tip, a resealable plastic bag with one of the bottom corners snipped off, or a spoon, pipe or spoon the yolk mixture back into the egg halves.
214efd60-35a0-4434-9cdf-ce127f18209f Spoon about 1/2 teaspoon of crème fraîche onto each piece and top with a little bit of caviar. Garnish with a couple of snipped fresh chive pieces and serve.
06f516e2-c846-4eb1-b2ed-980337a3b9c5 Slice each egg in half lengthwise and carefully remove yolks to a medium bowl.
06f516e2-c846-4eb1-b2ed-980337a3b9c5 Mash yolks well with a fork.
06f516e2-c846-4eb1-b2ed-980337a3b9c5 Add spinach dip and shallot and continue mashing and blending with the fork until yolk mixture is creamy.
06f516e2-c846-4eb1-b2ed-980337a3b9c5 Using a piping bag fitted with a plain tip, a resealable plastic bag with one of the bottom corners snipped off, or a spoon, pipe or spoon the yolk mixture back into the egg halves. Garnish with additional greens if you like, and serve.
95aca8ad-0820-4fc2-a648-df716a0045dd Slice each egg in half lengthwise and carefully remove yolks to a medium bowl. Mash yolks well with a fork.
95aca8ad-0820-4fc2-a648-df716a0045dd Add mayonnaise, miso, tamari, mirin, rice vinegar, toasted sesame oil, and pepper and continue mashing and blending with the fork until yolk mixture is creamy. Finely chop the 1/4 cup of shiitake bacon and stir into yolk mixture.
95aca8ad-0820-4fc2-a648-df716a0045dd Using a piping bag fitted with a large star tip or plain tip, a resealable plastic bag with one of the bottom corners snipped off, or a spoon, pipe or spoon the yolk mixture back into the egg halves.
95aca8ad-0820-4fc2-a648-df716a0045dd Garnish each egg half with a piece of shiitake bacon, a dot of sriracha and a sprinkle of gomasio.
54cc061b-a858-4475-a350-90c14cf3ef5a Slice each egg in half lengthwise and carefully remove yolks to a medium bowl.
54cc061b-a858-4475-a350-90c14cf3ef5a Mash yolks well with a fork.
54cc061b-a858-4475-a350-90c14cf3ef5a Add mayonnaise, crème fraîche, mustard, salt, and pepper and continue mashing and blending with the fork until yolk mixture is creamy. Stir in shallot.
54cc061b-a858-4475-a350-90c14cf3ef5a Using a piping bag fitted with a plain tip, a resealable plastic bag with one of the bottom corners snipped off, or a spoon, pipe or spoon the yolk mixture back into the egg halves.
54cc061b-a858-4475-a350-90c14cf3ef5a In a small frying pan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add panko and cook, stirring frequently and watching carefully, until lightly browned. Let cool for a few minutes before proceeding.
54cc061b-a858-4475-a350-90c14cf3ef5a Shortly before serving, garnish each deviled egg with a small piece of smoked salmon, a few capers, a sprinkle of chives, and a sprinkle of toasted panko.
5c4c48e1-f16e-4c40-9a4a-e47bd6154b5f Cook bacon according to package instructions until crisp. (We love to make bacon in the oven.) Finely crumble or chop two slices. Cut each of the remaining 8 slices into 3 equal pieces.
5c4c48e1-f16e-4c40-9a4a-e47bd6154b5f Slice each egg in half lengthwise and carefully remove yolks to a medium bowl. Mash yolks well with a fork. Add mayonnaise, mustard, salt, and pepper and continue mashing and blending with the fork until yolk mixture is creamy. Stir in shallot, minced sun-dried tomato and crumbled bacon.
5c4c48e1-f16e-4c40-9a4a-e47bd6154b5f Using a piping bag fitted with a plain tip or a star tip, a resealable plastic bag with one of the bottom corners snipped off, or a spoon, pipe or spoon the yolk mixture back into the egg halves.
5c4c48e1-f16e-4c40-9a4a-e47bd6154b5f To garnish each piece, arrange one cut piece of bacon, one small piece of sun-dried tomato and one parsley leaf in the yolk mixture.
5c4c48e1-f16e-4c40-9a4a-e47bd6154b5f Deviled eggs can be made up to a day or two in advance of serving and stored, tightly covered, in the fridge, but hold off on garnishing until right before serving.
b206187a-b49b-49bf-9c5d-249c5e8f4e43 Slice each egg in half lengthwise and carefully remove yolks to a medium bowl.
b206187a-b49b-49bf-9c5d-249c5e8f4e43 Mash yolks well with a fork.
b206187a-b49b-49bf-9c5d-249c5e8f4e43 Add mayonnaise, mustard, salt, and pepper and continue mashing and blending with the fork until yolk mixture is creamy. Stir in shallot.
b206187a-b49b-49bf-9c5d-249c5e8f4e43 Using a piping bag fitted with a plain tip, a resealable plastic bag with one of the bottom corners snipped off, or a spoon, pipe or spoon the yolk mixture back into the egg halves. Sprinkle with paprika and serve.
4109a8b6-e410-4e74-99aa-dcc7d73bbb23 Preheat oven to 450°F with a rack in the center. Place a baking rack on a rimmed half-sheet pan.
4109a8b6-e410-4e74-99aa-dcc7d73bbb23 Cut each baked potato in half lengthwise. If there's a side that's flatter (which is often true for russet potatoes), cut so that the flatter sides will be on the bottom and the cut potatoes will be wide, shallow, and stable.
4109a8b6-e410-4e74-99aa-dcc7d73bbb23 From each potato half, scoop out some of the flesh, leaving about 1/4 inch of flesh attached to the skins. (Reserve extra flesh for another use, such as Colcannon Cheddar Skillet Cakes or simply mashing up with a little milk and butter.)
4109a8b6-e410-4e74-99aa-dcc7d73bbb23 Brush tops and bottoms of potato halves with melted butter and sprinkle with fine sea salt. Place potato halves skin-side up on baking rack.
4109a8b6-e410-4e74-99aa-dcc7d73bbb23 Bake for 20 minutes. Skins will be crisp and lightly browned and flesh will be very tender on the inside.
4109a8b6-e410-4e74-99aa-dcc7d73bbb23 Flip potato halves right-side up and sprinkle some minced shallot into each. Top with cheddar. Return potatoes to oven for 5 minutes or so, until cheese is melted.
4109a8b6-e410-4e74-99aa-dcc7d73bbb23 Top each potato skin with a dollop of sour cream, about a tablespoon of crumbled bacon OR shiitake bacon bits, some minced chives, a shot of hot sauce, and a bit of flaky sea salt.
1e7a1281-4e08-49bf-be12-15e7ea734245 Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment.
1e7a1281-4e08-49bf-be12-15e7ea734245 Wearing latex gloves, slice each jalapeño in half lengthwise. Scoop out and discard seeds. The heat of jalapeños comes from the capsaicin in the white inner membranes. We usually remove all or most of this, too, so kids can enjoy this dish. If you want more heat, leave some or all of the white ribs intact.
1e7a1281-4e08-49bf-be12-15e7ea734245 In a medium mixing bowl, stir together the cream cheese, shallot, and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt.
1e7a1281-4e08-49bf-be12-15e7ea734245 Spoon some of the mixture into each jalapeño half and smooth the top.
1e7a1281-4e08-49bf-be12-15e7ea734245 Place stuffed jalapeños on lined baking sheet and sprinkle with grated cheddar. Place in oven for about 15 minutes, until peppers have softened and cheese is soft and bubbly. Then switch the oven to broil to brown the tops a bit. This will only take a minute or two.
1e7a1281-4e08-49bf-be12-15e7ea734245 While the poppers bake, melt the butter in a small frying pan over medium heat. Add the panko and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and cook, stirring frequently and watching carefully, until lightly browned. (Panko tends to hang out at the pale stage for minutes up on minutes and then burn in a flash, so pay attention.)
1e7a1281-4e08-49bf-be12-15e7ea734245 Sprinkle a little of the panko on top of each popper and serve warm.
f3764894-327e-4dcf-a5ef-ce32061a5a0a Spread a tablespoon or two of bean dip onto each toast.
f3764894-327e-4dcf-a5ef-ce32061a5a0a Slice tomatoes 1/4-inch thick and cut each slice in half. Line up the flat side of the tomato with one of the edges of the toast (if you're into that sort of thing).
f3764894-327e-4dcf-a5ef-ce32061a5a0a Garnish each piece with a bit of sun-dried tomato, herbs and pine nuts and sprinkle with flaky salt. Serve immediately.
db6498ea-1d3e-4ee2-a9bd-b5a0cee7d26e Into the bowl of a food processor fitted with the blade, add the beans, garlic, shallot, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, pepper, and half the sun dried tomato pieces.
db6498ea-1d3e-4ee2-a9bd-b5a0cee7d26e Process dip until perfectly smooth.
db6498ea-1d3e-4ee2-a9bd-b5a0cee7d26e With a spoon or spatula, stir in half the pesto until streaked throughout but not well mixed.
db6498ea-1d3e-4ee2-a9bd-b5a0cee7d26e Scrape int
db6498ea-1d3e-4ee2-a9bd-b5a0cee7d26e o a wide, shallow serving bowl and garnish with remaining pesto, sun dried tomato, and pine nuts. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with flaky sea salt if you like.
db6498ea-1d3e-4ee2-a9bd-b5a0cee7d26e Serve with raw veggies for dipping.
23bb8976-7d68-4118-8dd5-9ec7603406db Peel the eggs and slice in half lengthwise. Use a spoon to carefully scoop the yolks into a medium mixing bowl, and place whites on a serving platter.
23bb8976-7d68-4118-8dd5-9ec7603406db Add the mayonnaise, mustard, salt and pepper to the bowl and mix well with a fork until the yolks are incorporated into the mayo and the mixture is smooth and even.
23bb8976-7d68-4118-8dd5-9ec7603406db Use a fork to flake the tuna into the mixing bowl. Add shallot, olives, sun-dried tomato and parsley and mix with a fork until nice and creamy.
23bb8976-7d68-4118-8dd5-9ec7603406db Using a piping bag fitted with a star tip, a resealable plastic bag with one of the bottom corners snipped off, or a spoon, pipe or spoon the yolk mixture back into the egg halves.
4cbf5373-9863-4759-a0e5-f8285ff076b3 In a medium mixing bowl, stir together the flour and salt.
4cbf5373-9863-4759-a0e5-f8285ff076b3 Pour in the boiling water a little at a time and mix with a spoon until incorporated.
4cbf5373-9863-4759-a0e5-f8285ff076b3 Pour in the cold water a little at a time, continuing to mix until you have a very wet, sticky dough.
4cbf5373-9863-4759-a0e5-f8285ff076b3 Sprinkle plenty of flour onto a work surface and your hands. Scrape dough from bowl onto work surface and knead, adding more flour as necessary to prevent sticking, until dough is smooth. (See video for visual cues here and throughout the recipe.)
4cbf5373-9863-4759-a0e5-f8285ff076b3 Place dough in a clean bowl, cover with a clean kitchen towel, and let rest while you make the filling.
3be5932b-1010-45ed-a9c8-2ed51163ec29 Peel and clean the shrimp, leaving tails on if you like. (Tails make a nice presentation and a useful handle, but you can serve the appetizer with cocktail forks or toothpicks instead.)
3be5932b-1010-45ed-a9c8-2ed51163ec29 Cut each slice of prosciutto into two or three long strips. Wrap one strip around each shrimp. Place shrimp on a rimmed baking sheet lined with a piece of parchment paper that just fits.
3be5932b-1010-45ed-a9c8-2ed51163ec29 Melt butter in a small pot. Brush about half of the butter over the shrimp. Preheat broiler to high.
3be5932b-1010-45ed-a9c8-2ed51163ec29 While broiler preheats, add garlic and sage to remaining butter. Cook on medium heat for a minute or two, until very fragrant.
3be5932b-1010-45ed-a9c8-2ed51163ec29 Broil shrimp for about 90 seconds, until shrimp are turning opaque and prosciutto begins to cook. Flip shrimp with tongs and broil about 60 seconds more, until just cooked through.
3be5932b-1010-45ed-a9c8-2ed51163ec29 Transfer shrimp to a serving platter. Brush with garlic sage butter and sprinkle with black pepper. Serve immediately.
f51ab9be-926b-417c-b45b-efce1115cb12 Arrange arugula on a dinner plate and place burrata in the center.
f51ab9be-926b-417c-b45b-efce1115cb12 Arrange prosciutto, salami and tomatoes in whatever way makes you happy.
f51ab9be-926b-417c-b45b-efce1115cb12 Drizzle it all with olive oil and balsamic glaze and sprinkle with salt. Cut into the burrata a bit so your guests won't feel shy.
f51ab9be-926b-417c-b45b-efce1115cb12 Serve with small plates and forks and some good bread if you like.
9c2be3b0-d9d8-4bd5-b265-6d810c7f5712 Juice the limes into a medium mixing bowl. It might seem like there's a lot of juice, but you won’t be sorry. Add the onion and stir to coat. Let sit while you prepare the avocados.
9c2be3b0-d9d8-4bd5-b265-6d810c7f5712 Halve and pit each avocado. Dice flesh and scoop from skins into mixing bowl, tossing with lime juice as you go to prevent browning. Add salt and mash avocado to desired consistency. I like to leave a some pieces diced and mash some more thoroughly for a little textural interest. Add cilantro and jalapeño if using and stir to combine. Serve with tortilla chips and lots of good beer.
29d65ffb-1734-4cb4-999e-014a14d22bba Spread a generous amount of butter onto each baguette slice.
29d65ffb-1734-4cb4-999e-014a14d22bba Top with a few radish slices and sprinkle with fleur de sel.
17a416f9-0525-43d5-9b1e-e36d42ccc4a7 Fill a large pot halfway with water. Add 1 tablespoon salt. Bring water to a boil over high heat.
17a416f9-0525-43d5-9b1e-e36d42ccc4a7 Meanwhile, fill a large bowl with ice water.
17a416f9-0525-43d5-9b1e-e36d42ccc4a7 When water boils, add broccoli and cook for one to two minutes, until bright green and not raw. Remove with a strainer to ice water.
17a416f9-0525-43d5-9b1e-e36d42ccc4a7 Repeat with asparagus.
17a416f9-0525-43d5-9b1e-e36d42ccc4a7 When vegetables are cool, blot dry and arrange on a large platter with endive and bread slices.
17a416f9-0525-43d5-9b1e-e36d42ccc4a7 In a small pot, heat the olive oil and butter over medium heat until the butter starts to foam.
17a416f9-0525-43d5-9b1e-e36d42ccc4a7 Add garlic and anchovy and cook, mashing anchovy against bottom and sides of pot with a spoon, until most of the anchovy has dissolved into the sauce, about 3 minutes.
17a416f9-0525-43d5-9b1e-e36d42ccc4a7 Remove from heat, season to taste with pepper, and pour into a small bowl (or serve directly from pot).
17a416f9-0525-43d5-9b1e-e36d42ccc4a7 Serve warm, over a little Sterno burner or tea light if you like, with crudités and crusty bread.
bfa457ce-d3eb-4ea0-9d05-c069f6076064 Bake tater tots according to package directions. In the last minute of baking, sprinkle on about 2/3 of the cheese so it melts.
bfa457ce-d3eb-4ea0-9d05-c069f6076064 Heap cheesy tots onto a serving plate. In a small bowl, mix together the sour cream, onion powder and salt. Spoon over tater tots. Top with tomatoes, olives, onion, cilantro, jalapeño and remaining cheese. Serve immediately.
f5b7eb46-33f4-46d0-997f-f809bdd1640d Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center.
f5b7eb46-33f4-46d0-997f-f809bdd1640d Brush olive oil over the surface of the naan. In a small bowl, stir together the tomato paste and tomato sauce. Spread sauce over naan.
f5b7eb46-33f4-46d0-997f-f809bdd1640d Sprinkle 2/3 of the pecorino over tomato sauce. Arrange mozzarella overtop.
f5b7eb46-33f4-46d0-997f-f809bdd1640d Place pizzas directly on oven rack and bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Remove from oven and sprinkle with remaining pecorino, some pepper and basil if desired. Serve immediately, cut into slices of whatever size and shape you like you like.
18ff467d-ea0c-4552-bb92-f2102be2db09 Preheat oven to 350°F with a rack in the center.
18ff467d-ea0c-4552-bb92-f2102be2db09 In a medium bowl, stir together the cream cheese, mayonnaise, cheddar, 1/2 cup of the parmigiano, the jalapeños and the olives until well mixed.
18ff467d-ea0c-4552-bb92-f2102be2db09 Transfer to a baking dish. In a small bowl, stir together the remaining 1/4 cup parmgiano reggiano and the panko. Sprinkle over the top of the dip.
18ff467d-ea0c-4552-bb92-f2102be2db09 Bake until hot and bubbly, about 20-25 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.
bf249dbe-48ea-4fda-8aa2-7d69c4bf0315 Preheat oven to 400°F with two racks close to the center.
bf249dbe-48ea-4fda-8aa2-7d69c4bf0315 On a piece of parchment, roll out the puff pastry sheet(s). If you're using one 14-ounce sheet, roll it out into a 16-inch square. If you're using two 8 1/2-ounce sheets, roll each out into a 12-inch by 14-inch rectangle.
bf249dbe-48ea-4fda-8aa2-7d69c4bf0315 In a small bowl, mix together the salt, cayenne, nutmeg and black pepper. Sprinkle over puff pastry. Next, sprinkle the shredded cheese over the puff pastry. It's best if you vaguely aim for even distribution but inevitably don't achieve it, which will make each bite a little different in a good way. Press down lightly with your hands to stick the toppings to the pastry.
bf249dbe-48ea-4fda-8aa2-7d69c4bf0315 Fold each sheet in half (if using the two puff pastry rectangles, fold over the longer side to make 12-inch by 7-inch rectangles), then roll out again until the short side reaches 12 inches. Slice each sheet into 1-inch by 12-inch strips.
bf249dbe-48ea-4fda-8aa2-7d69c4bf0315 Line two baking sheets with parchment. Twist the two ends of each strip in opposite directions a few times and place twists on baking sheets with a little space in between. Brush with cream or egg wash.
bf249dbe-48ea-4fda-8aa2-7d69c4bf0315 Bake for about 15 minutes, until puffed and light brown. Rotate the pans and swap their oven positions halfway through. (Alternatively you can bake the pans one at a time in the center of the oven.) Cool slightly or completely, whichever you prefer, before serving. They're best on the day you make them.
c769fa01-2cf8-438a-ba63-e3322c61ed9d Mix together the ketchup, horseradish, tabasco, gin, celery salt, salt and lemon juice. Chill until ready to serve. Stir in parsley right before serving.
c769fa01-2cf8-438a-ba63-e3322c61ed9d Peel and devein shrimp, leaving tails attached. Place peels into a large pot. Add water, 1 tablespoon of the salt, wine or vermouth, peppercorns, coriander seeds, bay leaves, onion, tarragon and lemon. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and let sit 30 minutes more, then strain broth through a fine sieve into a fresh pot.
c769fa01-2cf8-438a-ba63-e3322c61ed9d Bring stock to a boil, then remove from heat. Add shrimp and cover. Leave for 3 minutes (still off the heat -- the shrimp "poach" in the residual heat and remain amazingly tender).
c769fa01-2cf8-438a-ba63-e3322c61ed9d Fill a large bowl with ice water and the remaining tablespoon salt. Add shrimp and leave until just opaque, 3 minutes or a shade more if the shrimp are very big. Chill in fridge (I usually wrap in paper towels and put in a gallon zip top bag) until ready to serve.
035b96a6-0956-45c0-af8a-01601f8a840f Defrost the puff pastry in the fridge overnight or on the counter for a couple of hours.
035b96a6-0956-45c0-af8a-01601f8a840f Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center. Unfold the puff pastry and roll it out gently with a rolling pin until it grows by 2-3 inches horizontally and vertically. Cut it into quarters, and then cut each quarter into six equal rectangles. Tuck each rectangle in to a mini muffin cup and set aside.
035b96a6-0956-45c0-af8a-01601f8a840f Trim the root end and the dark green leaves from the leeks and discard. Slice the remaining white and light green parts in half lengthwise and then cut crosswise into thin half-moons. Place in a colander and rinse thoroughly, then shake off any excess water.
035b96a6-0956-45c0-af8a-01601f8a840f Melt the butter in a frying pan over medium heat. Add leeks, a generous pinch of salt and some freshly ground black pepper and cook, stirring from time to time to prevent browning, until tender and reduced in volume by half, 5-10 minutes. Stir in cream, nutmeg and thyme and continue to cook until cream is thick enough to coat leeks without leaving liquid in the pan, about 5 minutes more. Remove from heat, crumble feta overtop and stir to incorporate.
035b96a6-0956-45c0-af8a-01601f8a840f Beat egg in a small bowl with one teaspoon water.
035b96a6-0956-45c0-af8a-01601f8a840f Spoon a small amount of leek filling into each prepared muffin cup. Brush with a little bit of egg wash. Bake for about 20 minutes, until pastry is nicely browned. Serve warm.
b0c275fb-7949-4854-857f-640afff1e632 Scrub the oysters well under running water to remove all sand and dirt. To shuck each oyster, hold it in a kitchen towel with the cupped side of the shell facing down so you won't lose the beautiful liquor when you open it. Insert the tip of an oyster knife firmly into the hinge and twist until it pops open. Then run the knife across the inside of the top shell. Watch the video linked in the notes section below to see this done.
b0c275fb-7949-4854-857f-640afff1e632 Run the oyster knife between the meat and the bottom shell to fully release the meat from the shell so it can be slurped up later. Place shucked oysters on a rimmed baking pan lined with a big sheet of gently crumpled aluminum foil to prevent tipping. Discard top shells.
b0c275fb-7949-4854-857f-640afff1e632 In a small pot, melt the butter with the shallot over medium heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the basil, parsley and lemon zest.
b0c275fb-7949-4854-857f-640afff1e632 Line the bottom of a heavy 12-inch frying pan with about 1/4 inch of Kosher salt. (I really prefer a cast iron skillet for its superior heat retention). Preheat the pan over medium-high heat for at least 5 minutes, until the salt starts to make some little popping noises. Then quickly arrange the shucked oysters in the pan and top each with a spoonful of the herb butter. Cover the pan with a lid (carefully use foil if you don't have a lid that fits) and cook for three minutes, until the oysters are just opaque. They'll continue to cook a bit from the residual heat in the pan. Sprinkle with a little bit of chopped prosciutto and a squeeze of lemon juice. Serve warm straight from the pan.
f1815d85-6b3e-422e-ab63-4ba72a5ce7b4 On a countertop or table, arrange a few nice-looking boards and three small bowls. Arrange cheeses, meats, fruits, olives, bread or crackers and other ingredients as if they just rolled out of fridge into their awesome, awesome life. Share with as many friends as you can find, or just a few if that sounds like more fun. Serve with plenty of wine.
75f6383f-1507-4164-92e9-47cb2882f6a8 In a small pot, melt the butter over medium heat. Stir in the flour and let bubble for about a minute. Pour in the milk, whisk until smooth, then bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer about 5 minutes until quite thick. Off the heat, stir in sour cream and then grated cheese. If cheese doesn't fully melt, you can help it along over low heat, stirring constantly. Stop when it's just shy of fully melted and let the residual heat do the rest so the sauce doesn't break. Set aside to cool slightly.
75f6383f-1507-4164-92e9-47cb2882f6a8 Wash and dry the cilantro and trim off the very bottoms of the stems. In a high-speed blender or a food processor, combine cilantro (leaves, stems and all), olive oil, lime juice and salt. Process until smooth.
75f6383f-1507-4164-92e9-47cb2882f6a8 In a medium bowl, pour the lime juice and a sprinkle of salt over the cabbage and massage a bit with your hands to tenderize cabbage.
75f6383f-1507-4164-92e9-47cb2882f6a8 Arrange the tortilla chips on a large platter or rimmed baking sheet. Heat the refried beans in the microwave until nice and hot, then dollop over tortilla chips. Pour the cheese sauce overtop, then sprinkle on the cabbage, hatch chilis, tomatoes and red onion. Finish by drizzling with cilantro sauce. Serve immediately.
b2065f03-abe4-4d21-ac7a-07294d59fae5 Cook and drain edamame according to package directions. (This is a great time to use the microwave.)
b2065f03-abe4-4d21-ac7a-07294d59fae5 In a small bowl, mix together the salt and garlic powder.
b2065f03-abe4-4d21-ac7a-07294d59fae5 While edamame are still very hot, sprinkle with garlic salt and chili flakes. Toss to distribute evenly. Serve immediately.
9b648cde-c13d-47c1-8ded-1d10ebea4992 Pop the popcorn kernels with an air popper into a large bowl.
9b648cde-c13d-47c1-8ded-1d10ebea4992 Drizzle with the olive oil.
9b648cde-c13d-47c1-8ded-1d10ebea4992 With a mortar and pestle or spice grinder, grind the nutritional yeast and salt together until you have a fine powder. Sprinkle over popcorn and toss to coat.
e6d2cc6f-f43f-4b5d-9ea4-a205ebd0c4d9 Combine all ingredients in the bowl of a food processor fitted with the blade.
e6d2cc6f-f43f-4b5d-9ea4-a205ebd0c4d9 Process until smooth and creamy.
e6d2cc6f-f43f-4b5d-9ea4-a205ebd0c4d9 Serve with chips, with vegetables, in a sandwich, on a bagel, from a spoon, yadda yadda.
b329a49c-87c6-4303-9490-5bf10ed3ed14 Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center.
b329a49c-87c6-4303-9490-5bf10ed3ed14 Pour chickpeas into a colander, discarding liquid, and rinse thoroughly.
b329a49c-87c6-4303-9490-5bf10ed3ed14 Line a rimmed baking sheet with paper towels, and pour the chickpeas onto the baking sheet. Cover with additional paper towels and dry thoroughly. Discard paper towels.
b329a49c-87c6-4303-9490-5bf10ed3ed14 Spread chickpeas evenly over the surface of the baking sheet.
b329a49c-87c6-4303-9490-5bf10ed3ed14 Roast on center rack, stirring occasionally, until chickpeas are just the slightest bit soft in the center. Start testing at the 20 minute mark.
b329a49c-87c6-4303-9490-5bf10ed3ed14 Remove baking sheet from the oven and toss the chickpeas thoroughly with the oil and either the soy sauce, lime juice, and salt or the paprikas and garlic salt.
b329a49c-87c6-4303-9490-5bf10ed3ed14 Roast about 10 minutes more, just until chickpeas are crisp all the way through.
b329a49c-87c6-4303-9490-5bf10ed3ed14 If you’re making the soy and lime variety, toss with lime zest.
b329a49c-87c6-4303-9490-5bf10ed3ed14 Serve warm or at room temperature. Keeps in an airtight container at room temperature for a few days.
0c9b4ef4-4d2c-4494-9eb0-747c51cf5c0a In a large bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a dough hook, combine the water and sugar and stir to dissolve sugar. Sprinkle yeast overtop and set aside for 10 minutes in a warm spot in the kitchen. Yeast will be foamy.
0c9b4ef4-4d2c-4494-9eb0-747c51cf5c0a Add one cup of flour to the bowl and stir with a spoon or on low with the dough hook until incorporated. Then add salt and four additional cups of flour. Stir with a spoon or the dough hook until combined, about one minute.
0c9b4ef4-4d2c-4494-9eb0-747c51cf5c0a If kneading by hand, turn the dough out onto a clean work surface (no need to flour it), and knead until it loses most of its stickiness and becomes quite elastic, about ten minutes. (To knead, hold the dough in place with one hand and stretch it out in front of you with the heel of your other hand as shown in the photos above, then roll it back up on itself and repeat.) If using a stand mixer, turn machine on medium-low and let the dough hook knead for about 90 seconds, until the dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl.
0c9b4ef4-4d2c-4494-9eb0-747c51cf5c0a Add the remaining 1/2 cup of flour and knead by hand for about two minutes more or in stand mixer for one minute more, until smooth. (If using a stand mixer, turn out the dough and knead it a few times by hand at the end.) Wash and dry the bowl, then pour about a Tablespoon of the oil into it. Place the dough back in the bowl and roll it to coat lightly with the oil on all sides. Place a clean kitchen towel over the top of the bowl and set aside in a warm spot in the kitchen to rise. Dough is ready when it has approximately doubled in volume, which will take an hour or a little more depending on the temperature of your kitchen. Brush two large baking sheets lightly with some of the olive oil.
0c9b4ef4-4d2c-4494-9eb0-747c51cf5c0a Turn the dough out onto a clean work surface and punch it down a few times to release any trapped air. Divide the dough into sixteen equal pieces. Place fifteen of them back in the bowl and cover with a damp paper towel.
0c9b4ef4-4d2c-4494-9eb0-747c51cf5c0a Starting with one of the small pieces of dough, roll with your hands into an approximately 18-inch "snake," and then twist into a pretzel shape. Set pretzel on baking sheet, leaving two inches of space on all sides. Repeat with remaining dough balls. Set pretzels aside for 15 minutes for their final rise.
0c9b4ef4-4d2c-4494-9eb0-747c51cf5c0a Preheat the oven to 450°F with one rack 1/3 of the way up from the oven floor and another 1/3 of the way down from the top. If you have a convection oven, it's great to use here -- just set it to 425° instead. Fill a large, heavy pot with two inches of water, add baking soda, and bring to a boil over high heat. Lower heat to maintain a slow simmer. Place a sheet of parchment or waxed paper on the countertop next to the stove.
0c9b4ef4-4d2c-4494-9eb0-747c51cf5c0a In batches of four to six depending on the size of your pot, gently place pretzels into the simmering water and poach for one to two minutes, until they are quite puffy and floating at the top of the pot. Remove to the parchment paper.
0c9b4ef4-4d2c-4494-9eb0-747c51cf5c0a Brush a little more oil onto the baking sheets. Gently blot any moisture off each pretzel with a paper towel and place back on the baking sheets. Brush each pretzel with a little olive oil and then sprinkle with sesame seeds and a bit of coarse salt.
0c9b4ef4-4d2c-4494-9eb0-747c51cf5c0a Place one baking sheet on the lower rack and one on the upper rack of the oven. Bake pretzels for eight minutes, then reverse the positions of the baking sheets and bake about seven minutes more, until pretzels are beautifully golden brown. Serve warm or at room temperature, preferably the same day they're made.
2af6a7f6-e227-4f81-b323-e6cdbe153c3d Slice each egg in half lengthwise and carefully remove yolks to a medium bowl. Mash yolks well with a fork.
2af6a7f6-e227-4f81-b323-e6cdbe153c3d Add mayonnaise, vinegar, mustard, salt, black pepper and cayenne and continue mashing and blending with the fork until yolk mixture is creamy.
2af6a7f6-e227-4f81-b323-e6cdbe153c3d Stir in shallot and herbs. Taste for seasoning — it should be assertively flavored, since egg whites have virtually no taste.
2af6a7f6-e227-4f81-b323-e6cdbe153c3d Using a piping bag fitted with a star tip, a resealable plastic bag with one of the bottom corners snipped off, or a spoon, pipe or spoon the yolk mixture back into the egg halves.
2af6a7f6-e227-4f81-b323-e6cdbe153c3d Garnish with additional herbs, if desired.
7eca8d54-141d-411c-855e-c476c2014e11 In a 10-inch skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat until shimmering.
7eca8d54-141d-411c-855e-c476c2014e11 Add the pepitas and toss to coat with the oil.
7eca8d54-141d-411c-855e-c476c2014e11 Sprinkle on the paprika, salt, garlic powder, and cayenne pepper.
7eca8d54-141d-411c-855e-c476c2014e11 Cook, tossing frequently, until many of the pepitas have turned light brown and made a popping sound.
7eca8d54-141d-411c-855e-c476c2014e11 Pour into a small bowl and serve as a bar snack.
3386686c-7e93-4d9d-bb51-a477e6aea098 Preheat the broiler with a rack about 6 inches below the heat source. Place the strawberries, 1 teaspoon of the honey, and the mint leaves in a medium bowl and stir gently to combine. Let sit at room temperature while you prepare the rest of the components. Note: if your strawberries are not luxuriously ripe, you may need a bit more honey, so adjust according to your taste.
3386686c-7e93-4d9d-bb51-a477e6aea098 In a small bowl, mix together the goat cheese, remaining 2 teaspoons honey, lemon juice, and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
3386686c-7e93-4d9d-bb51-a477e6aea098 Brush the baguette slices lightly with the olive oil. Place under the broiler until the tops are golden brown at the edges, 1 to 2 minutes. Flip the slices and brown the other side as well.
3386686c-7e93-4d9d-bb51-a477e6aea098 To assemble the bruschetta, turn the baguette slices so the olive oil side faces up. Spread some of the goat cheese mixture on each slice, and top with a few slices of strawberry. Arrange the hors d'oeuvres on a platter and drizzle a bit more honey over each piece. Sprinkle lightly with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve at once.
3c5a46f0-2604-400c-b586-6a333776fa5c Place all ingredients in a food processor fitted with the blade.
3c5a46f0-2604-400c-b586-6a333776fa5c Blend until smooth, stopping to scrape down the sides as necessary.
3c5a46f0-2604-400c-b586-6a333776fa5c Refrigerate for a couple of hours to let the flavors commune, if possible.
3c5a46f0-2604-400c-b586-6a333776fa5c Serve as a spread for crackers or a filling for sandwiches.
2536cdf5-168c-4465-a976-305eb9a724a6 Place the goat cheese in a small, shallow serving dish (or cut it in half and place it in two dishes).
2536cdf5-168c-4465-a976-305eb9a724a6 Pour the olive oil overtop, and then sprinkle the goat cheese with the thyme, red pepper flakes, salt and black pepper.
2536cdf5-168c-4465-a976-305eb9a724a6 Leave to rest, covered with tented plastic wrap (use toothpicks to tent) in the refrigerator for at least 1/2 hour or up to a couple of days.
2536cdf5-168c-4465-a976-305eb9a724a6 Let sit at room temperature for 1/2 hour before serving as a spread for crackers or toasted slices of baguette.
b8c5305f-55dc-438f-8d56-aa2264a70b50 Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center.
b8c5305f-55dc-438f-8d56-aa2264a70b50 Slice baguette on the bias into 1/4-inch thick slices and brush with the olive oil. Place onto a baking sheet. Bake until lightly toasted, about 5 minutes.
b8c5305f-55dc-438f-8d56-aa2264a70b50 Meanwhile, melt the butter over medium heat in a wide frying pan. Add the shallot and garlic and cook, stirring once in a while, until beginning to soften, about 1 minute. Add the mushrooms along with a couple of good pinches of salt and some freshly ground black pepper, and stir to coat with butter. Cook, stirring occasionally, 5 to 8 minutes more, until the mushrooms have given off their liquid, browned slightly, and reduced to about half their original volume.
b8c5305f-55dc-438f-8d56-aa2264a70b50 Remove the pan from the heat and pour in the brandy from a measuring cup. (Don't pour directly from the bottle despite what you may have seen in the movies.) Very carefully light a long match and touch the surface of the mushroom mixture to ignite the brandy. Or, if you're cooking with gas, you can tip the pan away from you into the burner's flame until the brandy ignites. I find this method maybe a little too entertaining. Stand back until the flame dies out.
b8c5305f-55dc-438f-8d56-aa2264a70b50 Return the pan to medium heat. Add the cream and stir to combine. Simmer until the cream has thickened slightly, a minute or two. Turn off the heat and stir in the Parmesan cheese and parsley. Taste for seasoning and add additional salt and pepper if desired.
b8c5305f-55dc-438f-8d56-aa2264a70b50 Spoon mushrooms onto toasted baguette slices and serve.
fcd435ad-03c6-4ce2-aea6-28e5487cd027 Preheat oven to 425°F with a rack in the center. Wash and thoroughly dry the cauliflower and cut into large florets.
fcd435ad-03c6-4ce2-aea6-28e5487cd027 In a small bowl, combine the two tablespoons olive oil, chili powder, 1/4 teaspoon of the salt and some freshly ground black pepper. Place the cauliflower florets on a baking sheet and toss well with the oil mixture. Roast for 25 minutes, turning once with a spatula mid-roasting.
fcd435ad-03c6-4ce2-aea6-28e5487cd027 While the cauliflower roasts, combine the extra-virgin olive oil, lime juice, cilantro, garlic, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt in a blender. Blend until smooth, stopping to scrape down sides as necessary.
fcd435ad-03c6-4ce2-aea6-28e5487cd027 Serve roasted cauliflower as an appetizer/snack with dipping sauce, or drizzle it with sauce and serve as a side dish.
28928bd8-f99f-468f-8752-230b54aaa409 Place half of cheese, along with onion, garlic puree, chives, mustard and cayenne, in the bowl of a food processor fitted with the metal blade. Process until smooth.
28928bd8-f99f-468f-8752-230b54aaa409 With the motor running, add the sherry and olive oil. Process to incorporate.
28928bd8-f99f-468f-8752-230b54aaa409 Add the remaining cheese and process until very thick and smooth.
28928bd8-f99f-468f-8752-230b54aaa409 Add additional sherry 1 tablespoon at a time to thin, if necessary.
28928bd8-f99f-468f-8752-230b54aaa409 Pack into 8-ounce crocks. Refrigerate for up to one month. Bring to room temperature before serving with crackers or toasts.
b7bb5c38-7ddc-456c-84fc-41b7b141df24 In a small pot, combine the potato slices and vinegar. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer until fork-tender, about 8 minutes. Let cool in liquid for 30 minutes. Then drain well and pat potatoes dry with paper towels.
b7bb5c38-7ddc-456c-84fc-41b7b141df24 Preheat the broiler with a rack about 6 inches below the heat source. Dump the potato slices onto a sheet pan, sprinkle very generously with olive oil, salt and pepper, and toss to coat. Arrange the potato slices in a single layer. Broil until lightly browned on top, about 7 minutes. Then flip the slices and broil until the underside is lightly browned, about 5 minutes more. Serve warm.
37abeb78-ef7d-432e-8515-3d2ad3270044 Preheat the oven to 425° F. Brush a mini-muffin pan with oil or melted butter. Crack the egg into a medium bowl and beat lightly. Peel the potatoes and cut with the julienne blade of a mandoline. (Hold the potato so as to cut crosswise, not lengthwise, otherwise the pieces will be too long.) Mix the cut potatoes with the egg as you go so they don't oxidize. Mix in a good pinch of salt and some freshly ground pepper.
37abeb78-ef7d-432e-8515-3d2ad3270044 Distribute the potato mixture among 24 mini-muffin molds to make a thinnish layer on the bottom and up the sides of each mold. Be careful to leave behind or drain off any accumulated liquid in the bowl rather than adding excess liquid to the molds. Bake for 25 minutes or until lightly browned and slightly crisp.
37abeb78-ef7d-432e-8515-3d2ad3270044 Cool on a rack for 15 minutes before removing nests from pan, loosening each by running a paring knife carefully around the sides.
37abeb78-ef7d-432e-8515-3d2ad3270044 While the potato nests bake, melt the butter and olive oil in a wide frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the minced shallot and garlic. Sauté for one minute. Add the sliced mushrooms, along with a generous pinch or two of salt and some freshly ground black pepper. Sauté, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms release any liquid and it cooks off. Add the Marsala and cook, stirring once or twice, until all liquid has evaporated.
37abeb78-ef7d-432e-8515-3d2ad3270044 Turn off the heat and stir in the crème fraîche, grated cheese and tarragon.
37abeb78-ef7d-432e-8515-3d2ad3270044 Spoon a small amount of the mushroom mixture into each potato nest. Rewarm in a low oven for a few minutes before serving, if desired.
62709a5a-639d-4c8c-bb98-5cd507807a86 Preheat oven to 375°F with a rack in the center.
62709a5a-639d-4c8c-bb98-5cd507807a86 Heat the olive oil a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the ramps or leeks, along with a good pinch of salt, and sauté for about 3 minutes, until the whites start to become translucent.
62709a5a-639d-4c8c-bb98-5cd507807a86 If using frozen spinach, cook according to package directions and drain thoroughly, squeezing out as much excess water as possible, before proceeding. Add the spinach, along with another pinch of salt, and sauté until wilted. Let cool slightly, and if there is any excess moisture, drain it.
62709a5a-639d-4c8c-bb98-5cd507807a86 Combine the cream cheese, sour cream, mayonnaise, salt, and pepper in a large bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer or food processor. Mix or pulse until well combined. Add the Parmigiano cheese, the chopped sundried tomatoes and the ramp-spinach mixture and mix or pulse to incorporate.
62709a5a-639d-4c8c-bb98-5cd507807a86 Spread the dip into a medium oven-proof dish and sprinkle with the Pepper Jack cheese. Bake for 25 minutes, until the cheese is melted and browned around the edges and the dip is starting to bubble a bit. Cool slightly and serve with chips or toasts.
81470336-79b9-4e4c-9683-ac0596e662a5 To prepare the fava beans for cooking, remove them from their large outer pods. Bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil, and fill a large bowl with ice water. Blanch the beans in the boiling water for one to two minutes, until they slip fairly readily from their skins. Transfer the beans with a skimmer or slotted spoon to the ice water. When they’re cool, drain the water and remove the beans from their whitish skins.
81470336-79b9-4e4c-9683-ac0596e662a5 To make the puree, heat the ½ cup of olive oil in a medium pot over medium heat. Add the shelled, skinned beans, garlic, herbs, water, and a good couple of pinches of salt and pepper. Simmer, stirring occasionally, until the beans are very tender (about 15 minutes), adjusting the heat as necessary to prevent burning, and adding more water if necessary. Remove the pot from the heat, and remove the herb sprig. Mash the beans with the back of a spoon or pass the mixture through a food mill.
81470336-79b9-4e4c-9683-ac0596e662a5 Stir in the ¼ cup of extra virgin olive oil and a bit of water if necessary to achieve a nice, thick but spreadable consistency, along with a squeeze of lemon juice and a bit of grated zest, if desired. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with toasted baguette slices.
e75b2552-8aaf-4583-8066-68dae45944e2 In a large pot, warm the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the shallot, leek, salt, and pepper and cook until beginning to soften, about two minutes.
e75b2552-8aaf-4583-8066-68dae45944e2 Add rice, stock, water, salt, pepper, and herbs de Provence. If you're using white rice, add the carrot and celery now. If your rice cooks for longer, hold off until later.
e75b2552-8aaf-4583-8066-68dae45944e2 Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for as long as suggested on the rice packaging. (For white rice, about 20 minutes. For brown and wild rice, about 45 minutes.) With 20 minutes left on the rice cooking time, add the carrot and celery.
