1665eab0-2a1d-4885-96df-ca3bcde0e485 Place plenty of ice into a mixing glass.
1665eab0-2a1d-4885-96df-ca3bcde0e485 Pour in the mezcal, vermouth, and Campari.
1665eab0-2a1d-4885-96df-ca3bcde0e485 Stir well until chilled.
1665eab0-2a1d-4885-96df-ca3bcde0e485 Pour into a single old-fashioned glass, garnish with twist of orange peel, and serve.
f006d41c-103f-4388-97fb-ebac8c0d6c59 Pour the rye and apple cider into a champagne glass.
f006d41c-103f-4388-97fb-ebac8c0d6c59 Top up the glass with champagne and add a big squeeze of lemon juice. Serve immediately.
116c02f0-813c-4250-a637-5b51a22a8af5 Place plenty of ice into a mixing glass.
116c02f0-813c-4250-a637-5b51a22a8af5 Pour in the bourbon or rye, vermouth, and Campari.
116c02f0-813c-4250-a637-5b51a22a8af5 Stir well until chilled.
116c02f0-813c-4250-a637-5b51a22a8af5 Pour into a single old-fashioned glass, garnish with twist of orange peel, and serve.
918fccee-ab0b-4cd3-b2ed-7a67f7d76833 Fill a small glass halfway with ice.
918fccee-ab0b-4cd3-b2ed-7a67f7d76833 Pour in gin and tonic water, squeeze in lime juice, give it a quick stir, and sip away.
991f9d46-8f98-41e5-940e-257a893dc730 Fill a large wine glass halfway with ice.
991f9d46-8f98-41e5-940e-257a893dc730 Add one lime wheel and a couple of mint leaves and muddle gently.
991f9d46-8f98-41e5-940e-257a893dc730 Pour in St-Germain.
991f9d46-8f98-41e5-940e-257a893dc730 Pour in Prosecco and top with soda water. Give it a quick stir.
991f9d46-8f98-41e5-940e-257a893dc730 Garnish with mint and lime wheel and serve.
cbb7612b-8e5c-4ae1-8897-281fd4d0c10d Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice.
cbb7612b-8e5c-4ae1-8897-281fd4d0c10d Pour in vodka, Cointreau, lime juice, and cranberry juice cocktail.
cbb7612b-8e5c-4ae1-8897-281fd4d0c10d Shake well until the outside of the shaker is very cold.
cbb7612b-8e5c-4ae1-8897-281fd4d0c10d Pour into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with the orange twist or lime wedge.
8f3a3446-842f-4832-b1e5-8fdb9f497576 Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice.
8f3a3446-842f-4832-b1e5-8fdb9f497576 Pour in Aperol, vermouth, verjus, grapefruit juice, and grapefruit bitters.
8f3a3446-842f-4832-b1e5-8fdb9f497576 Shake very well and strain into a coupe glass.
8f3a3446-842f-4832-b1e5-8fdb9f497576 Top with Champagne.
8f3a3446-842f-4832-b1e5-8fdb9f497576 Garnish with a grapefruit twist and serve.
0bae6e0c-1341-4de9-a07f-053e81bda591 First, make a salt rim for your glass. Cut a notch in the middle of the lime wedge (see video for visual cues) and run it generously around the rim of a rocks glass to wet it.
0bae6e0c-1341-4de9-a07f-053e81bda591 Pour kosher salt onto a small plate and roll the outside of the glass in it so that it sticks to the lime juice. (Don't place the top of the glass perpendicular to the plate, because salt on the inside of the rim will inevitably fall into the glass and make the drink itself salty.)
0bae6e0c-1341-4de9-a07f-053e81bda591 Place some ice into the glass and set aside.
0bae6e0c-1341-4de9-a07f-053e81bda591 Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice.
0bae6e0c-1341-4de9-a07f-053e81bda591 Pour in tequila, lime juice, Cointreau, and simple syrup or agave.
0bae6e0c-1341-4de9-a07f-053e81bda591 Shake well until very cold and then strain into the glass.
0bae6e0c-1341-4de9-a07f-053e81bda591 Garnish with the lime wheel and serve.
a69f7cf9-193d-4b95-8399-0e215ca8c865 Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice.
a69f7cf9-193d-4b95-8399-0e215ca8c865 Pour in the gin, Lillet Blanc or Cocchi Americano, Cointreau, lemon juice, and abisnthe.
a69f7cf9-193d-4b95-8399-0e215ca8c865 Shake well until very cold.
a69f7cf9-193d-4b95-8399-0e215ca8c865 Strain into a coupe glass and garnish with an orange twist.
7c8c2845-5cf6-40c1-acca-2c89a8180b2c Fill a highball glass with ice.
7c8c2845-5cf6-40c1-acca-2c89a8180b2c Pour in apple brandy, Cardamaro, and lemon juice.
7c8c2845-5cf6-40c1-acca-2c89a8180b2c Give it a gentle stir with a bar spoon.
7c8c2845-5cf6-40c1-acca-2c89a8180b2c Top with the ginger beer.
7c8c2845-5cf6-40c1-acca-2c89a8180b2c Garnish with the lemon and serve.
c3adb13b-f50f-42d3-9ec3-028ab4a9deb9 Fill a mixing glass halfway with ice.
c3adb13b-f50f-42d3-9ec3-028ab4a9deb9 Pour in rye, Cardamaro, and bitters. For a slightly drier and stronger drink, use 1 1/2 ounces Cardamaro. For a slightly rounder one, use 2 ounces Cardamaro.
c3adb13b-f50f-42d3-9ec3-028ab4a9deb9 Stir well until you can feel the outside of the mixing glass get very cold.
c3adb13b-f50f-42d3-9ec3-028ab4a9deb9 Strain into an ice-filled old-fashioned glass, garnish with an orange twist, and serve.
3e86cd4a-fb3e-45e0-bce1-a39690a0afe4 Fill a mixing glass halfway with ice.
3e86cd4a-fb3e-45e0-bce1-a39690a0afe4 Pour in gin, vermouth, Luxardo, and bitters.
3e86cd4a-fb3e-45e0-bce1-a39690a0afe4 Mix until well-chilled.
3e86cd4a-fb3e-45e0-bce1-a39690a0afe4 Pour into a coupe glass, garnish with an orange twist, and serve.
b31d03d5-d475-4d8c-9a09-cad26adc1880 Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice. Pour in gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup, and shake very well.
b31d03d5-d475-4d8c-9a09-cad26adc1880 Strain gin mixture into a Champagne flute. Top with Champagne.
b31d03d5-d475-4d8c-9a09-cad26adc1880 Garnish with a lemon twist and serve.
69630710-00ed-443f-a432-68972b6f2f66 Fill a mixing glass halfway with ice.
69630710-00ed-443f-a432-68972b6f2f66 Pour in gin, Aperol, and Lillet blanc.
69630710-00ed-443f-a432-68972b6f2f66 Stir until well-mixed and well-chilled.
69630710-00ed-443f-a432-68972b6f2f66 Pour into a glass. You can serve this drink on the rocks in an old-fashioned glass or up in a cocktail glass.
69630710-00ed-443f-a432-68972b6f2f66 Garnish with an orange slice and serve.
ecff5e8e-dea0-47b0-b584-72cdafc12e2d Add plenty of ice to a mixing glass.
ecff5e8e-dea0-47b0-b584-72cdafc12e2d Pour in gin, vermouth, and olive brine.
ecff5e8e-dea0-47b0-b584-72cdafc12e2d Stir until very well chilled.
ecff5e8e-dea0-47b0-b584-72cdafc12e2d Strain into a martini glass.
ecff5e8e-dea0-47b0-b584-72cdafc12e2d Garnish with three large, skewered olives and serve.
cc3970a4-1722-46cf-b3a2-0ebe6bf8bb26 Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
cc3970a4-1722-46cf-b3a2-0ebe6bf8bb26 Pour in tequila, Chartreuse, grapefruit juice, and lime juice.
cc3970a4-1722-46cf-b3a2-0ebe6bf8bb26 Shake well and strain into an ice-filled old-fashioned glass.
cc3970a4-1722-46cf-b3a2-0ebe6bf8bb26 Garnish with star anise and serve.
c4e113a6-e860-4f58-bf1f-1aee651d9eb6 Fill a mixing glass halfway with ice. Pour in cocktail ingredients except garnish and stir. Strain into a coupe glass, garnish, and serve.
327be837-a7f4-4b66-bacf-f95f0f1009dd Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
327be837-a7f4-4b66-bacf-f95f0f1009dd Pour in gin, lime juice, and simple syrup.
327be837-a7f4-4b66-bacf-f95f0f1009dd Shake well and strain into a coupe glass.
327be837-a7f4-4b66-bacf-f95f0f1009dd Garnish with cucumber or lime slice and serve.
fd26b16e-5c82-4382-ab10-b0e641bd205b Up to 6 hours before serving, make the batch. Pour chilled Campari, chilled coffee, simple syrup, and salt into a 2-quart pitcher and stir to mix. Seal well, covering with plastic wrap if needed, and refrigerate.
fd26b16e-5c82-4382-ab10-b0e641bd205b Up to 2 hours before serving, prepare grapefruit juice and stir into pitcher mix. Reseal and return to refrigerator if not serving immediately.
fd26b16e-5c82-4382-ab10-b0e641bd205b To serve, whisk pitcher mixture well, or pour half of the mixture into a blender and blend for 20 seconds, then stir back into remaining pitcher mix. Fill 12-ounce highball glasses with ice and add 1/4 cup chilled tonic water to each glass. Top with pitcher mix and garnish each drink with a grapefruit twist.
9bcca3cc-00dd-4d8d-a7af-6c70dcf5f94d Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice.
9bcca3cc-00dd-4d8d-a7af-6c70dcf5f94d Add Lillet Blanc, vodka, and grapefruit juice and shake until chilled.
9bcca3cc-00dd-4d8d-a7af-6c70dcf5f94d Strain into a cocktail glass, garnish with a slice of star fruit, and serve. You can also serve this cocktail with over ice.
e20a0958-b7ac-41c3-8e79-622b8efd3712 Combine the sugar and the water in a small pot.
e20a0958-b7ac-41c3-8e79-622b8efd3712 Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar has dissolved.
e20a0958-b7ac-41c3-8e79-622b8efd3712 Cool completely. Can be stored, covered, in the fridge for up to a month.
6aee2aa1-1548-459e-a089-a751d280490f Place some ice in a tall glass. For their slow melt and simple, classy look I used these giant ice cubes.
6aee2aa1-1548-459e-a089-a751d280490f Pour in Campari and vermouth, stir in soda water and serve.
b45d24ce-b7b4-4a10-b3d8-65b6f2d97936 Pour ingredients into an ice-filled cocktail shaker.
b45d24ce-b7b4-4a10-b3d8-65b6f2d97936 Shake well.
b45d24ce-b7b4-4a10-b3d8-65b6f2d97936 Strain into a cocktail glass to serve.
b45d24ce-b7b4-4a10-b3d8-65b6f2d97936 Garnish with a Luxardo cherry or a lime twist.
2e7fcff3-bd2a-4a1e-99bf-d5271a5c641a Heat a cast iron skillet over medium-high heat for a few minutes until very hot. Cut the lemon in half and then cut a 1/4-inch-thick round slice from one half. Place the lemon halves and the slice into the pan cut sides down and cook for about three to four minutes, until nicely charred. Remove lemon from pan and add thyme sprig. Cook for about a minute, until fragrant, then set aside to cool.
2e7fcff3-bd2a-4a1e-99bf-d5271a5c641a Squeeze juice from lemon halves through a fine-mesh sieve into a small bowl. Measure out 1 1/2 ounces juice, reserving any extra for another use. Stir honey into lemon juice until dissolved.
2e7fcff3-bd2a-4a1e-99bf-d5271a5c641a Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour in lemon juice mixture, gin and Vermouth and shake well. Place a few ice cubes into a single old fashioned glass and pour drink into glass. Garnish with lemon slice and thyme sprig. (Bruise the thyme with your fingers a bit so its flavors will infuse into the drink.)
44723f1a-f30c-48bf-9c06-b9c25cfabc00 Fill a copper mule cup most of the way with crushed ice. To crush your own ice, place regular ice cubes in a double layer of gallon-sized zip-top bags and smash ice with a wooden rolling pin or a mallet until crushed. (After a tough day you may find you start preferring your cocktail with homemade crushed ice.)
44723f1a-f30c-48bf-9c06-b9c25cfabc00 Stir in vodka, apple cider, ginger beer and lime juice. Garnish with apple slice and cinnamon stick.
ed105972-16b8-433d-a28d-bd0e82758814 Place plenty of ice into a mixing glass.
ed105972-16b8-433d-a28d-bd0e82758814 Pour in the gin, vermouth and Campari.
ed105972-16b8-433d-a28d-bd0e82758814 Stir well until chilled.
ed105972-16b8-433d-a28d-bd0e82758814 Pour into a single old-fashioned glass, garnish with twist of orange peel or a small slice of orange, and serve.
2e6fc8b4-8832-4490-af34-7c6894d50d4a In a small pot, combine the thyme, rosemary, sugar and water. Set over medium-high heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until sugar is dissolved and liquid is just shy of boiling.
2e6fc8b4-8832-4490-af34-7c6894d50d4a Remove from heat and set aside for at least 30 minutes. The longer it sits, the stronger the herb flavor will be. Strain the liquid into a little cup or container and discard herbs.
2e6fc8b4-8832-4490-af34-7c6894d50d4a When ready to serve, fill two medium glasses about 2/3 with ice.
2e6fc8b4-8832-4490-af34-7c6894d50d4a Juice the citrus into a liquid measuring cup with a spout and stir in two tablespoons of the herb syrup.
2e6fc8b4-8832-4490-af34-7c6894d50d4a Divide between glasses, garnish with herb sprigs and blood orange slices if you like, and serve immediately.
6bcb802a-2b72-4925-8c93-19d7b8d315e8 Pour the Campari into a champagne glass, fill the glass with Prosecco, stir gently and serve immediately.
c0b0be8f-5c63-4672-b7c2-efed09851140 Pour all ingredients into a 9x13-inch glass baking dishand stir.
c0b0be8f-5c63-4672-b7c2-efed09851140 Cover well and freeze overnight.
c0b0be8f-5c63-4672-b7c2-efed09851140 When ready to serve, use a fork to scrape into a slushie-like consistency. This will be easy since vodka doesn't completely freeze.
c0b0be8f-5c63-4672-b7c2-efed09851140 Scoop into glasses and serve. It's great frozen but also as it melts.
9744857a-7e52-4e85-a014-78520bab8ea3 In a cocktail shaker filled halfway with ice, shake clementine juice, lime juice and vodka until ice cold.
9744857a-7e52-4e85-a014-78520bab8ea3 Strain into a glass (preferably a copper mug) filled about 2/3 full with ice.
9744857a-7e52-4e85-a014-78520bab8ea3 Top with 4 ounces ginger beer and serve, garnished with clementine or lime if you like. (I like to give it a quick stir before garnishing, though I'm sure that's illegal somehow.)
effff915-fce7-4b42-8901-8bb8705c5f9c Fill a pint-sized jar halfway with ice. Pour in champagne, gin and sour cherry syrup. Stir to combine. Serve right away.
735d5bdf-ff01-44a3-93e0-8c9c360624fb Fill a large wine glass (or a pint-sized mason jar, or whatever glass you like) halfway with ice.
735d5bdf-ff01-44a3-93e0-8c9c360624fb Pour in the Prosecco and then the Aperol. Top with soda water. Garnish with an orange slice if you like.
3c88cd0b-252c-451e-9f22-2adc68bbfef7 Fill a mason jar or cocktail shaker halfway with ice.
3c88cd0b-252c-451e-9f22-2adc68bbfef7 Pour in the gin, vermouth, and fresh grapefruit juice.
3c88cd0b-252c-451e-9f22-2adc68bbfef7 Cover and shake, then divide between two ice-filled glasses. Garnish with a wisp of grapefruit rind and start sipping immediately.
b82d00a5-9f15-49db-8e4a-4d05493f1e64 Combine the rum, lime juice and simple syrup in a cocktail shaker.
b82d00a5-9f15-49db-8e4a-4d05493f1e64 Add a few ice cubes and shake.
b82d00a5-9f15-49db-8e4a-4d05493f1e64 Pour into an ice-filled glass and serve.
da45dc4e-d901-467a-a35e-0aa5507c9663 Into a 4-cup french press, liquid measure or jar, pour the ground coffee, brown sugar and cinnamon. Pour in half the water and stir well. Add remaining water and stir again.
da45dc4e-d901-467a-a35e-0aa5507c9663 Let sit at room temperature or in the fridge overnight, then press or strain through cheesecloth or a nut milk bag into a clean container.
da45dc4e-d901-467a-a35e-0aa5507c9663 To serve, fill glass with ice and pour in coffee and milk to taste. Dilute with cold filtered water if desired.
1eb355cd-88a8-4e1e-83e7-5eb4cb93bae2 Combine all ingredients in the jar of a blender and blend on high speed until perfectly smooth, about 30 seconds.
1eb355cd-88a8-4e1e-83e7-5eb4cb93bae2 Divide between two glasses and serve immediately.
c3ece550-ebf9-4bec-bfff-0b55bad382c0 Slice the rhubarb stalks crosswise into one-inch segments. Place rhubarb segments into a large pot along with the water. Bring to a boil over high heat, then cover and reduce heat to simmer for 20 minutes.
c3ece550-ebf9-4bec-bfff-0b55bad382c0 Strain liquid through a fine-mesh strainer into a pitcher or spouted bowl, pressing on the solids in the strainer to extract as much juice as possible.
c3ece550-ebf9-4bec-bfff-0b55bad382c0 After 20 minutes, the juice will separate, leaving a yellowish sludge at the bottom. Decant the clear pink liquid into a clean bottle or pitcher, leaving the sludge behind. Chill for a few hours at least, and serve cold over ice.
39f4461c-b481-4c02-a6a3-a0e3e77fddf7 Chop ingredients as necessary for your juicer, then feed through the juicer in the order listed.
39f4461c-b481-4c02-a6a3-a0e3e77fddf7 Stir, strain through a fine-mesh sieve if you like, and pour into glasses to serve.
ec21d4a9-1e30-4153-ae2a-15cbaea92555 Feed all ingredients through juicer in the order listed.
ec21d4a9-1e30-4153-ae2a-15cbaea92555 Strain juice through a fine-mesh sieve if you like.
ec21d4a9-1e30-4153-ae2a-15cbaea92555 Stir and serve, or keep in the fridge for up to three days if you use a masticating juicer.
44c1d10c-b439-4292-af58-c43cd69a38a8 Feed all ingredients through juicer in the order listed. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve if you like. Stir and serve a few ounces at a time. Keeps tightly sealed in the fridge for several days, or freeze in ice cube trays and store tightly sealed in the freezer for up to a month. (You'll lose some nutrients this way, but it's still good stuff.)
c86b3b27-283c-4c1a-912f-3001d51d15cd Juice ingredients in the order listed.
c86b3b27-283c-4c1a-912f-3001d51d15cd Pass through a fine mesh strainer if you like.
c86b3b27-283c-4c1a-912f-3001d51d15cd Stir together, divide between two glasses and serve immediately.
42e575c0-2053-4b25-8b3c-d3d43dcc55d9 Juice ingredients in the order listed.
42e575c0-2053-4b25-8b3c-d3d43dcc55d9 Pass through a fine mesh strainer if you like.
42e575c0-2053-4b25-8b3c-d3d43dcc55d9 Stir together, divide between two glasses and serve immediately.
58993b7d-7fdc-4e31-839b-0e98011f1df2 Juice ingredients in the order listed.
58993b7d-7fdc-4e31-839b-0e98011f1df2 Pass through a fine mesh strainer if you like.
58993b7d-7fdc-4e31-839b-0e98011f1df2 Stir together, divide between two glasses and serve immediately.
b691da85-44c5-4936-8e63-af50606cb215 Stir juices and hot sauce together thoroughly, divide between two glasses, and serve immediately.
17f23d16-6546-4e0e-a693-d34f2fed0ffd Run the watermelon, cucumber, mint, and limes through the juicer in the order listed. (Watermelon juices equally well in the blender, but running it through the juicer will prevent you from having two dirty appliances.)
17f23d16-6546-4e0e-a693-d34f2fed0ffd Stir in sugar, if using.
17f23d16-6546-4e0e-a693-d34f2fed0ffd Serve immediately.
b9c4f42c-0846-479f-9bb1-791a9a7084ff Feed ingredients through juicer in the order listed.
b9c4f42c-0846-479f-9bb1-791a9a7084ff Strain through a fine-mesh strainer if you like.
b75e7400-c651-43e5-ba57-2f14f315e19f Place all ingredients in blender and blend until completely smooth.
b75e7400-c651-43e5-ba57-2f14f315e19f Divide between two glasses and serve immediately.
84ae28c2-00a2-4f9c-975b-24b038fe1306 Feed all ingredients through juicer in the order listed.
84ae28c2-00a2-4f9c-975b-24b038fe1306 Strain juice through a fine-mesh sieve if you like.
84ae28c2-00a2-4f9c-975b-24b038fe1306 Stir well, divide between two glasses and serve immediately.
322620fd-df11-48cc-a3cf-c35742e97ddc Combine all ingredients in blender and puree until perfectly smooth.
aace9337-c0cc-454b-8012-a7352f9dc53f Combine all ingredients in a blender and process until perfectly smooth.
aace9337-c0cc-454b-8012-a7352f9dc53f Serve immediately.
74d90585-fcd7-4bc5-8f2c-72be73a987d8 Combine all ingredients in a blender and process until perfectly smooth.
74d90585-fcd7-4bc5-8f2c-72be73a987d8 Serve immediately.
d54d4c78-8f61-4989-a987-0e1474af71ac Place all ingredients in blender and process until perfectly smooth. Serve immediately.
312980b3-22e1-420c-95e1-515a02cd1422 Place all ingredients in blender and process until perfectly smooth. Serve immediately.
69ec7f4b-03db-4483-b1d3-fb90a8fb5b8f Combine all ingredients in a blender and process until perfectly smooth.
69ec7f4b-03db-4483-b1d3-fb90a8fb5b8f Serve immediately.
3b022139-6b8e-4a17-82f5-0149bebf0d39 Place the coconut water, lime juice, avocado, and pineapple into the blender
3b022139-6b8e-4a17-82f5-0149bebf0d39 Starting on a medium-low setting and increasing the speed as you go, blend until smooth.
3b022139-6b8e-4a17-82f5-0149bebf0d39 Depending on your blender, you may need to stop occasionally and press the ingredients toward the blades, then resume blending.
3b022139-6b8e-4a17-82f5-0149bebf0d39 Add the frozen banana slices and kale and continue to blend until perfectly smooth and creamy.
3b022139-6b8e-4a17-82f5-0149bebf0d39 Divide between two tall glasses and serve immediately.
d8c9dbb6-95c3-4f25-a790-72cd24405e55 Combine coconut water or pineapple juice with spinach, banana, peach, cilantro, and lime in a blender and process until perfectly smooth.
d8c9dbb6-95c3-4f25-a790-72cd24405e55 Serve immediately.
e612f865-eec7-4e84-a710-7040575e7d14 Combine all ingredients in blender and blend until perfectly smooth.
e612f865-eec7-4e84-a710-7040575e7d14 Divide between two glasses and serve immediately.
01306def-9138-4808-8625-6bd57e1c2b4a Combine all ingredients in blender and process until completely smooth (see notes).
01306def-9138-4808-8625-6bd57e1c2b4a Divide between two glasses and serve immediately.
33570680-da7e-4eb5-8de0-7bd8d8663e7a Combine all ingredients in the jar of a blender and blend on high speed until perfectly smooth, about 30 seconds.
33570680-da7e-4eb5-8de0-7bd8d8663e7a Divide between two glasses and serve immediately.
da1b87bc-73c7-4b3c-999a-02b3d976b504 Feed the ingredients through juicer in the order listed for maximum yield.
da1b87bc-73c7-4b3c-999a-02b3d976b504 Divide between two glasses and serve.
265c3d9b-ae03-4aa7-8fb9-cec60eceaa94 Place all ingredients in blender and blend until completely smooth.
265c3d9b-ae03-4aa7-8fb9-cec60eceaa94 Divide between two glasses and serve immediately.
5ae40c02-b56c-4d20-ac83-3ae9865ae003 Combine berries, almond milk, dates, flax seed, protein powder, vanilla, and maca powder in blender.
5ae40c02-b56c-4d20-ac83-3ae9865ae003 Blend on high speed until completely smooth, about 1 minute.
5ae40c02-b56c-4d20-ac83-3ae9865ae003 Divide between two glasses and serve cold.
5ae40c02-b56c-4d20-ac83-3ae9865ae003 Smoothie can be kept in a sealed container in the refrigerator for up to two days. Reblend or shake well before serving.
91dba221-364f-4dd8-b11f-2cad747164ae Add all ingredients to a regular or high speed blender and blend until completely smooth.
36d152ca-ef53-473b-af7b-c9171a3b8d77 Combine all ingredients in a high-speed or regular blender and blend until perfectly smooth.
7e98dd53-0b64-4f2a-ac10-a6d1cf06fe05 Combine all ingredients in a high-speed or regular blender and blend until completely smooth.
7e98dd53-0b64-4f2a-ac10-a6d1cf06fe05 Divide between two glasses and serve immediately.
9951ee3d-72a8-49ce-999c-806d6ffe8263 Combine cranberries, banana slices, clementine sections, cranberry juice, vanilla, and cinnamon in a blender and puree until perfectly smooth.
9951ee3d-72a8-49ce-999c-806d6ffe8263 Divide between two tall glasses and, if desired, stir a good splash of sparkling water into each.
9951ee3d-72a8-49ce-999c-806d6ffe8263 Serve immediately.
edb8dc1e-d2f6-4898-a5e8-74b8cded5fd3 Combine all ingredients in blender and puree until perfectly smooth.
edb8dc1e-d2f6-4898-a5e8-74b8cded5fd3 Divide between two glasses and serve immediately.
1ecc0064-18d9-4245-8d74-b10bbc8cb493 In a blender, combine the strawberries with 2 cups of the water, the vanilla seeds or extract, lemon juice, and simple syrup.
1ecc0064-18d9-4245-8d74-b10bbc8cb493 Puree until completely liquid. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve or through cheesecloth into a pitcher.
1ecc0064-18d9-4245-8d74-b10bbc8cb493 Stir in the remaining 2 cups water.
1ecc0064-18d9-4245-8d74-b10bbc8cb493 Chill completely. Pour into ice-filled glasses and serve.
041ed5f7-afe5-4c6b-beb1-dfbb2d18500d Combine all ingredients in a small pot. Set over medium-high heat to boil. Reduce heat to maintain a brisk simmer, stirring occasionally. Cook for 10-15 minutes, until liquid is red and slightly thickened. Strain liquid and discard (or eat!) cherries. Use when completely cooled.
7bde6395-8f86-4d70-91fc-8ded1b3134e2 Combine cherries, sugar and water in a small pot and set over medium-high heat to boil. Reduce heat to maintain a brisk simmer, stirring occasionally, until liquid has turned red and thickened slightly, 10-15 minutes. Pour through a fine mesh strainer to remove cherries. Chill syrup or let it cool on the counter.
7bde6395-8f86-4d70-91fc-8ded1b3134e2 Fill glasses with ice and pour in ginger ale or lemon-lime soda until glass is 3/4 full. Stir in 2 tablespoons sour cherry syrup (or more to taste). Deliver immediately into little hands, garnished with a fresh sour cherry or a maraschino cherry if you like.
a80976dc-d337-4059-9413-68c23cf83e3e Place the nuts in a medium bowl and cover completely with water. Soak nuts for eight hours, or overnight.
a80976dc-d337-4059-9413-68c23cf83e3e Drain and discard liquid and rinse nuts thoroughly.
a80976dc-d337-4059-9413-68c23cf83e3e Pour three cups of water into the blender and add the nuts.
a80976dc-d337-4059-9413-68c23cf83e3e Cover and blend for about two minutes, until very white and smooth. For cashews, there should be no remaining nut pulp and no need to strain. (See notes below.)
a80976dc-d337-4059-9413-68c23cf83e3e For almonds, pour the milk through a fine-mesh strainer lined with two layers of cheesecloth (or through a nut milk or paint strainer bag). Press until no more liquid drains out. Then use the milk and reserve the almond pulp to add to baked goods, cereals, etc., if you like.
a80976dc-d337-4059-9413-68c23cf83e3e Milk keeps, tightly sealed, in the fridge for about three days.
305fd18f-6e9d-4977-b0f7-30cf9829efe7 Chop chocolate, pistachios, and raspberries separately.
305fd18f-6e9d-4977-b0f7-30cf9829efe7 Melt the chocolate in a double boiler or on half power in bursts of 30 to 60 seconds the microwave, stirring gently and frequently either way.
305fd18f-6e9d-4977-b0f7-30cf9829efe7 Pour melted chocolate onto a rimmed baking sheet lined with parchment and spread into an even layer. You can choose the thickness — I prefer something between 1/4 and 1/8 inch.
305fd18f-6e9d-4977-b0f7-30cf9829efe7 While chocolate is hot, sprinkle with chopped nuts and raspberries.
305fd18f-6e9d-4977-b0f7-30cf9829efe7 Let rest until completely set, then break into shards.
6852b358-2bb0-47b8-9590-047842eb9a53 Fill a mixing glass with plenty of ice.
6852b358-2bb0-47b8-9590-047842eb9a53 Pour in bourbon, Cynar, and syrup. Add three dashes of Angostura bitters.
6852b358-2bb0-47b8-9590-047842eb9a53 Stir until very well-chilled.
6852b358-2bb0-47b8-9590-047842eb9a53 Strain into a coupe glass, garnish with star anise, and, serve.
7f7146a7-6112-4d1c-8a1a-2de272b39bb6 Preheat the oven to 350°F with the top rack in the lower third of the oven.
7f7146a7-6112-4d1c-8a1a-2de272b39bb6 Remove the neck and the bag of innards and giblets from inside the cavities. Sometimes they’re both in the large main cavity, but sometimes the bag is in the smaller neck cavity around the other side.
7f7146a7-6112-4d1c-8a1a-2de272b39bb6 If there are any pin feathers still on the bird, pluck them out.
7f7146a7-6112-4d1c-8a1a-2de272b39bb6 Place the turkey breast-side up into a large roasting pan. No racks or fancy positions necessary.
7f7146a7-6112-4d1c-8a1a-2de272b39bb6 Place butter into a small bowl. Strip one teaspoon of leaves from the thyme and add it to the bowl, reserving the rest. Add the salt, pepper, and lemon zest, and mix it all together thoroughly with a fork.
7f7146a7-6112-4d1c-8a1a-2de272b39bb6 Use your fingers to carefully separate the turkey skin from the breast meat to create pockets. Tuck some of the compound butter into the pockets and distribute it between the skin and the breast meat by wriggling it in as best as possible. Spread the remaining compound butter all over the outside of the turkey.
7f7146a7-6112-4d1c-8a1a-2de272b39bb6 Place the lemon and onion pieces into the large cavity of the bird along with a the remaining thyme sprigs.
7f7146a7-6112-4d1c-8a1a-2de272b39bb6 To truss, tuck the tip of each wing under the bird and tie the tips of the drumsticks together with a small piece of twine if this isn’t already done.
7f7146a7-6112-4d1c-8a1a-2de272b39bb6 Place turkey into oven and roast to your desired level of doneness. For me this means that an instant read thermometer inserted into the deepest part of the breast should read 155-160°F. Refer to the notes section below to learn more. A 10 pound turkey will probably need between 2 and 2 1/2 hours. A 14 pound turkey will probably need between 2 1/2 and 3 hours.
7f7146a7-6112-4d1c-8a1a-2de272b39bb6 Remove turkey from oven and let rest for at least 30 minutes before carving.
217ae54f-58ee-43f5-99db-f5599b84bff0 Preheat oven to 350°F with a rack in the center. Spray a half-sheet pan with cooking spray, line it with a piece of parchment paper, and spray the paper too.
217ae54f-58ee-43f5-99db-f5599b84bff0 Into a large bowl, sift together the flour, ginger, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, and salt.
217ae54f-58ee-43f5-99db-f5599b84bff0 In the bowl of a stand mixer, beat the butter with the paddle attachment on medium-high speed until light and fluffy. Add brown sugar and beat until combined with the butter, stopping to scrape down the sides of the bowl with a spatula as needed.
217ae54f-58ee-43f5-99db-f5599b84bff0 Beat in the eggs one at a time.
217ae54f-58ee-43f5-99db-f5599b84bff0 Lower the mixing speed to medium-low and pour in the molasses. Beat until incorporated. Beat in hot water.
217ae54f-58ee-43f5-99db-f5599b84bff0 Lower mixing speed to low and gradually spoon in the flour mixture, along with the lemon zest. Mix just until combined.
217ae54f-58ee-43f5-99db-f5599b84bff0 Pour batter onto prepared baking sheet and smooth with a spatula. Bake for 20-25 minutes, until a tester comes out clean.
217ae54f-58ee-43f5-99db-f5599b84bff0 Let gingerbread cool in the pan set over a cooling rack.
217ae54f-58ee-43f5-99db-f5599b84bff0 Once cooled, remove cake from pan. (If you have a large cutting board, you can place it directly on top of the sheet pan and flip the whole thing over to release the gingerbread onto the cutting board. Peel off parchment paper and cut gingerbread into 1-inch squares.
5cc85d2f-357b-4181-863d-ac3dec40919a Arrange one or two small bowls for the chocolate dip onto the serving platter. (You'll pour the dip in later.)
5cc85d2f-357b-4181-863d-ac3dec40919a Gently rinse and dry all fruit.
5cc85d2f-357b-4181-863d-ac3dec40919a To prepare the apples, quarter them, remove the core from each quarter by slicing it out diagonally, and then slice each quarter into four or five slices. Granny Smith apples don't brown quickly, so you can do this in advance without worrying about it.
5cc85d2f-357b-4181-863d-ac3dec40919a To prepare the grapes, snip the stems to form little bundles of 5 to 10 grapes.
5cc85d2f-357b-4181-863d-ac3dec40919a To prepare the star fruit, trim off and discard a thin slice from each end, then slice the star fruit crosswise into about 8 star-shaped slices.
5cc85d2f-357b-4181-863d-ac3dec40919a To prepare the dragon fruit, trim off and discard a thin slice from the stem end. Quarter the dragon fruit lengthwise and then cut each quarter crosswise into slices. The pink skin is not edible, but it's so beautiful that I like to leave it on. It's very easy for eaters to peel away from the edible flesh and gives them something to hold onto while eating.
5cc85d2f-357b-4181-863d-ac3dec40919a To prepare the kiwis, peel off the furry skin with a vegetable peeler or paring knife. Slice kiwis crosswise into rounds.
5cc85d2f-357b-4181-863d-ac3dec40919a To prepare the watermelon, cut a baby watermelon in half crosswise and reserve half for another use. Place the half watermelon cut side down and cut it into four quarters. Slice each quarter crosswise into triangular slices.
5cc85d2f-357b-4181-863d-ac3dec40919a To prepare the strawberries, either leave whole if they're smaller or remove leaves and cut into halves or quarters if they're large.
5cc85d2f-357b-4181-863d-ac3dec40919a To prepare cape gooseberries, remove papery hulls and wash well to remove as much of sticky exterior coating as is reasonable. You may not be able to remove it all, and that's okay.
43369774-1179-43b3-8d48-94001e84e40e Preheat waffle iron.
43369774-1179-43b3-8d48-94001e84e40e In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, white whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and cloves.
43369774-1179-43b3-8d48-94001e84e40e In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, sour cream, melted butter, and molasses.
43369774-1179-43b3-8d48-94001e84e40e Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix together until just combined. A few lumps are okay, just try to avoid any substantial pockets of unmixed dry ingredients.
43369774-1179-43b3-8d48-94001e84e40e Spray waffle iron lightly with nonstick cooking spray. Pour batter into waffle iron and cook according to manufacturer's instructions. In our waffle iron (recommended below), we use a scant 1/2 cup batter for each waffle and set the iron to medium-dark for these waffles.
43369774-1179-43b3-8d48-94001e84e40e Serve with a dusting of powdered sugar, maple syrup, and/or lightly sweetened whipped cream.
5b814516-59ef-4661-bf4b-42381ea189ec Preheat oven to 175°F with two racks close to the center. Line two cookie sheets with parchment paper.
5b814516-59ef-4661-bf4b-42381ea189ec Place the egg whites in a large metal bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer. Beat on medium until very foamy and then on high until soft peaks form, meaning that if you lift the beaters out of the egg whites, the tip of the peak that forms folds softly back onto itself but doesn’t collapse entirely.
5b814516-59ef-4661-bf4b-42381ea189ec With the mixer running at medium speed, gradually add half the sugar. Beat on high until white and glossy (it will look like marshmallow fluff).
5b814516-59ef-4661-bf4b-42381ea189ec Stop mixer and add remaining sugar all at once. Sprinkle cornstarch, vinegar, salt, and peppermint and chocolate extracts overtop. Beat again until mixture has enough structure to hold its shape when piped. This will take several minutes, maybe five to seven, depending on your mixer.
5b814516-59ef-4661-bf4b-42381ea189ec Fit a large piping bag with a star tip. Using a skewer or a small paintbrush, paint three thin lines of red gel food dye onto the inside of the piping bag, starting from the tip and going about halfway up the bag. You don’t really have to do a good job of this at all for the effect to work, so don’t stress about it.
5b814516-59ef-4661-bf4b-42381ea189ec Use a rubber spatula to transfer meringue from bowl into piping bag and twist the top to close.
5b814516-59ef-4661-bf4b-42381ea189ec Pipe bite-sized meringues (about an inch and a half in diameter) onto parchment-lined cookie sheets, leaving an inch or so of space between them.
5b814516-59ef-4661-bf4b-42381ea189ec Bake for about three hours, until dry and crisp.
5b814516-59ef-4661-bf4b-42381ea189ec Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Keep the parchment-lined baking sheets available.
5b814516-59ef-4661-bf4b-42381ea189ec When meringues are cool, melt chocolate chips. You can do this in a double-boiler or in the microwave in short bursts, stirring in between, until just melted.
5b814516-59ef-4661-bf4b-42381ea189ec Dip the bottom of each kiss into the chocolate and set on parchment until dry.
5b814516-59ef-4661-bf4b-42381ea189ec Once completely dry, kisses store well in an airtight container for a couple of weeks. Mason jars and cellophane gift bags work well for gifting!
1072e58b-2f75-46e6-b922-6582afa94271 Slice orange rinds into 1/2-inch-wide strips. You can do this over the course of several days if you like and leave rinds to air dry while you accumulate enough to dry in the oven.
1072e58b-2f75-46e6-b922-6582afa94271 Preheat oven to 300°F with a rack in the center.
1072e58b-2f75-46e6-b922-6582afa94271 Arrange rinds in a single layer on a baking sheet.
1072e58b-2f75-46e6-b922-6582afa94271 Bake for about 15 minutes, until completely dried.
1072e58b-2f75-46e6-b922-6582afa94271 Let cool completely before proceeding.
354a8b76-2872-4208-8bde-4057765c00ea Place the water, sugar and egg whites in the bowl of a stand mixer or a large mixing bowl. Using the whisk attachment or an electric mixer, beat ingredients together, slowly at first to avoid a sugar snow shower. Keep going until the icing is smooth, glossy and the consistency of toothpaste.
354a8b76-2872-4208-8bde-4057765c00ea Transfer a small amount of the icing to a smaller bowl and mix in a few drops of the color you'd like to use to line your cookies. Spoon this icing into a disposable piping bag and snip off a tiny bit of the bag's tip. Draw a line of icing as close as you'd like to the outer edge of your cookie, making sure to connect the line's ends to each other so the flood icing won't have any gaps to flow out.
354a8b76-2872-4208-8bde-4057765c00ea In another small bowl, mix some more of the icing with a few drops of the color you'd like to use to flood your cookies, along with two additional teaspoons of water. This icing should be thin enough to spread slowly and slightly across the surface of the cookies, but no thinner than that. You may need to experiment a little to find the consistency that's best for your humidity and, ahem, skill level. Pour this icing into another piping bag or better yet a squeeze bottle.
354a8b76-2872-4208-8bde-4057765c00ea Squeeze some flood icing onto the surface of a cookie, filling in the entire surface inside the line. You can use a toothpick to fill any gaps that don't fill themselves and gently rap the cookie onto the work surface if you're brave and want a perfectly smooth finish.
354a8b76-2872-4208-8bde-4057765c00ea To decorate the cookies further, add sprinkles or other decorations while the icing is still wet, or let the icing dry slightly and then mix other colors of the remaining thick icing and pipe additional designs.
6acb121d-d3b6-497c-9499-d575e13e3ef3 Fill a very large pot halfway with cold water and two tablespoons of fine sea salt. Place potato pieces into the pot as you peel and chop them.
6acb121d-d3b6-497c-9499-d575e13e3ef3 Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat and and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain potatoes in a colander.
6acb121d-d3b6-497c-9499-d575e13e3ef3 Heat the butter and milk together in a small pot over medium-low heat until butter is melted. Either press the potatoes through a ricer or food mill back into the pot, or return them to the pot straightaway and use a masher to mash them until smooth. Pour in hot buttery milk in a slow stream, stirring to incorporate. Taste and adjust for salt and pepper.
bccbb28c-2535-4a68-a441-1e72f307ab82 Preheat oven to 350°F. Line two standard muffin tins with 24 decorative paper liners.
bccbb28c-2535-4a68-a441-1e72f307ab82 In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle, mix sugar, flour, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda and salt on low speed until well combined.
bccbb28c-2535-4a68-a441-1e72f307ab82 Add eggs, milk, oil and vanilla extract. Mix on medium speed until batter is smooth. Pour in boiling water and carefully mix on low until just incorporated.
bccbb28c-2535-4a68-a441-1e72f307ab82 Divide batter among muffin cups. Bake cupcakes for about 18 minutes, until a tester comes out clean. Cool completely on a wire rack before frosting.
698567d9-5199-414e-8aae-2450deb2c5e3 In a large bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle, beat together the sugar, butter, baking powder, vanilla and salt until lightened and fluffy, about 5 minutes, scraping down bowl as necessary. Beat in egg until well combined.
698567d9-5199-414e-8aae-2450deb2c5e3 Into a medium bowl, sift together the cocoas and flour. Beat into wet ingredients all at once, just until well combined. Refrigerate dough for 30 minutes. (Dough will keep in fridge for 24 hours if you want to prepare it the day before.)
698567d9-5199-414e-8aae-2450deb2c5e3 Preheat oven to 375°F with two racks close to the center. Line two baking sheets with parchment.
698567d9-5199-414e-8aae-2450deb2c5e3 Divide dough into two discs. Sprinkle with cocoa. Roll out each disc until dough is 1/8" thick and cut into shapes with cookie cutters. Transfer cookies to baking sheets, leaving space between cookies.
698567d9-5199-414e-8aae-2450deb2c5e3 Bake cookies for 8 to 10 minutes, until edges begin to firm. Cool on pan for a couple of minutes and then completely on a rack before decorating.
ffdca6ac-4617-4778-834b-4768ae1ec0fd Peel and clean the shrimp, leaving tails on if you like. (Tails make a nice presentation and a useful handle, but you can serve the appetizer with cocktail forks or toothpicks instead.)
ffdca6ac-4617-4778-834b-4768ae1ec0fd Cut each slice of prosciutto into two or three long strips. Wrap one strip around each shrimp. Place shrimp on a rimmed baking sheet lined with a piece of parchment paper that just fits.
ffdca6ac-4617-4778-834b-4768ae1ec0fd Melt butter in a small pot. Brush about half of the butter over the shrimp. Preheat broiler to high.
ffdca6ac-4617-4778-834b-4768ae1ec0fd While broiler preheats, add garlic and sage to remaining butter. Cook on medium heat for a minute or two, until very fragrant.
ffdca6ac-4617-4778-834b-4768ae1ec0fd Broil shrimp for about 90 seconds, until shrimp are turning opaque and prosciutto begins to cook. Flip shrimp with tongs and broil about 60 seconds more, until just cooked through.
ffdca6ac-4617-4778-834b-4768ae1ec0fd Transfer shrimp to a serving platter. Brush with garlic sage butter and sprinkle with black pepper. Serve immediately.
7d9474ef-bbce-420d-b092-74d14ed3dfc4 Fill a large pot halfway with water. Add 1 tablespoon salt. Bring water to a boil over high heat.
7d9474ef-bbce-420d-b092-74d14ed3dfc4 Meanwhile, fill a large bowl with ice water.
7d9474ef-bbce-420d-b092-74d14ed3dfc4 When water boils, add broccoli and cook for one to two minutes, until bright green and not raw. Remove with a strainer to ice water.
7d9474ef-bbce-420d-b092-74d14ed3dfc4 Repeat with asparagus.
7d9474ef-bbce-420d-b092-74d14ed3dfc4 When vegetables are cool, blot dry and arrange on a large platter with endive and bread slices.
7d9474ef-bbce-420d-b092-74d14ed3dfc4 In a small pot, heat the olive oil and butter over medium heat until the butter starts to foam.
7d9474ef-bbce-420d-b092-74d14ed3dfc4 Add garlic and anchovy and cook, mashing anchovy against bottom and sides of pot with a spoon, until most of the anchovy has dissolved into the sauce, about 3 minutes.
7d9474ef-bbce-420d-b092-74d14ed3dfc4 Remove from heat, season to taste with pepper, and pour into a small bowl (or serve directly from pot).
7d9474ef-bbce-420d-b092-74d14ed3dfc4 Serve warm, over a little Sterno burner or tea light if you like, with crudités and crusty bread.
700ee79b-2e5e-4338-82d7-cf33762ce16d Preheat oven to 400°F with two racks close to the center.
700ee79b-2e5e-4338-82d7-cf33762ce16d On a piece of parchment, roll out the puff pastry sheet(s). If you're using one 14-ounce sheet, roll it out into a 16-inch square. If you're using two 8 1/2-ounce sheets, roll each out into a 12-inch by 14-inch rectangle.
700ee79b-2e5e-4338-82d7-cf33762ce16d In a small bowl, mix together the salt, cayenne, nutmeg and black pepper. Sprinkle over puff pastry. Next, sprinkle the shredded cheese over the puff pastry. It's best if you vaguely aim for even distribution but inevitably don't achieve it, which will make each bite a little different in a good way. Press down lightly with your hands to stick the toppings to the pastry.
700ee79b-2e5e-4338-82d7-cf33762ce16d Fold each sheet in half (if using the two puff pastry rectangles, fold over the longer side to make 12-inch by 7-inch rectangles), then roll out again until the short side reaches 12 inches. Slice each sheet into 1-inch by 12-inch strips.
700ee79b-2e5e-4338-82d7-cf33762ce16d Line two baking sheets with parchment. Twist the two ends of each strip in opposite directions a few times and place twists on baking sheets with a little space in between. Brush with cream or egg wash.
700ee79b-2e5e-4338-82d7-cf33762ce16d Bake for about 15 minutes, until puffed and light brown. Rotate the pans and swap their oven positions halfway through. (Alternatively you can bake the pans one at a time in the center of the oven.) Cool slightly or completely, whichever you prefer, before serving. They're best on the day you make them.
e8637d9a-6f6f-4a06-9e5f-dfa0a49b1823 Pour the Campari into a champagne glass, fill the glass with Prosecco, stir gently and serve immediately.
bb9abee7-8ba7-45b6-94ab-e6cd3e92d402 In a standard food processor fitted with the blade, pulse the Oreos until reduced to dust. Meanwhile, whip the cream cheese and peppermint extract. (I use the regular paddle attachment of my KitchenAid. You can also use a hand-held electric mixer or a spatula and a lot of elbow grease.)
bb9abee7-8ba7-45b6-94ab-e6cd3e92d402 Mix the cookie crumbs into the cream cheese until well combined. Chill for 10 minutes.
bb9abee7-8ba7-45b6-94ab-e6cd3e92d402 Roll mixture into 30 1-inch balls and place on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Chill thoroughly. (I pop them in the freezer for an hour.)
bb9abee7-8ba7-45b6-94ab-e6cd3e92d402 To temper the chocolate, roughly chop HALF of it and place in large microwave-safe bowl. Microwave in bursts (starting with one minute and following with 30 seconds), stirring in between, until chocolate is melted and reaches 115°F. Then place the entire remaining half (not chopped) into the bowl and stir until it is melted and the temperature of the melted chocolate is 90°. This can take a while, but it's key. When the chocolate reaches 90°, use two forks to dip each truffle in the chocolate and roll to coat completely. Replace on parchment-lined baking sheet. I do about 5 at a time, stop to sprinkle quickly with crushed candy cane before they dry, and then continue. If you work quickly you shouldn't have to reheat the chocolate.
bcdf7375-9217-44ef-9c31-02aef87904c5 Mix together the ketchup, horseradish, tabasco, gin, celery salt, salt and lemon juice. Chill until ready to serve. Stir in parsley right before serving.
bcdf7375-9217-44ef-9c31-02aef87904c5 Peel and devein shrimp, leaving tails attached. Place peels into a large pot. Add water, 1 tablespoon of the salt, wine or vermouth, peppercorns, coriander seeds, bay leaves, onion, tarragon and lemon. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and let sit 30 minutes more, then strain broth through a fine sieve into a fresh pot.
bcdf7375-9217-44ef-9c31-02aef87904c5 Bring stock to a boil, then remove from heat. Add shrimp and cover. Leave for 3 minutes (still off the heat -- the shrimp "poach" in the residual heat and remain amazingly tender).
bcdf7375-9217-44ef-9c31-02aef87904c5 Fill a large bowl with ice water and the remaining tablespoon salt. Add shrimp and leave until just opaque, 3 minutes or a shade more if the shrimp are very big. Chill in fridge (I usually wrap in paper towels and put in a gallon zip top bag) until ready to serve.
5dde8441-03b4-4e95-8b76-6fe905f66323 Defrost the puff pastry in the fridge overnight or on the counter for a couple of hours.
5dde8441-03b4-4e95-8b76-6fe905f66323 Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center. Unfold the puff pastry and roll it out gently with a rolling pin until it grows by 2-3 inches horizontally and vertically. Cut it into quarters, and then cut each quarter into six equal rectangles. Tuck each rectangle in to a mini muffin cup and set aside.
5dde8441-03b4-4e95-8b76-6fe905f66323 Trim the root end and the dark green leaves from the leeks and discard. Slice the remaining white and light green parts in half lengthwise and then cut crosswise into thin half-moons. Place in a colander and rinse thoroughly, then shake off any excess water.
5dde8441-03b4-4e95-8b76-6fe905f66323 Melt the butter in a frying pan over medium heat. Add leeks, a generous pinch of salt and some freshly ground black pepper and cook, stirring from time to time to prevent browning, until tender and reduced in volume by half, 5-10 minutes. Stir in cream, nutmeg and thyme and continue to cook until cream is thick enough to coat leeks without leaving liquid in the pan, about 5 minutes more. Remove from heat, crumble feta overtop and stir to incorporate.
5dde8441-03b4-4e95-8b76-6fe905f66323 Beat egg in a small bowl with one teaspoon water.
5dde8441-03b4-4e95-8b76-6fe905f66323 Spoon a small amount of leek filling into each prepared muffin cup. Brush with a little bit of egg wash. Bake for about 20 minutes, until pastry is nicely browned. Serve warm.
a3cdb390-8a13-4fae-8f9e-c5a0030abc39 Scrub the oysters well under running water to remove all sand and dirt. To shuck each oyster, hold it in a kitchen towel with the cupped side of the shell facing down so you won't lose the beautiful liquor when you open it. Insert the tip of an oyster knife firmly into the hinge and twist until it pops open. Then run the knife across the inside of the top shell. Watch the video linked in the notes section below to see this done.
a3cdb390-8a13-4fae-8f9e-c5a0030abc39 Run the oyster knife between the meat and the bottom shell to fully release the meat from the shell so it can be slurped up later. Place shucked oysters on a rimmed baking pan lined with a big sheet of gently crumpled aluminum foil to prevent tipping. Discard top shells.
a3cdb390-8a13-4fae-8f9e-c5a0030abc39 In a small pot, melt the butter with the shallot over medium heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the basil, parsley and lemon zest.
a3cdb390-8a13-4fae-8f9e-c5a0030abc39 Line the bottom of a heavy 12-inch frying pan with about 1/4 inch of Kosher salt. (I really prefer a cast iron skillet for its superior heat retention). Preheat the pan over medium-high heat for at least 5 minutes, until the salt starts to make some little popping noises. Then quickly arrange the shucked oysters in the pan and top each with a spoonful of the herb butter. Cover the pan with a lid (carefully use foil if you don't have a lid that fits) and cook for three minutes, until the oysters are just opaque. They'll continue to cook a bit from the residual heat in the pan. Sprinkle with a little bit of chopped prosciutto and a squeeze of lemon juice. Serve warm straight from the pan.
b88eff4b-8f21-43e5-a25e-4b7a5bf7f5be Pour all ingredients into a 9x13-inch glass baking dishand stir.
b88eff4b-8f21-43e5-a25e-4b7a5bf7f5be Cover well and freeze overnight.
b88eff4b-8f21-43e5-a25e-4b7a5bf7f5be When ready to serve, use a fork to scrape into a slushie-like consistency. This will be easy since vodka doesn't completely freeze.
b88eff4b-8f21-43e5-a25e-4b7a5bf7f5be Scoop into glasses and serve. It's great frozen but also as it melts.
2ea433de-ef43-4288-b71a-0f3b10ade417 Melt the butter in the braiser or skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion, peppers, and shiitakes all at once, along with 1/2 teaspoon of the salt. Cook, stirring from time to time, for about 10 minutes, until the vegetables have softened, browned a bit, and decreased in volume by at least half. Remove from heat.
2ea433de-ef43-4288-b71a-0f3b10ade417 While the other vegetables cook, place the defrosted broccoli on a thick layer of paper towels and cover with another thick layer. When the veggies in the skillet have cooked as noted above, press down gently on the paper towels to remove moisture from the broccoli. The add broccoli to the skillet and stir to incorporate.
2ea433de-ef43-4288-b71a-0f3b10ade417 Crack the eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat well with a fork. Stir in milk, nutmeg, cayenne, and a few good grinds black pepper. Add bread cubes and stir to moisten. Then stir in all the vegetables, half the gruyere and half the parmesan or pecorino. Pour the whole mixture back into the braiser or into the baking pan and sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Cover and refrigerate overnight or for at least a few hours before proceeding. Remove from fridge about an hour before baking if possible.
2ea433de-ef43-4288-b71a-0f3b10ade417 An hour before serving time, preheat oven to 375°F with a rack in the center. Bake uncovered for about 40 minutes, until puffed and golden. Serve hot or even at room temperature.
73453b85-2ec4-4640-ae4f-3a92b66a7f0f Snip open the tea bag and pour the contents into a small microwave-safe bowl (or a small pot if you’d prefer to use the stovetop). Add the butter and warm on medium heat until melted. Set aside to let the tea steep in the butter for five minutes. (You'll strain out the tea solids later.)
73453b85-2ec4-4640-ae4f-3a92b66a7f0f In a large bowl, stir together the flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, cloves and allspice. Into the center of the bowl, crack the eggs and pour the buttermilk. Strain the butter into the bowl through a tea strainer or small fine-mesh sieve. Using a fork, beat the eggs a bit and then gently incorporate the dry ingredients into the wet to form a rough dough. Don’t overmix or donuts will be tough.
73453b85-2ec4-4640-ae4f-3a92b66a7f0f Sprinkle a little flour on your work surface. (I sometimes like to roll out dough on a nice big piece of parchment — flour the parchment if you go that route.) Place the dough on the work surface and knead just a few times to bring it all together. Lightly flour the top of the dough and a rolling pin, and roll out to about 1/4-inch thickness. Using a 3 1/2-inch donut cutter with a 1-inch hole (or similarly sized cookie cutters, biscuit cutters or even an overturned water glass and shot glass) cut out as many donuts and holes as you can. Gather and re-roll the dough one time to make more donuts.
73453b85-2ec4-4640-ae4f-3a92b66a7f0f In a Dutch oven or similar heavy pot with high sides, heat the oil over medium-high heat until it reaches 350°F. During cooking, adjust the heat as necessary to maintain the temperature as best as possible. Fry donuts in batches, about three at a time depending on the size of your pot. It should take about 1 1/2 to 2 minutes per side until donuts are golden brown and cooked through. Some cracking on the top before you flip each donut is a good indication that the inside is nicely cooked. Cool donuts on a wire rack lined with paper towels.
73453b85-2ec4-4640-ae4f-3a92b66a7f0f In a wide, shallow bowl, stir together the powdered sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg. Pour in the tea and vanilla and stir until a nice smooth glaze forms. Dip the top of each donut into the glaze and return to rack. The glaze should dry within a few minutes. Serve donuts on the day you make them.
81f0df51-0157-4491-a8e6-60e52682d960 On a countertop or table, arrange a few nice-looking boards and three small bowls. Arrange cheeses, meats, fruits, olives, bread or crackers and other ingredients as if they just rolled out of fridge into their awesome, awesome life. Share with as many friends as you can find, or just a few if that sounds like more fun. Serve with plenty of wine.
317ce632-be01-4cd4-93f2-e83be717897b In a cocktail shaker filled halfway with ice, shake clementine juice, lime juice and vodka until ice cold.
317ce632-be01-4cd4-93f2-e83be717897b Strain into a glass (preferably a copper mug) filled about 2/3 full with ice.
317ce632-be01-4cd4-93f2-e83be717897b Top with 4 ounces ginger beer and serve, garnished with clementine or lime if you like. (I like to give it a quick stir before garnishing, though I'm sure that's illegal somehow.)
2c00fd90-00ea-483b-9aa1-9a6216c7b8c2 Fill each jar with about six heaping tablespoons of either herb salt or spiced sugar.
2c00fd90-00ea-483b-9aa1-9a6216c7b8c2 Print free printable labels, above, onto label sheets. It's a good idea to test your printer first on a plain piece of paper and then hold that paper up to the light with a sheet of labels behind it to check for alignment. Make sure to print at 100%, not "fit to page."
2c00fd90-00ea-483b-9aa1-9a6216c7b8c2 Adhere a label onto the flat insert on each jar lid.
2c00fd90-00ea-483b-9aa1-9a6216c7b8c2 Screw lids onto jars and gift away. Salt and sugar keep well for at least a year.
72b35170-49f0-41be-9e3b-89a363cb3c6c Pour the sugar into in a large bowl.
72b35170-49f0-41be-9e3b-89a363cb3c6c Slit the vanilla beans lengthwise with a small, sharp knife and scrape out the seeds. Add the seeds to the bowl.
72b35170-49f0-41be-9e3b-89a363cb3c6c Sprinkle in the cinnamon, cardamom and nutmeg and stir well to distribute all the spices evenly. If there are any clumps, break them up and pass the mixture through a sieve.
72b35170-49f0-41be-9e3b-89a363cb3c6c Divide spiced sugar among 12 small jars such as these wide-mouth half pint jars — about 6 heaping tablespoons per jar plus a little extra for good luck.
ec23ca12-6477-45d1-9eee-6c4ce563c6d4 Preheat oven to 325°F.
ec23ca12-6477-45d1-9eee-6c4ce563c6d4 Cut the butter into small pieces and place it in a large bowl (or the bowl of a stand mixer) with the sugar. Beat on medium speed until lightened in color and fluffy. Add the vanilla extract and beat to incorporate.
ec23ca12-6477-45d1-9eee-6c4ce563c6d4 Add the flour and stir in gently with a spatula or wooden spoon until incorporated. Gather dough into your hands and shape into two balls. You'll need to give it a good squeeze to get it to hold together well. You can chill it for 20 minutes or so at this point or proceed directly.
ec23ca12-6477-45d1-9eee-6c4ce563c6d4 Dust work surface and rolling pin with flour and gently roll each dough ball into a thin disk, about 1/8 inch, but don't stress.
ec23ca12-6477-45d1-9eee-6c4ce563c6d4 Using a 2 1/2-inch round cookie/biscuit cutter, cut as many circles as you can. You should get between 90 and 100 in total, after you re-roll any scraps and use them to make a few more cookies.
ec23ca12-6477-45d1-9eee-6c4ce563c6d4 Using a small snowflake cookie cutter (or any small festive shape you like), cut into the center of half the circles. Remove the snowflakes to bake separately.
ec23ca12-6477-45d1-9eee-6c4ce563c6d4 Transfer cookies to cookie sheets lined with parchment and chill in the fridge for 15 minutes to help cookies retain their shape in the oven.
ec23ca12-6477-45d1-9eee-6c4ce563c6d4 Bake for 10-12 minutes, until very lightly golden.
ec23ca12-6477-45d1-9eee-6c4ce563c6d4 Remove from the oven and transfer cookies to a wire rack to cool completely. Cookies will keep well at this stage for a few days.
ec23ca12-6477-45d1-9eee-6c4ce563c6d4 The day you plan to present the cookies, spread a nice layer of jam over the flat (bottom) side of each of the intact circles. Heap a little bit of jam in the center and leave a little border around the edge.
ec23ca12-6477-45d1-9eee-6c4ce563c6d4 Dust the tops of the snowflake-cutout circles, as well as the snowflakes themselves, with plenty of powdered sugar.
ec23ca12-6477-45d1-9eee-6c4ce563c6d4 To assemble the cookies, gently press a cutout circle onto each jam-covered circle, which should help the jam fill in the snowflake shape and also spread to the outside edges of the cookies.
afa3d549-7ed8-41da-8061-81052e7af1c6 Preheat oven to 325°F with a rack in the center.
afa3d549-7ed8-41da-8061-81052e7af1c6 Cut the butter into small pieces and place it in a large bowl (or the bowl of a stand mixer) with the sugar. Beat on medium speed until lightened in color and fluffy. Add the vanilla extract and beat to incorporate.
afa3d549-7ed8-41da-8061-81052e7af1c6 Add the flour and stir in gently with a spatula or wooden spoon until incorporated. Gather dough into your hands and squeeze it together until it forms a cohesive dough. Shape into a ball.
afa3d549-7ed8-41da-8061-81052e7af1c6 Dust work surface and rolling pin with flour and gently roll dough into a 1/4-inch thick disk. Cut into shapes using a cookie cutter. You can re-roll any scraps and use them to make a few more cookies.
afa3d549-7ed8-41da-8061-81052e7af1c6 Transfer cookies to a cookie sheet lined with parchment and chill in the fridge for 15 minutes to help cookies retain their shape in the oven.
afa3d549-7ed8-41da-8061-81052e7af1c6 Bake about 12 minutes, until very lightly golden.
afa3d549-7ed8-41da-8061-81052e7af1c6 Remove from the oven and transfer cookies to a wire rack to cool. Decorate if you like.
4fd53652-c045-4c39-aaed-2130f1888980 Preheat oven to 350°F with a rack in the center. Spray a 9- or 10-inch loaf pan with cooking spray and line with parchment that overhangs slightly on two sides.
4fd53652-c045-4c39-aaed-2130f1888980 Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and a sprinkle of the salt and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the minced mushrooms and another sprinkle of the salt, raise heat to high, and cook until they have released their juices and reabsorbed them, about 7 minutes. Add garlic, thyme, oregano, basil, tarragon and sage and cook 2 minutes more. Deglaze the pan with the wine, scraping up any browned bits, and cook until liquid is absorbed, about 1 minute.
4fd53652-c045-4c39-aaed-2130f1888980 In a medium mixing bowl, beat together the eggs and cottage cheese.
4fd53652-c045-4c39-aaed-2130f1888980 In a large mixing bowl, toss together the brown rice, walnuts and cashews. Stir in the egg mixture, then add the mushroom mixture, cheeses, parsley, remaining salt and pepper. Mix well.
4fd53652-c045-4c39-aaed-2130f1888980 Spoon mixture into loaf pan and smooth top. If desired, decorate with a few mushroom slices or walnut halves. Place loaf pan on a rimmed baking sheet.
4fd53652-c045-4c39-aaed-2130f1888980 Bake until firm, about 60 minutes. Let cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to a platter to serve.
31e1594d-91bb-422f-9296-8f8082007b70 In a large bowl, beat the butter with an electric mixer until lightened in color and texture, 1 to 2 minutes. Gradually add the sugar and continue to beat until the mixture is light, about 2 minutes more. Add the eggs and beat until well combined.
31e1594d-91bb-422f-9296-8f8082007b70 In a medium bowl, sift together 3 cups of the flour and the salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Add half the flour mixture to the bowl with the wet ingredients and stir to combine. Then add half the sherry and stir to incorporate. Repeat with remaining flour mixture and sherry. When all is well blended, add enough additional flour to stiffen the dough, about 1 cup. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
31e1594d-91bb-422f-9296-8f8082007b70 Preheat the oven to 450°F. Grease two baking sheets. Flour a work surface and roll out the dough to a mere 1/16 inch thick. Cut out cookies with a cookie cutter. Place on cookie sheets, leaving an inch of space between cookies. You will need to bake in several batches. Bake for about 7 minutes.
ce5243c8-b893-4fe4-817a-bd145d50ab31 Place half of cheese, along with onion, garlic puree, chives, mustard and cayenne, in the bowl of a food processor fitted with the metal blade. Process until smooth.
ce5243c8-b893-4fe4-817a-bd145d50ab31 With the motor running, add the sherry and olive oil. Process to incorporate.
ce5243c8-b893-4fe4-817a-bd145d50ab31 Add the remaining cheese and process until very thick and smooth.
ce5243c8-b893-4fe4-817a-bd145d50ab31 Add additional sherry 1 tablespoon at a time to thin, if necessary.
ce5243c8-b893-4fe4-817a-bd145d50ab31 Pack into 8-ounce crocks. Refrigerate for up to one month. Bring to room temperature before serving with crackers or toasts.
5ada5da2-260f-4c86-a6c2-b4943585ba9a Line a rimmed sheet pan with parchment paper.
5ada5da2-260f-4c86-a6c2-b4943585ba9a Place the salmon, skin side down, on the parchment. Brush evenly with the lemon juice.
5ada5da2-260f-4c86-a6c2-b4943585ba9a Combine salt, sugar, and cracked pepper in a medium bowl.
5ada5da2-260f-4c86-a6c2-b4943585ba9a Sprinkle the mixture over the salmon, covering completely. The layer of curing mixture should be a little thicker where the salmon is thicker and thinner where the fillet thins out toward the tail.
5ada5da2-260f-4c86-a6c2-b4943585ba9a Cover evenly with the dill.
5ada5da2-260f-4c86-a6c2-b4943585ba9a Cover the salmon with another layer of parchment and then another sheet pan. Weight the top sheet pan with two 16-ounce cans.
5ada5da2-260f-4c86-a6c2-b4943585ba9a Refrigerate for 40-48 hours.
5ada5da2-260f-4c86-a6c2-b4943585ba9a Scrape the dill and curing mixture from the salmon. Rinse well and pat dry.
5ada5da2-260f-4c86-a6c2-b4943585ba9a Slice very thinly to serve. The salmon can be refrigerated for up to 5 days before serving.
bc275a10-6957-4f85-bd76-2d7816889b8d Combine all ingredients in a very small pot. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat. Boil for 30 seconds, then remove from heat and let cool completely.
bc275a10-6957-4f85-bd76-2d7816889b8d Pour cooled mixture through a fine-meshed sieve into a small baking dish or other freezer-safe container just big enough to hold the mixture in a shallow layer. (Protip: save the strained shallot and toss into your next salad.)
bc275a10-6957-4f85-bd76-2d7816889b8d Freeze the mixture, scraping every hour or so with a fork to break up the ice into small pieces, until fully frozen (probably about 3 hours).
bc275a10-6957-4f85-bd76-2d7816889b8d Serve in a small, very cold bowl as a condiment for oysters on the half shell.
fc130fb7-a016-4d00-bfe4-5e4f10c49a96 Preheat oven to 425°F with a rack in the center.
7859780a-967d-4799-83d7-9e8e83839333 Preheat the oven to 350°F with a rack in the center. Grease a 9-by-13-by-2-inch pan.
7859780a-967d-4799-83d7-9e8e83839333 In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, ground ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, cloves, and salt. Whisk to combine.
7859780a-967d-4799-83d7-9e8e83839333 In a medium bowl, combine the eggs, oil, milk, and vanilla. Whisk to combine. Pour the wet ingredients over the dry ingredients and stir until just mixed well. Stir in parsnips and walnuts.
7859780a-967d-4799-83d7-9e8e83839333 Pour batter into prepared pan and bake for about 25 minutes, until a tester comes out clean from the center of the cake. Cool completely on a rack.
7859780a-967d-4799-83d7-9e8e83839333 When cool, frost if you like.
beca3fea-7681-4b3b-a068-26c3b9579530 Have all ingredients at room temperature. Preheat oven to 325°F with a rack in the center.
beca3fea-7681-4b3b-a068-26c3b9579530 Spread the butter all over the bottom and sides of a 9-inch springform pan.
beca3fea-7681-4b3b-a068-26c3b9579530 Crush the graham crackers into crumbs. You can do this in a sealed plastic bag with a rolling pin or in a food processor. Pour the graham cracker crumbs into the greased pan and tap to distribute them around the bottom and sides, forming a thin crust. Tap out any excess.
beca3fea-7681-4b3b-a068-26c3b9579530 Place the raspberries and the two tablespoons of sugar into a blender and process until smooth. Pass the puree through a fine-mesh strainer to remove all the seeds.
beca3fea-7681-4b3b-a068-26c3b9579530 In a large mixing bowl, beat the softened cream cheese for 30 to 60 seconds, just until smooth. Scrape down the sides of the bowl.
beca3fea-7681-4b3b-a068-26c3b9579530 Pour in the sugar little by little and beat until smooth and creamy, a minute or two.
beca3fea-7681-4b3b-a068-26c3b9579530 Add the eggs one at a time, beating until just incorporated and scraping down the sides of the bowl as necessary.
beca3fea-7681-4b3b-a068-26c3b9579530 Add the heavy cream, sour cream, lemon zest, lemon juice, and vanilla. Beat briefly, just until combined.
beca3fea-7681-4b3b-a068-26c3b9579530 Pour creamy filling into crust.
beca3fea-7681-4b3b-a068-26c3b9579530 Pour raspberry puree over creamy filling. Use a knife to swirl it into the top of the filling any way you like. (Refer to video for visual cues.)
beca3fea-7681-4b3b-a068-26c3b9579530 Wrap the outside of the pan tightly with foil. Place the pan into a roasting pan or large baking dish. Position the pan on the center oven rack and then carefully pour boiling water into the outer roasting pan to reach halfway up the sides of the cheesecake pan.
beca3fea-7681-4b3b-a068-26c3b9579530 Bake for 55 to 60 minutes, until the outsides of the cake are set and the center still jiggles when you move the pan.
beca3fea-7681-4b3b-a068-26c3b9579530 Turn off the oven and leave the door ajar (you can use a utensil to prop it open). Let the cake rest in the oven for an hour.
beca3fea-7681-4b3b-a068-26c3b9579530 Remove cake from oven and from water bath. Remove foil. Let cake cool completely in pan.
beca3fea-7681-4b3b-a068-26c3b9579530 Cover cake and refrigerate overnight to chill through completely.
beca3fea-7681-4b3b-a068-26c3b9579530 Carefully remove outer ring from cake and serve.
3f02a492-5c87-4d60-b0ac-453e0377923a Preheat oven to 350°F with a rack in the center. Butter and flour an 8 x 8-inch baking pan, tapping out any excess flour.
3f02a492-5c87-4d60-b0ac-453e0377923a Into a medium mixing bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
3f02a492-5c87-4d60-b0ac-453e0377923a In a large mixing bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk, beat butter and sugar together on medium-high until pale and fluffy, about 5 minutes. Beat in the eggs one at a time until incorporated. Add vanilla and beat for 5 minutes more.
3f02a492-5c87-4d60-b0ac-453e0377923a Reduce mixer speed to low and alternate between adding the flour mixture (in 3 parts) and the milk (in two parts), starting and ending with flour. Mix just until batter is smooth — do not overmix.
3f02a492-5c87-4d60-b0ac-453e0377923a Spread batter into pan and bake for 30-35 minutes, just until a cake tester comes out clean from the center. Cake will be pale, not brown. Cool completely before frosting.
208e296a-e0d4-4e5f-8f2d-996bb6f29b8d Preheat the oven to 300° F. (Yup, just 300!) Spray both pans with cooking spray. Cut out two circles of parchment paper to cover the bottoms of the pans. Place them in the greased pans and spray those, too.
208e296a-e0d4-4e5f-8f2d-996bb6f29b8d Combine the hot coffee with the chopped chocolate in a heatproof bowl or glass measuring cup. Let sit for a few minutes and then stir until the chocolate is completely melted.
208e296a-e0d4-4e5f-8f2d-996bb6f29b8d In a very large bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer, beat the eggs until thickened a bit and lightened in color, about 4 minutes. Add the coffee-chocolate mixture, oil, buttermilk, and vanilla and beat on low until well combined.
208e296a-e0d4-4e5f-8f2d-996bb6f29b8d Into a large bowl, sift together the sugar, flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder and salt. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients all at once and mix on low just until well combined.
208e296a-e0d4-4e5f-8f2d-996bb6f29b8d Pour half the batter into each pan and bake until a cake tester inserted into the center comes out clean, approximately 60 to 70 minutes.
208e296a-e0d4-4e5f-8f2d-996bb6f29b8d Let the cake cool completely in the pans on cooling racks. Then run a knife around the sides of each pan and turn out the layers. Remove the parchment. The cake is ready for frosting when completely cool.
76d28ff1-4f96-4dc1-bbc5-d5b04098967d Preheat oven to 325°F with a rack in the center. Butter or spray a 9-inch round cake pan (I have one like this, or try one of these) with cooking spray. Line the bottom of the pan with a circle of parchment paper and butter or spray that too.
76d28ff1-4f96-4dc1-bbc5-d5b04098967d In a strainer, toss zucchini with 1 cup of the sugar and let sit for 10 minutes to drain. Use your hands to squeeze out all the liquid you can.
76d28ff1-4f96-4dc1-bbc5-d5b04098967d In a mixing bowl, beat eggs with a fork, then beat in zucchini and oil.
76d28ff1-4f96-4dc1-bbc5-d5b04098967d Sprinkle in the flour, remaining 1 2/3 cups sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon and salt. Use the fork to stir the dry ingredients together a bit and then incorporate into the wet ingredients, mixing gently until well combined.
76d28ff1-4f96-4dc1-bbc5-d5b04098967d Stir in chocolate chips.
76d28ff1-4f96-4dc1-bbc5-d5b04098967d Scrape batter into pan and spread evenly.
76d28ff1-4f96-4dc1-bbc5-d5b04098967d Bake for 50 to 60 minutes, until the center doesn't jiggle and a tester comes out clean unless you hit a chocolate chip.
76d28ff1-4f96-4dc1-bbc5-d5b04098967d Cool in pan on a rack for at least 40 minutes before removing from pan to cool completely.
76d28ff1-4f96-4dc1-bbc5-d5b04098967d Sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve at room temperature.
2443a09c-60e4-4e73-bb04-7b6acab1fb4c Have all ingredients at room temperature.
2443a09c-60e4-4e73-bb04-7b6acab1fb4c Preheat oven to 350°F with a rack in the center, and grease a 9 x 13 x 2-inch baking pan.
2443a09c-60e4-4e73-bb04-7b6acab1fb4c In a medium mixing bowl, stir the rhubarb pieces together with two tablespoons of the sugar. Let sit while you make the batter.
2443a09c-60e4-4e73-bb04-7b6acab1fb4c In another medium mixing bowl, stir together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cardamom.
2443a09c-60e4-4e73-bb04-7b6acab1fb4c In a small bowl, stir together the sour cream and vanilla extract.
2443a09c-60e4-4e73-bb04-7b6acab1fb4c In a large bowl (or the bowl of a. stand mixer), beat together the butter and the remaining cup sugar until lightened in color and texture, about 3 minutes.
2443a09c-60e4-4e73-bb04-7b6acab1fb4c Add the eggs one at a time, beating to incorporate after each addition.
2443a09c-60e4-4e73-bb04-7b6acab1fb4c Then add the flour mixture in three parts, alternating with the sour cream in two parts and beating on low after each addition until just incorporated.
2443a09c-60e4-4e73-bb04-7b6acab1fb4c Gently fold the rhubarb into the batter.
2443a09c-60e4-4e73-bb04-7b6acab1fb4c Scrape the batter evenly into the prepared pan.
46af5b1a-f72f-4917-aef0-8265a088ba19 Preheat oven to 350°F with a rack in the center. Spray a half-sheet pan with cooking spray, line it with a piece of parchment paper, and spray the paper too.
46af5b1a-f72f-4917-aef0-8265a088ba19 Into a large bowl, sift together the flour, ginger, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, and salt.
46af5b1a-f72f-4917-aef0-8265a088ba19 In the bowl of a stand mixer, beat the butter with the paddle attachment on medium-high speed until light and fluffy. Add brown sugar and beat until combined with the butter, stopping to scrape down the sides of the bowl with a spatula as needed.
46af5b1a-f72f-4917-aef0-8265a088ba19 Beat in the eggs one at a time.
46af5b1a-f72f-4917-aef0-8265a088ba19 Lower the mixing speed to medium-low and pour in the molasses. Beat until incorporated. Beat in hot water.
46af5b1a-f72f-4917-aef0-8265a088ba19 Lower mixing speed to low and gradually spoon in the flour mixture, along with the lemon zest. Mix just until combined.
46af5b1a-f72f-4917-aef0-8265a088ba19 Pour batter onto prepared baking sheet and smooth with a spatula. Bake for 20-25 minutes, until a tester comes out clean.
46af5b1a-f72f-4917-aef0-8265a088ba19 Let gingerbread cool in the pan set over a cooling rack.
46af5b1a-f72f-4917-aef0-8265a088ba19 Once cooled, remove cake from pan. (If you have a large cutting board, you can place it directly on top of the sheet pan and flip the whole thing over to release the gingerbread onto the cutting board. Peel off parchment paper and cut gingerbread into 1-inch squares.
63a0244b-6188-4aa0-9910-e385d71369e9 Preheat oven to 350°F. Line two standard muffin tins with 24 decorative paper liners.
63a0244b-6188-4aa0-9910-e385d71369e9 In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle, mix sugar, flour, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda and salt on low speed until well combined.
63a0244b-6188-4aa0-9910-e385d71369e9 Add eggs, milk, oil and vanilla extract. Mix on medium speed until batter is smooth. Pour in boiling water and carefully mix on low until just incorporated.
63a0244b-6188-4aa0-9910-e385d71369e9 Divide batter among muffin cups. Bake cupcakes for about 18 minutes, until a tester comes out clean. Cool completely on a wire rack before frosting.
13a746a6-6f9e-404f-aab8-f47de8e8117c Preheat the oven to 325° F for cake or 375° F for cupcakes. Grease the bottom of a 10-inch tube or bundt pan, or line two cupcake pans with a total of 20 paper liners. Have all ingredients at room temperature.
13a746a6-6f9e-404f-aab8-f47de8e8117c Beat flour and butter together for five minutes.
13a746a6-6f9e-404f-aab8-f47de8e8117c Add eggs one at a time, beating after each addition.
13a746a6-6f9e-404f-aab8-f47de8e8117c Add sugar, baking powder, salt and vanilla and almond extracts. Beat for two minutes more.
13a746a6-6f9e-404f-aab8-f47de8e8117c For a cake, bake for about one hour, checking after fifty minutes. For cupcakes, bake for 20-25 minutes.
13a746a6-6f9e-404f-aab8-f47de8e8117c Cool in pan for 10 minutes and then completely on a rack before frosting.
0a3b2619-c68d-48c2-91bf-80ea35e0ce0c Preheat oven to 350°F. Line three standard muffin tins with 36 paper liners (or bake in batches, one or two tins at a time).
0a3b2619-c68d-48c2-91bf-80ea35e0ce0c In a very large bowl or the bowl of a large stand mixer fitted with the paddle (I have this one, which is 6 quarts, and it still sloshed a little), stir sugar, flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda and salt until combined.
0a3b2619-c68d-48c2-91bf-80ea35e0ce0c Add eggs, milk, oil and vanilla extract. Mix on low speed until batter is smooth. Pour in boiling water and stir with a spoon or very carefully mix on low speed with the splash guard surrounding the bowl until just incorporated.
0a3b2619-c68d-48c2-91bf-80ea35e0ce0c Pour batter into muffin cups. Bake cupcakes for about 18 minutes, until a tester comes out clean. Cool completely on a wire rack before frosting.
8bdbe893-9f32-4658-b0de-5df7da3ac04d Preheat oven to 350°F with a rack in the center. Butter and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
8bdbe893-9f32-4658-b0de-5df7da3ac04d In a large bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer, beat together the sugar and eggs for 30 seconds. Add the rest of the ingredients and beat for one minute more.
8bdbe893-9f32-4658-b0de-5df7da3ac04d Divide batter evenly between the prepared cake pans and bake for about 30 minutes, until a tester comes out clean and the cake has slightly pulled away from the sides of the pan.
8bdbe893-9f32-4658-b0de-5df7da3ac04d Cool in pans for five minutes before turning out onto a rack to cool completely.
18cabf40-9f91-4772-a540-269efbb2f72f Preheat oven to 350°F. Line two standard muffin tins with 24 decorative paper liners to match your theme.
18cabf40-9f91-4772-a540-269efbb2f72f In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle, mix sugar, flour, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda and salt on low speed until well combined.
18cabf40-9f91-4772-a540-269efbb2f72f Add eggs, milk, oil and vanilla extract. Mix on medium speed until batter is smooth. Pour in boiling water and carefully mix on low until just incorporated.
18cabf40-9f91-4772-a540-269efbb2f72f Divide batter among muffin cups. Bake cupcakes for about 18 minutes, until a tester comes out clean. Cool completely on a wire rack before frosting.
ea53dd5b-5319-42ff-bd84-5755abd1f1b2 Preheat the oven to 350°F. In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment or a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs and add oil while mixer is running. Add vanilla, and then gradually add the sugar.
ea53dd5b-5319-42ff-bd84-5755abd1f1b2 In a separate medium size bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and spices. Add these dry ingredients to the wet mixture a little at a time, mixing everything thoroughly to make a smooth batter.
ea53dd5b-5319-42ff-bd84-5755abd1f1b2 Add the carrots and nuts, then the coconut and pineapple and mix until all the ingredients are blended into the batter.
ea53dd5b-5319-42ff-bd84-5755abd1f1b2 Pour the batter into a greased 9x13 inch pan and bake for 45 to 50 minutes. Cake is done when a tester inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool completely in the pan on a cooling rack.
94e95767-f9a8-49a1-9474-8821660475c8 Have all ingredients at room temperature. Preheat oven to 350°F with a rack in the center, and grease a 9 x 13 x 2-inch baking pan.
94e95767-f9a8-49a1-9474-8821660475c8 In a large bowl, stir together the 2 cups flour, baking powder, baking soda, and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
94e95767-f9a8-49a1-9474-8821660475c8 In a small bowl, stir together the sour cream and vanilla extract.
94e95767-f9a8-49a1-9474-8821660475c8 In another large bowl, beat together the 4 tablespoons butter and the 1 cup sugar until lightened in color and texture, about 3 minutes. Add the eggs one at a time, beating to incorporate after each addition. Then add the flour mixture in three parts, alternating with the sour cream in two parts and beating on low after each addition until just incorporated.
94e95767-f9a8-49a1-9474-8821660475c8 Toss the blueberries with the remaining tablespoon of flour and gently fold into the batter. Scrape the batter evenly into the prepared pan.
