076fa9ba-ef75-4118-850e-77ad90e6d645 In a small pan, toast the sesame and cumin seeds over medium-low heat until the sesame seeds begin to turn golden brown and the seeds are very fragrant. Add the warm seeds to the bowl.
076fa9ba-ef75-4118-850e-77ad90e6d645 In a blender, combine the lemon juice and zest, olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper. Blend until smooth.
076fa9ba-ef75-4118-850e-77ad90e6d645 Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine well. Serve immediately or store in the fridge for up to three days.
72535329-fb93-47d7-adb6-79dbd7af95db Heat the oil in a heavy 5-quart pot over medium-high heat.
72535329-fb93-47d7-adb6-79dbd7af95db Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes.
72535329-fb93-47d7-adb6-79dbd7af95db Add the garlic, ginger, cumin, coriander, paprika, and turmeric and cook, stirring constantly, for 90 seconds.
72535329-fb93-47d7-adb6-79dbd7af95db Add the split peas and the salt and pepper along with 5 cups water, and give it all a good stir.
72535329-fb93-47d7-adb6-79dbd7af95db Raise the heat to high and bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to maintain a simmer and cover the pot.
72535329-fb93-47d7-adb6-79dbd7af95db Cook, stirring occasionally, until split peas are very tender and have lost their defined shape, about an hour.
72535329-fb93-47d7-adb6-79dbd7af95db Stir in lemon juice and zest and cilantro.
72535329-fb93-47d7-adb6-79dbd7af95db Serve as a main dish with rice and leafy greens or as an accompaniment to a larger meal (à la Indian dal).
65931a85-94a4-4760-8b8b-5393f64376bc Rinse the lentils well under running water, then place them in a bowl with the water and soak for 30 minutes.
65931a85-94a4-4760-8b8b-5393f64376bc Meanwhile, finely chop the cilantro (including stems), onion, and garlic, and grate the ginger. Set the cilantro aside.
65931a85-94a4-4760-8b8b-5393f64376bc Place the mustard seeds in a 5-quart Dutch oven or other pot with a heavy bottom, and cook over medium heat until they begin to pop. Add the onion, garlic, ginger, and olive oil. Reduce heat to low and cook, stirring frequently, for 5 minutes. Add the ground coriander, cumin, turmeric, paprika, and curry leaves, and continue cooking, stirring frequently, for 3 minutes.
65931a85-94a4-4760-8b8b-5393f64376bc Add the lentils and their soaking water, the tomatoes, honey, fenugreek, and salt, and stir to blend. Cover and simmer for about 30 minutes, until the lentils are fully cooked.
65931a85-94a4-4760-8b8b-5393f64376bc Stir in the butter, lemon or lime juice, and cilantro. Serve hot.
168e23c0-e5fe-4a0c-9c52-6ea8afa0b5e5 If cooking larger, thicker-skinned beans such as chickpeas, great northern, cannellini, soak them for four to eight hours in cool water filtered if possible, to cover by a couple of inches, with two teaspoons of salt. Then proceed as directed in step two, discarding soaking water.
168e23c0-e5fe-4a0c-9c52-6ea8afa0b5e5 Rinse beans under running water and pick out any non-beanlike goodies such as small stones. Place beans in a medium pot and add fresh cool water, filtered if possible, to cover by about two inches.
168e23c0-e5fe-4a0c-9c52-6ea8afa0b5e5 Add salt, bay leaves, garlic, and onion, along with additional ingredients listed above, if using.
168e23c0-e5fe-4a0c-9c52-6ea8afa0b5e5 Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a gentle simmer. Partially cover the pot and simmer slowly until beans are done to your liking, stirring occasionally and topping up with additional water if necessary. This will take anywhere from an hour to three hours or more, depending on the type and age of the beans you’re using and how tender you'd like them.
7187df7d-e678-4e43-8987-efa190d99845 Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the onion and sauté until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the tofu and sauté until warm, about 2 minutes. Add the curry paste and stir gently but thoroughly to coat the tofu well.
7187df7d-e678-4e43-8987-efa190d99845 Add the tomatoes and their juices, the cauliflower, and 1 cup water. Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer until cauliflower is almost tender, about 15 minutes. Remove cover and simmer briskly until sauce thickens, about 5 minutes more. Serve spooned over rice. Leftovers will keep well in the fridge for a few days.
be4559db-4b78-4338-a5eb-6b0b8a88f42a Preheat oven to 250°F (121°C) with a rack in the center.
be4559db-4b78-4338-a5eb-6b0b8a88f42a Pat sirloin cap dry with paper towels.
be4559db-4b78-4338-a5eb-6b0b8a88f42a Score the fat in a crosshatch pattern. Make the cuts deep enough to cut through the fat but not through the meat. See video and step-by-step photos in post for visual cues.
be4559db-4b78-4338-a5eb-6b0b8a88f42a Sprinkle both sides generously with salt and pepper.
be4559db-4b78-4338-a5eb-6b0b8a88f42a Place steaks cut-side down in a cast iron pan.
be4559db-4b78-4338-a5eb-6b0b8a88f42a Roast for about 30 minutes, until internal temperature reaches 105°F (41°C).
be4559db-4b78-4338-a5eb-6b0b8a88f42a Remove steaks from pan and place pan over high heat on stovetop.
be4559db-4b78-4338-a5eb-6b0b8a88f42a Place steaks back in pan and sear 1 to 2 minutes per side, until golden brown.
be4559db-4b78-4338-a5eb-6b0b8a88f42a Rest 10 minutes before slicing against the grain.
be4559db-4b78-4338-a5eb-6b0b8a88f42a Serve with chimichurri sauce (if you like).
7fc1accc-31b9-4a4b-a2f9-38baa82ea2d5 Heat a cast-iron skillet over medium heat for two minutes. Open the hamburger buns and brush each inside face with some of the melted butter. Place buns buttered side down (probably in two batches, depending on your skillet) and toast for a couple of minutes, until light golden brown on the underside. Place buns on serving plates.
7fc1accc-31b9-4a4b-a2f9-38baa82ea2d5 Raise heat to medium-high. Divide beef into four hockey pucks and sprinkle both sides generously with salt and pepper.
7fc1accc-31b9-4a4b-a2f9-38baa82ea2d5 Place pucks onto skillet and use a sturdy metal spatula to firmly smash each puck into a patty that's about 1/3-inch thick. After this, absolutely ignore the burgers for about three minutes, until the undersides are brown and crisp at the edges and the juices on the surface are hot and bubbly. Scrape up each patty and any brown bits with the spatula and flip it. Cook one to two minutes more. Place a slice of cheese on top of each burger at the very end of cooking to melt just enough.
7fc1accc-31b9-4a4b-a2f9-38baa82ea2d5 To make the sauce, stir together all sauce ingredients in a small bowl until well combined.
7fc1accc-31b9-4a4b-a2f9-38baa82ea2d5 Transfer patties to buns. Layer each burger with two tomato slices and a piece of lettuce. Spoon 1/4 of the sauce onto each top bun half. Serve immediately.
37449edb-b430-465c-bf49-c4648c44f87b Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center.
37449edb-b430-465c-bf49-c4648c44f87b Pat filets dry with paper towels and season with salt and pepper.
37449edb-b430-465c-bf49-c4648c44f87b Heat a 12-inch cast iron pan over high heat until very hot. Carefully pour in oil and coat bottom of pan by swirling or spreading with a spatula.
37449edb-b430-465c-bf49-c4648c44f87b Place filets in pan and cook undisturbed for three minutes to sear. Flip once and cook two minutes more.
37449edb-b430-465c-bf49-c4648c44f87b Transfer pan to oven and cook just until meat reads 125°F on an instant read thermometer inserted into the center. Depending on thickness this will take from 2 to more than 5 minutes, so check early and often. The filet will continue to cook off the heat, so pulling it out of the pan at 125°F (or even a little before, if you like), will yield a beautiful, true medium-rare (130°) finished product
37449edb-b430-465c-bf49-c4648c44f87b Transfer filets to a cutting board to rest while you make the pan sauce.
aa53ddfd-09ec-4d71-8a0a-3104e7a1480c Set a heavy 5 1/2-quart pot (this is my favorite) over medium-high heat and add the bacon. Cook, stirring occasionally, until browned. If there is more than about two tablespoons of fat at the bottom of the pot, spoon out the rest and discard or save for another use. Add onion, carrot, and celery and continue cooking, stirring from time to time, until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in garlic and tomato paste and cook two minutes more.
aa53ddfd-09ec-4d71-8a0a-3104e7a1480c Add ground beef, along with one teaspoon of the salt, stirring to break up the meat into small pieces. Cook for about 5 minutes, until beef isn't pink. Stir in wine and simmer for a few minutes, until liquid is reduced by about half. Stir in tomato sauce, chopped tomatoes, cinnamon, nutmeg, and remaining teaspoon of salt.
aa53ddfd-09ec-4d71-8a0a-3104e7a1480c Cover pot and reduce heat to maintain a gentle simmer while you cook the spaghetti. Stir in cream and leave pot uncovered for the last few minutes of cooking.
aa53ddfd-09ec-4d71-8a0a-3104e7a1480c While the sauce simmers, fill a large, heavy pot halfway with well salted water and bring to a boil. Cook spaghetti al dente according to package instructions. Drain, return pasta to pot, and toss with several ladles of sauce. (Psst...I also sometimes throw in a big pat of really good butter while tossing the spaghetti with the sauce.)
aa53ddfd-09ec-4d71-8a0a-3104e7a1480c To serve, plate spaghetti in wide, shallow bowls and top with additional sauce. Pass grated cheese and a pepper mill at the table, along with some flaky sea salt if you like.
d2d24af0-9087-4000-af6c-a4e141cd2770 Pat steak dry with paper towels. If pieces are too long to fit on grill, cut into manageable sections.
d2d24af0-9087-4000-af6c-a4e141cd2770 In a gallon-size zip top bag, mix together the oil, orange and lime juices, garlic, salt, vinegar, and torn cilantro. Add meat and marinate at room temperature for two hours (or up to a day in the fridge), turning the bag over occasionally.
d2d24af0-9087-4000-af6c-a4e141cd2770 30 minutes before you're ready to eat, preheat grill to high. Grill the steak until nicely browned on the underside, 3 to 5 minutes. Then flip once and grill about 3 minutes more, depending on thickness, for medium-rare. Let steak rest for 10 minutes.
d2d24af0-9087-4000-af6c-a4e141cd2770 While steak rests, warm refried beans and tortillas according to package instructions, and assemble toppings in bowls at the table. Slice steak thinly against the grain.
d2d24af0-9087-4000-af6c-a4e141cd2770 Let everyone assemble their own tacos. Anything goes, but we recommend a nice schmear of refried beans on the bottom, a few slices of steak, and plenty of toppings.
515bd5db-04f2-4645-b3bc-a9ab3e856487 In a large zip-top bag or a 9x12 glass baking dish, stir together the vegetable oil, lime juice, sherry vinegar, garlic, shallot, chili powder, soy sauce and salt. Place steak in bag or dish and coat well with marinade. Marinate for two hours at room temperature or 8 hours in the fridge, flipping once if possible to ensure even coverage.
515bd5db-04f2-4645-b3bc-a9ab3e856487 Heat a gas grill to high (the hotter the better) or prepare a charcoal grill for direct heat. Remove steak from marinade and shake off any excess liquid, then grill each side for just a few minutes, until outside is nicely seared in spots and internal temperature reaches 130°F (check with an instant-read thermometer) for medium-rare. Skirt, flatiron and flank steak are best at medium-rare.
515bd5db-04f2-4645-b3bc-a9ab3e856487 Remove steak to a cutting board and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes. Place baguette slices on the grill in the coolest spot and toast very briefly, flipping once, to crisp the outside and get some grill marks. Set aside.
515bd5db-04f2-4645-b3bc-a9ab3e856487 Arrange some greens, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion and avocado in each of four bowls. Slice the steak thinly against the grain and top each bowl with a generous serving. Drizzle salads with olive oil and balsamic glaze. Sprinkle with flaky salt and pepper and serve.
5852cf80-17a7-449d-b796-7de3a6c8f3d6 Dry the beef cubes well with paper towels.
5852cf80-17a7-449d-b796-7de3a6c8f3d6 Set a large Dutch oven or other heavy, oven-proof lidded pot over medium-high heat. Add chopped bacon and cook, stirring from time to time, until browned. Remove bacon from pot, leaving fat in pot. In batches to avoid crowding, add beef cubes and brown well on all sides. Remove beef from pot and pour off (or spoon out) all but 2 to 3 tablespoons of fat. Preheat oven to 350°F with a rack in the lower third.
5852cf80-17a7-449d-b796-7de3a6c8f3d6 Add onions and carrots to pot. Cook, stirring from time to time, until lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Add garlic and cook, stirring, one minute more. Stir in tomato paste. Add beef and bacon back to pot. Pour in wine and enough beef broth to cover meat by about half an inch. Stir in thyme, bay leaves and salt. Cover pot with lid and place in oven. Cook for about two hours, until meat is very tender.
5852cf80-17a7-449d-b796-7de3a6c8f3d6 While stew cooks, set a frying pan over medium-high heat and pour in olive oil. When hot, add mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, until well browned.
5852cf80-17a7-449d-b796-7de3a6c8f3d6 When meat is very tender, carefully place pot on stovetop over medium heat. Add mushrooms and pearl onions. In a small bowl, mash together the butter and flour with a fork to form a paste. Stir paste into stew. Simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Serve immediately or bring to room temperature before refrigerating.
5852cf80-17a7-449d-b796-7de3a6c8f3d6 Remove thyme stems and bay leaves and stir in parsley just before serving.
d118bf43-309b-4d98-ac9c-92d8ca1a98f9 Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a half sheet pan with foil. To make the bacon weave, start by laying four bacon slices next to each other, long sides touching, in the middle of the pan. Then, one by one starting at the top, lay each of the remaining pieces crosswise. Weave the first piece over, under, over, under the original slices. Weave the second piece under, over, under, over, etc. (If you learned a different weaving method in elementary school, go for it.) Bake bacon until done to your liking -- 15 minutes plus depending on the thickness of the cut. Drain on paper towels, reserving the grease in the pan. When cooled enough, cut weave into four squares.
d118bf43-309b-4d98-ac9c-92d8ca1a98f9 Meanwhile, form four burger patties from the ground beef. Use your thumb to create a nice big divot in the middle of each patty to ensure even cooking. Sprinkle generously with salt and pepper immediately before cooking. You can grill the burgers or cook in a cast-iron pan with a couple tablespoons of the bacon grease. To grill, prepare a hot side and a cooler side of the grill with a little oil on the grates. Start burgers over direct heat, flipping once, to form a nice crust on both sides. This should take about three minutes per side. Transfer burgers to indirect heat to cook through to your liking (125°F for medium-rare, 130°F for medium on an instant-read thermometer). For cast iron, preheat a 12-inch cast iron pan over high heat until very hot. Pour in two tablespoons of bacon grease, then set burgers into pan. Cook on high heat to form a crust on both sides, flipping once, then reduce heat to medium and continue cooking according to internal temperature instructions above. Let burgers rest for at least 5 minutes before continuing.
d118bf43-309b-4d98-ac9c-92d8ca1a98f9 While burgers rest, add another two tablespoons of bacon grease into the hot pan, pile in the onions and sprinkle generously with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring frequently, until browned and wilted. Add marsala and cook until evaporated.
d118bf43-309b-4d98-ac9c-92d8ca1a98f9 To assemble the burgers, toast the buns for a minute or two if you like, then layer on some spinach leaves, a burger patty, bacon, onions, and some crumbled blue cheese.
665700ac-ef62-429d-a3fb-4abc728906ef Pat chicken breasts dry with paper towels.
665700ac-ef62-429d-a3fb-4abc728906ef To make the chicken in the Instant Pot: Pour chicken broth into Instant Pot and add chili powder, cumin, paprika, and salt. Arrange chicken breasts in a single layer in the Instant Pot. Close lid and set vent to sealing. Cook on manual, high pressure, for 8 minutes. Let the pressure release naturally for 5 minutes before carefully doing a manual release. See notes section for oven and stovetop cooking instructions.
665700ac-ef62-429d-a3fb-4abc728906ef Shred chicken with two forks while still warm.
665700ac-ef62-429d-a3fb-4abc728906ef To assemble the tacos, place some shredded chicken on a flour tortilla and top with avocado, salsa verde, pico de gallo, shredded cheese, and Cholula.
8a11a41b-a4d7-414b-b0ff-81d6ace878f9 In a 9x13-inch baking dish or other large, shallow dish, whisk together the marinade ingredients: olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, dill, oregano, and pepper.
8a11a41b-a4d7-414b-b0ff-81d6ace878f9 Cut each chicken breast in half across the middle and pound with a mallet if necessary to make each piece about an inch thick and a little bigger than a hamburger bun. Or, if using chicken tenders, see prep note below.
8a11a41b-a4d7-414b-b0ff-81d6ace878f9 Place chicken pieces into the dish with the marinade and coat well., Leave to marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes or in the fridge for anywhere between 2 and 24 hours.
8a11a41b-a4d7-414b-b0ff-81d6ace878f9 Cut bell peppers in half from stem end to tip and remove stems, ribs and seeds. Cut a slit of about an inch at both the top and bottom of each pepper half to help it relax into a flatter shape as it grills.
8a11a41b-a4d7-414b-b0ff-81d6ace878f9 Cut halloumi into four slices, not super-thin or they might get too floppy on the grill.
e88944d6-83b4-4c94-acfe-2977e8144f1b Preheat oven to 425°F with a rack in the center.
e88944d6-83b4-4c94-acfe-2977e8144f1b In a large mixing bowl, stir together mayo, garlic, lemon juice, mustard, salt, some pepper and two tablespoons of the parmesan.
e88944d6-83b4-4c94-acfe-2977e8144f1b Dry chicken well with paper towels. Remove tough tendons. (See note.)
e88944d6-83b4-4c94-acfe-2977e8144f1b Add chicken and stir to coat well. Set aside.
e88944d6-83b4-4c94-acfe-2977e8144f1b On a rimmed baking sheet, mix together the panko, remaining two tablespoons parmesan and the butter with your hands. Spread out in a single layer and bake for about 4 minutes, depending on your oven, watching very carefully to prevent burning, until just about browned to your liking.
e88944d6-83b4-4c94-acfe-2977e8144f1b Pour browned panko onto a large plate or into a wide, shallow bowl. Place wire rack onto baking sheet.
e88944d6-83b4-4c94-acfe-2977e8144f1b Use tongs to remove each chicken tender from the bowl and dredge in panko until well coated, then lay on wire rack with a little bit of space between tenders.
e88944d6-83b4-4c94-acfe-2977e8144f1b Bake for about 15 minutes, until chicken is just cooked through. There's no need to flip them.
e88944d6-83b4-4c94-acfe-2977e8144f1b Serve right away with ketchup or dipping sauce of your choice (if you like — the chicken is nice and flavorful on its own).
4b88fbfc-ec84-4e7b-9ec8-3e75ae4704fd Pat chicken breasts dry with paper towels.
4b88fbfc-ec84-4e7b-9ec8-3e75ae4704fd Pour chicken broth into Instant Pot and add salt and additional seasonings, if using.
4b88fbfc-ec84-4e7b-9ec8-3e75ae4704fd Arrange chicken breasts in a single layer in the Instant Pot.
4b88fbfc-ec84-4e7b-9ec8-3e75ae4704fd Close lid and set vent to sealing.
4b88fbfc-ec84-4e7b-9ec8-3e75ae4704fd Cook on manual, high pressure, for 8 minutes.
4b88fbfc-ec84-4e7b-9ec8-3e75ae4704fd Let the pressure release naturally for 5 minutes before carefully doing a manual release.
4b88fbfc-ec84-4e7b-9ec8-3e75ae4704fd Shred chicken with two forks, either in the pot or on a cutting board. Place chicken back into pot and stir with cooking liquid.
4b88fbfc-ec84-4e7b-9ec8-3e75ae4704fd Chicken will keep well, tightly sealed in the fridge, for a week. You can store it right in the cooking liquid.
3a21f027-6d94-4df7-92f4-876065ac83a3 Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C) with a rack in the center.
3a21f027-6d94-4df7-92f4-876065ac83a3 Remove any giblets from the cavity of the chicken and pat it dry all over.
3a21f027-6d94-4df7-92f4-876065ac83a3 Place the chicken into a roasting pan. For a 4 to 5 pound chicken, we like to use the good old 9x13x2-inch metal roasting pan we've had for years. Nothing fancy.
3a21f027-6d94-4df7-92f4-876065ac83a3 Rub the chicken all over with the olive oil, and sprinkle all over with the salt.
3a21f027-6d94-4df7-92f4-876065ac83a3 Tuck the tips of the wings under the chicken.
3a21f027-6d94-4df7-92f4-876065ac83a3 Roast for about 60 minutes, until the juices run clear when you stick the tip of a knife between one of the legs and thighs, and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the breast reads 145°F (63°C) to 150°F (65°C). Start checking around the 45 minute mark, and don't worry if it goes a little bit over.
3a21f027-6d94-4df7-92f4-876065ac83a3 Let the chicken rest on a cutting board for 20 minutes. Then carve and serve.
b38f0de9-6120-4e5d-b393-d3de5fca9ca1 Preheat oven to 425°F with a rack in the center. Choose a roasting pan that will accommodate the chicken and potatoes. (A good old 13" x 9" metal roasting pan that's on the deeper side and safe for the stovetop usually works well.) Place the chicken in the pan breast-side up and slide your fingers gently between the skin and the breast to make a pocket on each side.
b38f0de9-6120-4e5d-b393-d3de5fca9ca1 In a small bowl, mash together four tablespoons of the butter, the chopped prosciutto, garlic, sage, lemon zest and a few generous grinds of black pepper. Use your hands to spread most of the butter mixture between the skin and breast of the chicken, then rub the rest all over the outside of the bird. Tuck the thyme sprigs and lemon halves into the cavity of the chicken. Roast for 20 minutes.
b38f0de9-6120-4e5d-b393-d3de5fca9ca1 Meanwhile, bring a large pot of very well salted water to the boil, boil the potatoes for 10 minutes, and drain.
b38f0de9-6120-4e5d-b393-d3de5fca9ca1 Use tongs to lift up the chicken for a moment and add the parboiled potatoes to the bottom of the roasting pan. Roast for 40+ minutes more, until an instant thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh (but not touching the bone) reads 165°F. Let chicken rest on carving board for 10 minutes and spoon potatoes into a serving bowl.
b38f0de9-6120-4e5d-b393-d3de5fca9ca1 Make the gravy while the chicken rests. In a small bowl, mash together the remaining two tablespoons butter with the flour to make a paste. Set roasting pan over medium-high heat on the stove (one or two burners, depending on the size of your pan). Whisk flour paste into pan drippings and let brown for a minute. Then whisk in wine and simmer for a minute or two. Pour in stock, whisk to remove any lumps, and simmer for about 8 minutes until nicely thickened. Taste for salt and grind in some black pepper.
b38f0de9-6120-4e5d-b393-d3de5fca9ca1 Carve chicken and serve with potatoes, gravy to pass at the table, and maybe a nice simple kale salad.
960c6a22-efef-4e94-98b5-39a4af73916f Pat the chicken breasts dry with paper towels. With a very sharp knife, make each breast into a little pocket by cutting a horizontal slit into one of the thin sides. The slit should be almost but not quite the length of the chicken breast and go almost but not quite all the way through to the opposite side.
960c6a22-efef-4e94-98b5-39a4af73916f Stuff 1/4 of the provolone cubes into each breast and press the chicken lightly to seal around it. Don’t worry if it’s not perfect. Oozing cheese isn’t a terrible thing.
960c6a22-efef-4e94-98b5-39a4af73916f Wrap each stuffed chicken breast in a couple of slices of prosciutto, covering as much of the surface as you can.
960c6a22-efef-4e94-98b5-39a4af73916f Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil over medium-high in a 12-inch nonstick skillet. Add wrapped chicken breasts and cook, uncovered, on one side until prosciutto is darkened in color and chicken breast is about halfway cooked through. Flip once and cook until chicken breast is jus cooked through. Remove chicken breasts to a plate.
960c6a22-efef-4e94-98b5-39a4af73916f Heat remaining tablespoon of olive oil in the same skillet. Add shiitakes and cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned and tender. Add shallot and garlic and cook, stirring frequently, for a minute or two until softened.
960c6a22-efef-4e94-98b5-39a4af73916f Pour Marsala into pan and stir to scrape up any browned bits on bottom of pan. Simmer until liquid has just evaporated. Add chicken stock and sage and simmer briskly for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, stir together butter and flour with a fork to form a paste. Stir paste into pan sauce and continue to simmer for 5 minutes more. Add chicken back to pan and simmer until warm. Grind some pepper over everything and taste for salt.
960c6a22-efef-4e94-98b5-39a4af73916f To serve, place a piece of chicken on each of four plates and top with some mushrooms and sauce. Sautéed spinach makes a great, easy accompaniment.
34c55f8b-0548-407d-b88e-5e8bf800cd68 Preheat the oven to 375°F with a rack in the center. Remove any giblets and pat chickens dry with paper towels. Set the chickens on a rack in a large roasting pan, breast side up, and cut away and discard the two pockets of fat tucked just inside the opening to each chicken’s cavity.
34c55f8b-0548-407d-b88e-5e8bf800cd68 Combine the rosemary, thyme, oregano, garlic, salt, pepper and olive oil in a mortar, and smash it all into a paste with the pestle. (Alternatively, use the side of a chef’s knife to smash it all together.) Divide the paste between the two chickens and rub it all over the skin.
34c55f8b-0548-407d-b88e-5e8bf800cd68 Roast the chicken for 20 minutes with the breast side up. Then flip it and cook 20 minutes more, breast side down. Turn it over again and cook for an additional 20 minutes, breast side up. For a smaller chicken, this may be all the time you need. If it’s closer to 4 pounds, you’ll need an additional 20 or so minutes. Remove the chicken from the oven when a thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh reads 165° F.
34c55f8b-0548-407d-b88e-5e8bf800cd68 While the chicken roasts, whisk together the shallot, vinegar, extra-virgin olive oil and a generous amount of salt and pepper to make the dressing.
34c55f8b-0548-407d-b88e-5e8bf800cd68 Lay the baguette slices in a single layer on a sheet pan or two and brush each with a little bit of the dressing. When the chickens are cooked, let them rest on a cutting board, tented with foil, for 15 minutes. Turn off the oven and place the sheet pans inside so the bread toasts a bit from the residual heat.
34c55f8b-0548-407d-b88e-5e8bf800cd68 While the chickens rest, set the roasting pan over medium-high heat on a burner (or two) on the stovetop. Whisk the flour into the pan drippings to form a paste. Then pour in the stock and whisk until there are no lumps. Simmer briskly for 5 to 10 minutes, lowering heat as necessary, until gravy is as thick as you like.
34c55f8b-0548-407d-b88e-5e8bf800cd68 To serve, place some simple greens on each plate, arrange a piece of chicken and a few garlic croutons on top, and drizzle as liberally as you like with both dressing and gravy.
77fee3f7-df9d-4f57-a46b-7f9ccd431260 Heat a 12-inch cast-iron pan or braiser over medium-high heat. Season the chicken pieces well with salt and pepper. Place skin-side down in the skillet and cook, without disturbing, until golden brown on the skin side, about 5 minutes. Remove chicken to a plate.
77fee3f7-df9d-4f57-a46b-7f9ccd431260 Pour off all but two tablespoons of fat from the pan. Reduce heat to medium. Add the leeks, mushrooms, garlic, rosemary and sage and cook, stirring often, until all the veggies have softened and substantially reduced in volume, 5-10 minutes. Add flour and cook, stirring constantly, for a minute or two. Stir in the wine, chicken stock and cream and bring to a boil. Add browned chicken, skin-side up, and any juices that have accumulated on the plate. Adjust heat to keep liquid at a simmer, and cook until chicken is done all the way through, about 45 minutes.
77fee3f7-df9d-4f57-a46b-7f9ccd431260 Serve with rice, noodles or potatoes.
58adc947-c100-4748-b76d-6c0f407ed2fb If you are starting with raw chicken breasts: Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center. Place chicken breasts in a small roasting pan and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon chili powder, a bit of the salt, and pepper. Turn with tongs to coat evenly. Bake until cooked through, 20 minutes give or take. Set aside to cool. (If you are starting with cooked chicken or turkey, skip this step and simply add the full amount of chili powder to the pot in step 2 below.)
58adc947-c100-4748-b76d-6c0f407ed2fb While the chicken bakes, warm the remaining two tablespoons olive oil in a medium Dutch oven or other heavy pot over medium-high heat. Add the onion and pepper along with remaining salt and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and a little bit browned, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic, reduce heat to medium, and cook, stirring frequently, until very fragrant, about a minute. Add flour, remaining 1 teaspoon chili powder and the cumin and stir to coat vegetables. Cook, stirring, for one minute.
58adc947-c100-4748-b76d-6c0f407ed2fb Pour in the broth and diced chilis and raise heat to high. Stir a few times to incorporate flour, then bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer for about five minutes.
58adc947-c100-4748-b76d-6c0f407ed2fb Using two forks, shred chicken. Add chicken, beans, and corn to pot along with any accumulated juices from the chicken roasting pan, and simmer for a few minutes more to warm through.
58adc947-c100-4748-b76d-6c0f407ed2fb Off the heat, stir in cilantro, red onion and lime juice. To serve, ladle into bowls and pass cheese, sour cream and lime wedges at the table if you like.
9e5339b0-677c-472a-a770-22038e614fa3 To make the tuna poke, cut tuna into bite-sized cubes. I like them on the smaller side — maybe 1/2-inch dice — but it's totally up to you. Place cubes in a small mixing bowl and add scallion, shallot, tamari, sesame oil and chili flakes. Toss gently and set aside.
9e5339b0-677c-472a-a770-22038e614fa3 To make the salmon poke, cut salmon into cubes to match the size of the tuna and place in a small mixing bowl. In another small bowl, stir together the mayonnaise, sriracha and tamari. Spoon sauce over salmon and toss gently to coat. Stir in shallot and scallion and set aside.
9e5339b0-677c-472a-a770-22038e614fa3 To assemble the bowls, place some rice in the bottom of each serving bowl. Arrange portions of tuna, salmon, and whatever additional ingredients you like. Pictured here are avocado, seaweed salad that I bought already prepared, some simple shelled edamame, a little bit of salmon roe, and a nice sprinkle of gomasio, freshly ground black pepper, and chili toasted sesame oil.
65835c03-6a56-482c-8a78-05691d41d07e Preheat the oven to 275° F // 135° C with a rack in the center.
65835c03-6a56-482c-8a78-05691d41d07e Place the salmon skin-side down on a rimmed baking sheet or baking dish. Remove and discard any pin bones.
65835c03-6a56-482c-8a78-05691d41d07e Rub the olive oil all over the flesh.
65835c03-6a56-482c-8a78-05691d41d07e Sprinkle the salmon evenly with the shallots, capers, lemon juice, and a generous amount of salt and pepper.
65835c03-6a56-482c-8a78-05691d41d07e Roast for 15 minutes. Flesh will be just barely opaque in the center, and still quite soft, when it's done.
65835c03-6a56-482c-8a78-05691d41d07e Serve warm or at room temperature.
950506c5-8e04-4ad6-8875-2cd92623e576 Peel and devein the shrimp, leaving tails on. (See note below.)
950506c5-8e04-4ad6-8875-2cd92623e576 Set a large frying pan over medium-high heat and warm the olive oil.
950506c5-8e04-4ad6-8875-2cd92623e576 Add shallot, garlic, red pepper flakes, and salt. Cook, stirring frequently, for a minute or so until shallots turn slightly translucent.
950506c5-8e04-4ad6-8875-2cd92623e576 Add shrimp to pan. The two pounds of shrimp in this recipe will not fit in a single layer in almost any frying pan, but here we're not looking for browning, so it's totally fine. Use tongs or a spatula to keep the shrimp moving so they cook evenly. Take them out individually and put on a plate just as they start to turn pink. You'll finish cooking them later.
950506c5-8e04-4ad6-8875-2cd92623e576 After removing the shrimp, pour in the wine and lemon juice. Simmer briskly until liquid is reduced by about a third.
950506c5-8e04-4ad6-8875-2cd92623e576 Turn heat to low and swirl in butter until it's melted into a silky sauce.
950506c5-8e04-4ad6-8875-2cd92623e576 Return shrimp to pan and cook, stirring to coat with sauce, just until cooked through.
950506c5-8e04-4ad6-8875-2cd92623e576 Off the heat, sprinkle with plenty of freshly ground black pepper and the parsley.
950506c5-8e04-4ad6-8875-2cd92623e576 There are lots of ways to serve shrimp scampi. You can place the whole pan on the table along with a couple of torn baguettes and let everyone have at it. You can toss with a pound of cooked spaghetti or linguine. Or you can spoon it atop basmati rice pilaf or orzo. All pretty, pretty, pretty good.
1e7c9360-4cd4-4faf-a50e-9156b779cc50 Drain water or oil from tuna and place into a medium mixing bowl. Break up any large pieces of tuna with a fork.
1e7c9360-4cd4-4faf-a50e-9156b779cc50 Add celery, shallot, mustard, mayonnaise, salt, and pepper, along with any of the optional additions. Stir to combine well.
1e7c9360-4cd4-4faf-a50e-9156b779cc50 Serve with salad or on a sandwich or tuna melt. For salads and sandwiches, I like to add a little freshly squeezed lemon juice right before serving.
3d5fe608-0bc0-4dda-b40e-7b496b02d6c9 Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center. Into a large, heavy pan with a lid (such as this one or this one), place the shallots, bell pepper, tomatoes, garlic, capers, wine, stock, thyme and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt. Bake, covered, for 20 minutes.
3d5fe608-0bc0-4dda-b40e-7b496b02d6c9 Pat sea bass fillets dry with paper towels. Carefully remove pan from oven and arrange filets in pan on top of sauce, nestling them in a bit. Sprinkle fish with remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt and dot with butter.
3d5fe608-0bc0-4dda-b40e-7b496b02d6c9 Return pan to oven, uncovered. Bake until fish is just cooked through, about 15 to 20 minutes depending on thickness.
3d5fe608-0bc0-4dda-b40e-7b496b02d6c9 To serve, place about a cup of orzo into each of four wide, shallow bowls and top each with a piece of fish. Spoon some veggies and plenty of sauce overtop, and sprinkle with basil and freshly ground black pepper.
92f5d56e-3788-46c6-9e85-ce5b77cc4eb6 If your scallops still have the little piece of muscle attached to the side, remove and discard it. (See video for technique.) Pat scallops dry with paper towels and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
92f5d56e-3788-46c6-9e85-ce5b77cc4eb6 Dice the chorizo into small cubes (about 1/4-inch). Heat a 12-inch nonstick pan over high heat. Add chorizo and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned on several sides — just a few minutes. Remove chorizo to a bowl.
92f5d56e-3788-46c6-9e85-ce5b77cc4eb6 Add oil to pan and keep over high heat. When very hot, add scallops without crowding. Cook 60 seconds without moving, then add butter and cook 30 seconds more. Use tongs to flip each scallop and cook just until done to your liking. I like to pull them off the heat before they're opaque in the center, which, depending on size, may mean just 30 seconds or so on the second side.
92f5d56e-3788-46c6-9e85-ce5b77cc4eb6 To serve, place a few scallops and some of the chorizo on each plate and sprinkle with chives, if using. These are great over basmati rice pilaf.
36239a50-ef50-456e-a095-feefdf0cfc83 Bring a medium pot of salted water to the boil. Add the freekeh and cook, uncovered, 22 to 25 minutes, until tender. Drain and return to pot. Set aside in a warm place.
36239a50-ef50-456e-a095-feefdf0cfc83 Meanwhile, in a medium nonstick pan, warm two teaspoons of the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook, stirring constantly, until very fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add kale, in batches if necessary, along with some salt and pepper. Cook for a minute or two, until beginning to wilt. Add dates along with 1/2 cup of water. Continue cooking, stirring from time to time, until kale is tender and water has evaporated. Add kale mixture to the freekeh and stir to combine. Squeeze in juice of half the lemon.
36239a50-ef50-456e-a095-feefdf0cfc83 In a small bowl, stir together the labneh and juice of remaining half lemon. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
36239a50-ef50-456e-a095-feefdf0cfc83 Wipe out the pan used for the kale and warm remaining two teaspoons olive oil over medium-high heat. Season salmon fillets generously with salt and pepper, then place skin-side down in hot skillet. Cook undisturbed for 5 minutes or so, until skin is browned and crisp. Gently flip fillets and cook a minute or two more, until salmon is done to your liking.
36239a50-ef50-456e-a095-feefdf0cfc83 Divide freekeh mixture between two plates. Top each with a salmon fillet and some lemon labneh. Serve immediately.
f05401f4-3193-4c40-8837-68210c5ec298 Melt 1 tablespoon of the butter over medium-high heat in a 12-inch nonstick frying pan or seasoned cast iron skillet.
f05401f4-3193-4c40-8837-68210c5ec298 Add the shrimp and cook, turning once, until just opaque. Remove to a plate.
f05401f4-3193-4c40-8837-68210c5ec298 Melt the remaining tablespoon butter in the same pan over medium-high heat.
f05401f4-3193-4c40-8837-68210c5ec298 Add onion and shiitakes and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions are softened, about 5 minutes.
f05401f4-3193-4c40-8837-68210c5ec298 Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for one minute.
f05401f4-3193-4c40-8837-68210c5ec298 Add the kale by the handful and cook, stirring occasionally, until wilted and almost tender, about 5 minutes.
f05401f4-3193-4c40-8837-68210c5ec298 Add the soy sauce, wine, and cream, and cook until sauce has thickened slightly, 2 to 3 minutes.
f05401f4-3193-4c40-8837-68210c5ec298 Return shrimp to pan along with any accumulated juices and continue cooking for a minute or so to rewarm.
f05401f4-3193-4c40-8837-68210c5ec298 Serve immediately.
d44ef944-f201-47be-ac1a-e993c7200c9e Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack in the center. Cut potatoes into bite-sized pieces, about 1-inch by 1/2-inch, but don't stress. On a rimmed half-sheet pan (18-inch x 13-inch), toss with olive oil, 1 teaspoon salt, and a few good grinds black pepper. Roast for 30 minutes or until crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. I don't bother to toss them during cooking, which results in the undersides being nicely browned and no sticking. You can toss them halfway through if you like.
d44ef944-f201-47be-ac1a-e993c7200c9e Push potatoes to the perimeter of the sheet pan. Lay salmon pieces in center and asparagus in bunches over potatoes as pictured above. Rub a little olive oil onto each pice of salmon and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Sprinkle chopped herbs over everything. Roast for about 10 minutes, until salmon is just cooked through and asparagus are crisp-tender.
d44ef944-f201-47be-ac1a-e993c7200c9e Before serving, garnish with lemon wedges and drizzle with additional olive oil and some flaky sea salt if you like. Serve immediately.
2761789c-d789-490b-a5f0-6b3adf35c7e1 Mix together the ketchup, horseradish, tabasco, gin, celery salt, salt and lemon juice. Chill until ready to serve. Stir in parsley right before serving.
2761789c-d789-490b-a5f0-6b3adf35c7e1 Peel and devein shrimp, leaving tails attached. Place peels into a large pot. Add water, 1 tablespoon of the salt, wine or vermouth, peppercorns, coriander seeds, bay leaves, onion, tarragon and lemon. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and let sit 30 minutes more, then strain broth through a fine sieve into a fresh pot.
2761789c-d789-490b-a5f0-6b3adf35c7e1 Bring stock to a boil, then remove from heat. Add shrimp and cover. Leave for 3 minutes (still off the heat -- the shrimp "poach" in the residual heat and remain amazingly tender).
2761789c-d789-490b-a5f0-6b3adf35c7e1 Fill a large bowl with ice water and the remaining tablespoon salt. Add shrimp and leave until just opaque, 3 minutes or a shade more if the shrimp are very big. Chill in fridge (I usually wrap in paper towels and put in a gallon zip top bag) until ready to serve.
d4b7c9f0-9f4d-494a-8cc1-a1d64135de02 Scrub the oysters well under running water to remove all sand and dirt. To shuck each oyster, hold it in a kitchen towel with the cupped side of the shell facing down so you won't lose the beautiful liquor when you open it. Insert the tip of an oyster knife firmly into the hinge and twist until it pops open. Then run the knife across the inside of the top shell. Watch the video linked in the notes section below to see this done.
d4b7c9f0-9f4d-494a-8cc1-a1d64135de02 Run the oyster knife between the meat and the bottom shell to fully release the meat from the shell so it can be slurped up later. Place shucked oysters on a rimmed baking pan lined with a big sheet of gently crumpled aluminum foil to prevent tipping. Discard top shells.
d4b7c9f0-9f4d-494a-8cc1-a1d64135de02 In a small pot, melt the butter with the shallot over medium heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the basil, parsley and lemon zest.
d4b7c9f0-9f4d-494a-8cc1-a1d64135de02 Line the bottom of a heavy 12-inch frying pan with about 1/4 inch of Kosher salt. (I really prefer a cast iron skillet for its superior heat retention). Preheat the pan over medium-high heat for at least 5 minutes, until the salt starts to make some little popping noises. Then quickly arrange the shucked oysters in the pan and top each with a spoonful of the herb butter. Cover the pan with a lid (carefully use foil if you don't have a lid that fits) and cook for three minutes, until the oysters are just opaque. They'll continue to cook a bit from the residual heat in the pan. Sprinkle with a little bit of chopped prosciutto and a squeeze of lemon juice. Serve warm straight from the pan.
0b4e9987-45be-40e5-b105-7c4153126cc1 In a 12-inch nonstick pan or shallow Dutch oven, melt 1 tablespoon butter over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds to a minute, until very fragrant but not browned. Add shrimp to pan in a single layer. Cook for about a minute on one side, until opaque, then flip and heat the other side until just cooked through. Remove from pan, sprinkle with about 1/3 of the lemon juice, and reserve.
0b4e9987-45be-40e5-b105-7c4153126cc1 Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons butter and the olive oil over medium-high in the same pan. Add onion and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. Add rice, stir well to coat with butter and oil, and cook for a minute. Pour in wine and stir to incorporate. Simmer, stirring frequently, until almost evaporated. Then add broth by the cupful, continuing to stir frequently and adding more as it absorbs. Add the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt during this process. Stir in broccoli as you add the last cup of broth. Stop cooking when there’s still a bit of thick broth remaining and the rice is tender but with the tiniest bite in the center of the grain.
0b4e9987-45be-40e5-b105-7c4153126cc1 Remove from heat, stir in remaining lemon juice and grated cheese and taste for seasoning. Arrange shrimp overtop, sprinkle with parsley and a little freshly ground black pepper, and serve with the rest of that bottle of wine.
5af02fc6-91c4-40e1-ac14-94b76f2ab2a9 Cut or tear the lobster meat into bite-sized pieces and place in a medium bowl.
5af02fc6-91c4-40e1-ac14-94b76f2ab2a9 In a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, lemon juice, capers, chives and salt and pepper. Pour the dressing over the lobster and toss gently to coat all the meat.
5af02fc6-91c4-40e1-ac14-94b76f2ab2a9 Melt the butter on a skillet over medium-high heat. Set the buns down on the skillet on one of their side edges. Cook for a minute or two until golden brown, then flip and cook the opposite side.
5af02fc6-91c4-40e1-ac14-94b76f2ab2a9 Divide the lobster meat among the buns and serve immediately.
79c7cc12-b30f-438f-b2c7-c8088397b1d9 In a heavy, wide skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Sprinkle a little bit of salt around the bottom of the pan.
79c7cc12-b30f-438f-b2c7-c8088397b1d9 Place the crabs into the pan in a single layer, shell side down. Cook undisturbed for about five minutes, until the underside is crispy and red with a few browned spots
79c7cc12-b30f-438f-b2c7-c8088397b1d9 Flip crabs and cook on the other side until cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes more. Serve immediately or pack for lunch.
e85efbdf-5a93-40a2-9c85-fb2a748cf700 Sprinkle the flour onto a plate and dredge each crab lightly in the flour.
e85efbdf-5a93-40a2-9c85-fb2a748cf700 Heat butter and oil in a heavy 12-inch skillet over medium heat.
e85efbdf-5a93-40a2-9c85-fb2a748cf700 Add three of the crabs shell-side down in a single layer. Cook for four minutes on the first side, then flip and cook for three minutes on the other side. Repeat with the remaining crabs.
e85efbdf-5a93-40a2-9c85-fb2a748cf700 While the crabs are cooking, combine the mayo, soy sauce, sriracha and shallot in a small bowl and mix well.
e85efbdf-5a93-40a2-9c85-fb2a748cf700 Place a bed of greens and some cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, and avocado slices in each of four wide bowls. Lay two crabs over each, and drizzle with spicy sauce. Serve warm.
d3419f3f-f56f-4696-8198-3ee624f78fe0 Line a rimmed sheet pan with parchment paper.
d3419f3f-f56f-4696-8198-3ee624f78fe0 Place the salmon, skin side down, on the parchment. Brush evenly with the lemon juice.
d3419f3f-f56f-4696-8198-3ee624f78fe0 Combine salt, sugar, and cracked pepper in a medium bowl.
d3419f3f-f56f-4696-8198-3ee624f78fe0 Sprinkle the mixture over the salmon, covering completely. The layer of curing mixture should be a little thicker where the salmon is thicker and thinner where the fillet thins out toward the tail.
d3419f3f-f56f-4696-8198-3ee624f78fe0 Cover evenly with the dill.
d3419f3f-f56f-4696-8198-3ee624f78fe0 Cover the salmon with another layer of parchment and then another sheet pan. Weight the top sheet pan with two 16-ounce cans.
d3419f3f-f56f-4696-8198-3ee624f78fe0 Refrigerate for 40-48 hours.
d3419f3f-f56f-4696-8198-3ee624f78fe0 Scrape the dill and curing mixture from the salmon. Rinse well and pat dry.
d3419f3f-f56f-4696-8198-3ee624f78fe0 Slice very thinly to serve. The salmon can be refrigerated for up to 5 days before serving.
37f57ba9-0192-4601-a4c5-732de1ba38be Combine all ingredients in a very small pot. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat. Boil for 30 seconds, then remove from heat and let cool completely.
37f57ba9-0192-4601-a4c5-732de1ba38be Pour cooled mixture through a fine-meshed sieve into a small baking dish or other freezer-safe container just big enough to hold the mixture in a shallow layer. (Protip: save the strained shallot and toss into your next salad.)
37f57ba9-0192-4601-a4c5-732de1ba38be Freeze the mixture, scraping every hour or so with a fork to break up the ice into small pieces, until fully frozen (probably about 3 hours).
37f57ba9-0192-4601-a4c5-732de1ba38be Serve in a small, very cold bowl as a condiment for oysters on the half shell.
11d431a4-504e-4bbb-bd77-003f1a39aa01 To cook the rice, combine it in a medium pot with 2 cups water, 1 tablespoon of the soy sauce, and the butter.
11d431a4-504e-4bbb-bd77-003f1a39aa01 Bring to a boil, then cover, lower the heat so that you see just a bit of steam escaping, and cook for 40 minutes (or according to the time on the package) without lifting the lid.
11d431a4-504e-4bbb-bd77-003f1a39aa01 Meanwhile, to cook the lentils, place them in a smallish pot with the bay leaf, Herbes de Provence, and the salt. Cover with about two inches of water, bring to a boil and then simmer for 20 minutes, or until tender.
11d431a4-504e-4bbb-bd77-003f1a39aa01 Drain the lentils and remove the bay leaf.
11d431a4-504e-4bbb-bd77-003f1a39aa01 While the rice and lentils cook, whisk together the olive oil, the vinegar, the remaining tablespoon of soy sauce, and a few generous twists of black pepper in a large bowl.
11d431a4-504e-4bbb-bd77-003f1a39aa01 Add the cooked rice and lentils, shallot, tomatoes, bell pepper, and parsley to the bowl and stir gently to let the dressing infuse it all with savory goodness.
11d431a4-504e-4bbb-bd77-003f1a39aa01 Serve warm or at room temperature.
b15f0d17-0021-4a29-bdeb-b1f6aad28788 Place rice into a large bowl and cover with several inches of water. The water will become very cloudy right way. Drain this first batch of water immediately.
b15f0d17-0021-4a29-bdeb-b1f6aad28788 Cover the rice with water again. Use your hand to swirl the rice around for a few seconds, and then drain it again. Repeat this process until the water remains clear when you jostle the rice.
b15f0d17-0021-4a29-bdeb-b1f6aad28788 Drain the water once more and cover the rice by several inches with clean water. Let the rice soak for 30 minutes, then drain well in a fine-mesh sieve. Now the rice is ready to cook.
b15f0d17-0021-4a29-bdeb-b1f6aad28788 Place the rice, kombu if using, and water into the Instant Pot or a medium-sized nonreactive pot with a heavy bottom and a tight-fitting lid.
b15f0d17-0021-4a29-bdeb-b1f6aad28788 To cook in the Instant Pot: Position the lid, set the vent to sealing position, and cook on manual, high pressure for 5 minutes. Let the pressure release naturally for 10 minutes before carefully releasing any remaining pressure and opening the lid.
b15f0d17-0021-4a29-bdeb-b1f6aad28788 To cook on the stovetop: Position the lid, then turn heat to high and bring to a boil. When the water boils, lower the heat to low or medium-low (depending on your burner) to maintain a gentle simmer. Simmer until the water is absorbed, about 12 minutes. Then remove pot from the heat, leaving the lid closed, and let the rice steam for an additional 10 minutes.
b15f0d17-0021-4a29-bdeb-b1f6aad28788 While the rice cooks, stir together the vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small pot or microwave-safe bowl. Heat just until salt and sugar have dissolved.
b15f0d17-0021-4a29-bdeb-b1f6aad28788 Remove the kombu. Gently spoon cooked rice into a wide, shallow bowl. Pour vinegar mixture over rice.
b15f0d17-0021-4a29-bdeb-b1f6aad28788 Using a rice paddle or silicone spatula, gently cut and fold the rice to mix in the vinegar and cool the rice. Refer to the notes section below for details and to the video for visual cues.
b15f0d17-0021-4a29-bdeb-b1f6aad28788 Let rice cool to body temperature (or all the way to room temperature, if you prefer) before using for sushi.
d38891f8-3698-43a8-b8ab-34fee5e04b2d Rinse the quinoa very well in a fine mesh sieve under running water.
d38891f8-3698-43a8-b8ab-34fee5e04b2d Place quinoa in a small pot along with water or stock and salt.
d38891f8-3698-43a8-b8ab-34fee5e04b2d Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer for about 15 minutes, until liquid is almost completely absorbed.
d38891f8-3698-43a8-b8ab-34fee5e04b2d Remove from heat and leave covered for 10 minutes more. Stir or fluff with a fork.
d38891f8-3698-43a8-b8ab-34fee5e04b2d Quinoa is ready to eat as-is or use in a recipe.
619b9119-6b33-4152-b87a-17473cb62677 In a 12-inch nonstick pan or shallow Dutch oven, melt the butter and olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring frequently, until beginning to soften, about five minutes. Stir in the rice and cook, still stirring frequently, for one minute. Add the ham and cook one minute more.
619b9119-6b33-4152-b87a-17473cb62677 Add the wine and cook, stirring almost constantly, until nearly absorbed. Lower heat to medium if necessary to prevent any hint of burning. Then begin adding the broth by the cupful (or so), stirring frequently throughout. Continue adding broth as the rice absorbs it. Add a big sprinkle of salt if your broth isn't salty. Stir in the peas with the last addition of broth. Risotto is finished cooking when each grain of rice is tender but still has a nice hint of chewy bite, and there's a little bit of delicious starchy broth remaining. (Keep in mind that the broth will thicken as you add the cheeses and let the risotto rest for a few minutes after cooking.)
619b9119-6b33-4152-b87a-17473cb62677 Off the heat, stir in the cheeses and tarragon and taste for salt and pepper. Let the risotto rest for about five minutes before spooning into wide, shallow bowls to serve.
9a643b92-d3f7-4874-b531-97052ec3383b In a wide pan with a lid (like this one, this one, or this one), melt butter over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until translucent and just starting to brown, about five minutes. While onion cooks, rinse rice in a fine-mesh sieve until the water runs clear and shake out any excess water.
9a643b92-d3f7-4874-b531-97052ec3383b Add garlic to pan and cook, stirring, until very fragrant, about a minute. Add rice and stir to coat with butter, then cook, stirring once or twice, for two minutes. Pour in stock and give it all a good stir. Bring to a boil over high heat. Then cover pan, lower heat to maintain a gentle simmer, and cook until broth is absorbed, 15 to 20 minutes.
9a643b92-d3f7-4874-b531-97052ec3383b Off the heat, place a clean kitchen towel between the pan and the lid to absorb excess steam and let pilaf rest for 5 to 10 minutes. Sprinkle with chives and almonds if using and serve.
85f5f906-db94-4764-aab1-acdbd8a0d828 In a 12-inch nonstick pan or shallow Dutch oven, melt 1 tablespoon butter over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds to a minute, until very fragrant but not browned. Add shrimp to pan in a single layer. Cook for about a minute on one side, until opaque, then flip and heat the other side until just cooked through. Remove from pan, sprinkle with about 1/3 of the lemon juice, and reserve.
85f5f906-db94-4764-aab1-acdbd8a0d828 Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons butter and the olive oil over medium-high in the same pan. Add onion and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. Add rice, stir well to coat with butter and oil, and cook for a minute. Pour in wine and stir to incorporate. Simmer, stirring frequently, until almost evaporated. Then add broth by the cupful, continuing to stir frequently and adding more as it absorbs. Add the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt during this process. Stir in broccoli as you add the last cup of broth. Stop cooking when there’s still a bit of thick broth remaining and the rice is tender but with the tiniest bite in the center of the grain.
85f5f906-db94-4764-aab1-acdbd8a0d828 Remove from heat, stir in remaining lemon juice and grated cheese and taste for seasoning. Arrange shrimp overtop, sprinkle with parsley and a little freshly ground black pepper, and serve with the rest of that bottle of wine.
78ed614f-fc87-4624-be7b-673f2ded5e29 In a large pan with a heavy bottom, melt the butter over medium-high heat.
78ed614f-fc87-4624-be7b-673f2ded5e29 Add the onion along with a good pinch of salt and cook, stirring frequently, until beginning to soften, about five minutes.
78ed614f-fc87-4624-be7b-673f2ded5e29 Stir in the rice and cook, still stirring frequently, for two minutes.
78ed614f-fc87-4624-be7b-673f2ded5e29 Add the wine and cook, stirring almost constantly, until nearly absorbed. Lower heat to medium if necessary to prevent any hint of burning.
78ed614f-fc87-4624-be7b-673f2ded5e29 Begin adding the broth by the cupful (or so), stirring frequently throughout. With the first addition, crumble in the saffron threads. Continue adding broth as the rice absorbs it. Add a big sprinkle of salt if your broth isn't salty.
78ed614f-fc87-4624-be7b-673f2ded5e29 Stir in the peas with the last addition of broth.
78ed614f-fc87-4624-be7b-673f2ded5e29 Risotto is finished cooking when each grain of rice is tender but still has a nice hint of chewy bite, and there's a little bit of delicious starchy broth remaining. (Keep in mind that the broth will thicken as you add the cheeses and let the risotto rest for a few minutes after cooking.)
78ed614f-fc87-4624-be7b-673f2ded5e29 Off the heat, stir in the cheeses.
78ed614f-fc87-4624-be7b-673f2ded5e29 Let the risotto rest for about five minutes. Then drizzle with a little olive oil if you like and serve.
48b793aa-525d-4972-b7dc-4f2e9dc8a57f Place shallot, spinach, oats, broth and soy sauce in a small pot and bring to a boil over high heat.
48b793aa-525d-4972-b7dc-4f2e9dc8a57f Reduce heat to simmer and cook for 5-10 minutes, until oats have softened into a porridge.
48b793aa-525d-4972-b7dc-4f2e9dc8a57f Off the heat, stir in butter and miso paste.
48b793aa-525d-4972-b7dc-4f2e9dc8a57f Transfer to a bowl and top with a drizzle of sriracha and a boiled egg if you like.
8c1b8f77-236a-455c-9bb2-7d25aeb79d6d Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a medium-sized pot.
8c1b8f77-236a-455c-9bb2-7d25aeb79d6d Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until starting to soften, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and the salt and pepper and cook two minutes more.
8c1b8f77-236a-455c-9bb2-7d25aeb79d6d Add the oats and stock to the pot, bring to a boil over high heat, and then simmer, stirring from time to time, until the oats have absorbed just about all the liquid.
8c1b8f77-236a-455c-9bb2-7d25aeb79d6d Stir in the soy sauce and butter.
8c1b8f77-236a-455c-9bb2-7d25aeb79d6d Ladle into bowls and top each bowl with an egg and plenty of crispy shiitakes.
b6af7c8c-10b9-4cd4-af10-1028a928634d Steam the cauliflower until crisp-tender and place in a large bowl.
b6af7c8c-10b9-4cd4-af10-1028a928634d In a small pot, combine lentils, stock, herbes de Provence and a generous pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer until liquid is almost absorbed and lentils are barely tender, about 20 minutes. Let rest, covered, for 10 minutes more.
b6af7c8c-10b9-4cd4-af10-1028a928634d Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until it shimmers. Add the onion along with a generous sprinkle of salt and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and browned in spots. Add garlic and capers and cook until very fragrant. Stir in cooked quinoa and heat through.
b6af7c8c-10b9-4cd4-af10-1028a928634d Tip lentils and onion mixture into the bowl with the cauliflower. Sprinkle with the lemon juice, walnuts and pepper and toss gently to combine. Serve warm, with Pecorino to pass if desired.
57a6a667-2462-4d52-be6d-9e10879ef9fc Trim and discard the root end and green parts of the leeks. Slice the white parts in half lengthwise, then crosswise into thin half-moons. Place in a colander and wash very well — leeks can be very sandy. Drain well.
57a6a667-2462-4d52-be6d-9e10879ef9fc Heat the olive oil in a wide, shallow pan over medium-high heat. Add the leeks, mushrooms, salt and thyme. Cook, stirring occasionally and without browning, for about 10 minutes, until leeks are becoming tender and the liquid released from the mushrooms has begun to reduce. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, one more minute. Stir in the wine and simmer briskly for two minutes.
57a6a667-2462-4d52-be6d-9e10879ef9fc Add the farro, stock, tamari, and bay leaf, give it all a good stir, and raise the heat to high. While the liquid comes to a boil, use your fingers to crumble the chestnuts into the pan. When it boils, reduce the heat to maintain a gentle simmer, cover the pan, and simmer until liquid is absorbed, about 30 minutes. Serve warm. Keeps well for several days, tightly covered in the refrigerator.
0d324561-3524-4fc1-88f9-aa7a4be2497a Rinse the quinoa very well, then place in a medium lidded pot with 1 1/2 cups water.
0d324561-3524-4fc1-88f9-aa7a4be2497a Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to maintain a gentle simmer.
0d324561-3524-4fc1-88f9-aa7a4be2497a Simmer for 15 minutes or until nearly all the water is absorbed.
0d324561-3524-4fc1-88f9-aa7a4be2497a Remove from heat and keep in covered pot to steam for 5 minutes, until all water is absorbed.
0d324561-3524-4fc1-88f9-aa7a4be2497a While the quinoa cooks, chop the vegetables and set aside.
0d324561-3524-4fc1-88f9-aa7a4be2497a In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar, soy sauce, mirin, and sesame oil with a fork.
0d324561-3524-4fc1-88f9-aa7a4be2497a Spoon the quinoa into a serving bowl while still warm and mix together thoroughly with the dressing.
0d324561-3524-4fc1-88f9-aa7a4be2497a After it cools a bit, stir in the chopped vegetables.
0d324561-3524-4fc1-88f9-aa7a4be2497a Serve cold or at room temperature.
166397dd-a7a3-45a5-88af-edb0c477aaf3 Place the rice in a medium pot with two scant cups cold water.
166397dd-a7a3-45a5-88af-edb0c477aaf3 Bring to a boil over high heat, then cover, reduce heat to maintain a gentle simmer, and cook until water is absorbed, about 40 minutes.
166397dd-a7a3-45a5-88af-edb0c477aaf3 Meanwhile, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat in a wide skillet.
166397dd-a7a3-45a5-88af-edb0c477aaf3 Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until it starts to soften, about 5 minutes.
166397dd-a7a3-45a5-88af-edb0c477aaf3 Add the mushrooms and cook, still stirring occasionally, until they have reduced in volume by about half and reabsorbed any water they've given off during cooking, about 5 to 7 minutes.
166397dd-a7a3-45a5-88af-edb0c477aaf3 Add the garlic and cook, stirring, one minute more.
166397dd-a7a3-45a5-88af-edb0c477aaf3 Add the spinach to the pan and cook, stirring, until just wilted.
166397dd-a7a3-45a5-88af-edb0c477aaf3 When the rice and the mushroom mixture are both cooked, scrape the mushroom mixture into the pot with the rice.
166397dd-a7a3-45a5-88af-edb0c477aaf3 Add the soy sauce and chives and stir together gently but thoroughly.
166397dd-a7a3-45a5-88af-edb0c477aaf3 Serve warm or at room temperature.
92e74371-5626-4ff4-a3bf-0ca732c4f0bf Bring two cups of water to a boil in a small pot. Add the rice and 1/4 teaspoon salt, cover, and cook at a gentle simmer for 40 minutes or until water is absorbed. Cool slightly.
92e74371-5626-4ff4-a3bf-0ca732c4f0bf Meanwhile, preheat oven to 375°F with a rack in the middle. On a large rimmed baking sheet, place the diced eggplant, onion, and garlic. Sprinkle with two Tablespoons of the olive oil, the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, and the pepper. Roast for about 30 minutes, until tender.
92e74371-5626-4ff4-a3bf-0ca732c4f0bf Pour the rice, roasted eggplant mixture, olives, feta (if using), basil, and chickpeas (if using) into a large bowl. Sprinkle with the lemon juice and toss gently to combine. Serve warm or at room temperature.
948c6c60-099a-40fa-b350-b7308828eb0b Place the farro in a medium pot with cold water to cover by an inch. Soak for 20 minutes.
948c6c60-099a-40fa-b350-b7308828eb0b After 20 minutes, drain the soaking water and add fresh water to cover the farro by two inches. Add the salt.
948c6c60-099a-40fa-b350-b7308828eb0b Bring the farro to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to maintain a gentle boil. Cook for about 25 minutes, until the farro is tender but still chewy. Drain.
948c6c60-099a-40fa-b350-b7308828eb0b Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat.
948c6c60-099a-40fa-b350-b7308828eb0b Add the onion, mushrooms and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is soft and the mushrooms have reduced substantially in volume, about 7 minutes. Lower the heat if necessary to prevent the onion and garlic from browning.
948c6c60-099a-40fa-b350-b7308828eb0b Add the broccoli florets, soy sauce and water to the pan.
948c6c60-099a-40fa-b350-b7308828eb0b Cover and simmer until the broccoli is quite tender, 5 to 7 minutes more. (Cook the broccoli only as much as you like it cooked. I prefer this dish without any hint of crunch.)
948c6c60-099a-40fa-b350-b7308828eb0b Remove the lid and cook one minute more to reduce any remaining liquid to just a few tablespoons.
948c6c60-099a-40fa-b350-b7308828eb0b Off the heat, add the drained farro and the parmesan cheese to the pan. Stir well and season to taste with pepper. Serve warm.
95a4e943-615d-444d-b5ac-1457c849b9f4 Halve the onions lengthwise and then thinly slice each half crosswise, to form lots of thin half-circles. Melt 1 tablespoon of the butter, along with the olive oil, in a 12-inch nonstick frying pan over medium-low heat.
95a4e943-615d-444d-b5ac-1457c849b9f4 Add the onions and a big pinch of salt, and cook for about 45 minutes to an hour, stirring occasionally with a wooden spoon, until they are dramatically reduced in volume and well on their way to turning a deep golden brown. You may need to reduce the heat to low after a while to prevent them from burning. You can ignore the onions for a while, but watch them carefully at the end, as they will start to change more quickly. When nearly done, pour in Marsala and continue cooking until evaporated. You can do this step up to a couple days in advance if you like and store onions tightly covered in the fridge.
95a4e943-615d-444d-b5ac-1457c849b9f4 Meanwhile, dice bacon and place in another large frying pan . Cook over medium heat until just crispy, then remove bacon from pan and set aside. Pour off most of the bacon grease from the pan, leaving two tablespoons.
95a4e943-615d-444d-b5ac-1457c849b9f4 To the pan with the bacon grease, add the rice and stir to coat with fat. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about two minutes, until some of the rice grains are translucent.
95a4e943-615d-444d-b5ac-1457c849b9f4 Raise heat to medium-high. Add the wine and cook, stirring frequently, until absorbed.
95a4e943-615d-444d-b5ac-1457c849b9f4 Add chicken stock, about a cup at a time, and stir frequently. Wait until most of the liquid has been absorbed and the rest turned into a starchy-looking broth before adding the next ladle-full of stock.
95a4e943-615d-444d-b5ac-1457c849b9f4 After the last addition of stock, continue to stir until the rice is tender, with a little chewy bite, and there is still some thick, glossy broth.
95a4e943-615d-444d-b5ac-1457c849b9f4 Add the spinach along with the reserved bacon and caramelized onions and and stir for less than a minute, until spinach is just wilted.
95a4e943-615d-444d-b5ac-1457c849b9f4 Turn off the heat and stir in the remaining two tablespoons butter and the grated cheese. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Let rest for just a couple of minutes and serve in shallow bowls with extra grated cheese to pass at the table.
f681393f-f6d0-4b8c-8508-b97769dd9a44 Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add rice noodles and cook according to package instructions, usually just a few minutes (ours cook for 3).
f681393f-f6d0-4b8c-8508-b97769dd9a44 While the noodles cook: Into a serving bowl, pour the safflower oil, toasted sesame oil, tamari, and sriracha. Whisk to combine well.
f681393f-f6d0-4b8c-8508-b97769dd9a44 Drain noodles and add to sauce. You can rinse them before adding to the sauce if you like to reduce the starchiness, but I don't bother. Toss with tongs to coat well.
f681393f-f6d0-4b8c-8508-b97769dd9a44 Add scallions and a big squeeze of fresh lime juice and toss. Serve warm or at room temperature with additional lime wedges.
a0be9f3e-d804-4f43-9a85-c5489f40c1b8 Cook the orzo in well salted water according to package directions.
a0be9f3e-d804-4f43-9a85-c5489f40c1b8 Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the onions, garlic, and a big pinch of salt and cook, stirring frequently, until the onion is beginning to soften.
a0be9f3e-d804-4f43-9a85-c5489f40c1b8 Add the shredded zucchini and the thyme and raise heat to high. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the squash releases its juices and they cook off. The zucchini will reduce in size by at least half and may begin to brown slightly.
a0be9f3e-d804-4f43-9a85-c5489f40c1b8 Turn off the heat and immediately add the drained orzo, lemon juice and zest, and cheese, along with salt and pepper to taste. Stir well but gently to combine. Serve warm or at room temperature.
0cb1ebe9-8d0f-4f8f-8193-3e7073f66ea8 Start with a very large, heatproof mixing bowl.
0cb1ebe9-8d0f-4f8f-8193-3e7073f66ea8 Whisk together the eggs and egg yolks, half the grated cheese, and plenty of freshly ground black pepper. Set aside.
0cb1ebe9-8d0f-4f8f-8193-3e7073f66ea8 Fill a very large pot halfway with water. Add plenty of salt, cover, and bring to a boil. (Proceed to step four at this point, and start cooking the bacon while you wait for the water to boil.) When the water boils, cook the spaghetti one minute less than it says on the package.
0cb1ebe9-8d0f-4f8f-8193-3e7073f66ea8 At the same time, add the diced bacon and the smashed garlic cloves to a large pan and then set the pan over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the bacon is nicely browned and a lot of the fat has been rendered. If there is a lot of fat in the pan, remove most of it, leaving three or four tablespoons.
0cb1ebe9-8d0f-4f8f-8193-3e7073f66ea8 With the bacon pan set over low heat, carefully stir in 1/4 cup of the pasta cooking water, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan. When the pasta is ready, use tongs to transfer it from the pot to the pan. It's fine if some of the cooking water clings to the spaghetti as you transfer it. (Leave the rest of the cooking water in the pasta pot.) Stir the spaghetti to coat with the bacon fat/water emulsion and cook for a minute, then turn off the heat.
0cb1ebe9-8d0f-4f8f-8193-3e7073f66ea8 Give the eggs another good whisk, and then slowly whisk in 1/4 cup of the pasta cooking water. This helps to temper the eggs, bringing up their temperature slowly so they won't scramble. When the water is incorporated, tip the entire contents of the pan into the bowl with the egg mixture. Use tongs to stir it all up very well, coating all of the spaghetti strands with the sauce.
0cb1ebe9-8d0f-4f8f-8193-3e7073f66ea8 At this point, you'll need to use your judgment a little bit. If all of the sauce clings to the pasta like a nice, creamy, gently thickened coating, you're all set. You can plate the pasta, sprinkle it with the remaining cheese and some more pepper, and serve. Often this will be the case — the combined heat of all the dish's elements will be enough cook the sauce.
0cb1ebe9-8d0f-4f8f-8193-3e7073f66ea8 If the sauce seems thin and watery rather than silky, set the mixing bowl over the pot of steaming pasta water and toss the pasta constantly with the tongs until the heat from the water thickens the sauce. (If the bowl fits over the pot without touching the water, you can rest it on top — otherwise hold it just above the water with one hand while tossing with the other.) When the sauce is silky and clings to the pasta, you're ready to plate.
f891641a-d413-4e35-972a-97598342a2cb Fill a big pot halfway with water and a teaspoon of salt. Cover and bring to a boil over high heat.
f891641a-d413-4e35-972a-97598342a2cb Melt the butter (or heat the olive oil) in a 12-inch nonstick frying pan over medium heat. Add shallot, garlic, and olives and cook, stirring frequently, for about three minutes. Aim for the shallots to be slightly translucent and garlic slightly soft, without any browning.
f891641a-d413-4e35-972a-97598342a2cb Stir in wine, beans, and cherry tomatoes. Raise heat to medium-high and simmer for two to three minutes, until much of the liquid has evaporated.
f891641a-d413-4e35-972a-97598342a2cb Reduce heat to medium and stir in spinach. Cook two to three minutes more, until wilted.
f891641a-d413-4e35-972a-97598342a2cb Cook tortellini in boiling water according to package instructions.
f891641a-d413-4e35-972a-97598342a2cb Drain tortellini and stir into to skillet along with the pecorino. Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper and some salt if you like (but taste first since there are lots of salty ingredients).
f891641a-d413-4e35-972a-97598342a2cb Serve with additional grated cheese.
13fcdd27-8452-4793-aa1b-f00b9a9a15ca Trim the ends off the zucchini and cut into noodles according to the instructions on your spiralizer. Line two rimmed sheet pans with thick layers of paper towels. Spread half of the zucchini noodles onto each pan and sprinkle with the salt. Cover with another thick layer of paper towels and press gently. Leave noodles to dry while you prepare the rest of the dish.
13fcdd27-8452-4793-aa1b-f00b9a9a15ca Warm olive oil over medium heat in a very large pan or wide, shallow pot. (A 5-quart Dutch oven, a 12-inch frying pan with high sides, or even a wok would all work well.) Add shallot, garlic, and capers, and cook, stirring frequently, for two minutes. Stir in tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, until most of them have burst.
13fcdd27-8452-4793-aa1b-f00b9a9a15ca While tomatoes cook, cut the kernels from the corn cobs. Add corn kernels and chickpeas to pan and cook for about two minutes, until warmed through.
13fcdd27-8452-4793-aa1b-f00b9a9a15ca Pat zucchini noodles dry with the paper towels and stir noodles into the vegetable mixture in the pan. (Tongs work really well if you have them.) Cook until noodles are crisp-tender, just a couple of minutes. The tomatoes and zucchini will create a bit of delicious sauciness in the bottom of the pan. Stir this to coat the noodles. Remove pan from heat and divide noodles and saucy vegetables among wide, shallow serving bowls.
13fcdd27-8452-4793-aa1b-f00b9a9a15ca Cut slices of Bayonne Ham into long, thin strips, about four per slice. Divide strips among serving bowls. The residual heat from the noodles will warm the ham just enough to be beautifully tender and flavorful, without cooking it.
13fcdd27-8452-4793-aa1b-f00b9a9a15ca Garnish each bowl with some basil, freshly ground black pepper, and grated cheese.
eee6c0b2-fbb0-46e5-a88f-1e5511c832ea Place macaroni, broth, shallot, mustard, nutmeg, cayenne, salt, and pepper into Instant Pot and stir.
eee6c0b2-fbb0-46e5-a88f-1e5511c832ea Set vent to sealing position. Cook on manual mode, high pressure, for 4 minutes. (Pot will take about 10 minutes to come up to pressure before timed cooking begins.)
eee6c0b2-fbb0-46e5-a88f-1e5511c832ea Carefully do a manual pressure release by turning the vent to open. (We like to use a towel or a long-handled spoon to do this.)
eee6c0b2-fbb0-46e5-a88f-1e5511c832ea Stir in milk and cheeses until cheese is melted.
eee6c0b2-fbb0-46e5-a88f-1e5511c832ea Stir in sour cream.
eee6c0b2-fbb0-46e5-a88f-1e5511c832ea Serve hot.
cf4bff88-93ac-47e3-add5-c32dc04de52d Fill a large pot halfway with very well salted water and bring to a boil.
cf4bff88-93ac-47e3-add5-c32dc04de52d Whisk together the cream and egg yolk and set aside.
cf4bff88-93ac-47e3-add5-c32dc04de52d In a deep 12-inch frying pan, melt one tablespoon of the butter over medium-high heat. Cut chicken tenders into bite-sized pieces. (Protip: try using kitchen shears to avoid dirtying a cutting board.) Place chicken into pan in a single layer and sprinkle generously with salt and pepper. Cook until lightly browned on the underside and opaque halfway through, about three minutes. Flip once and cook until just cooked through. Remove to a plate and set aside.
cf4bff88-93ac-47e3-add5-c32dc04de52d When water boils, cook fettuccine until al dente according to package directions. Before draining pasta, scoop out 1/2 cup of the cooking water and set aside.
cf4bff88-93ac-47e3-add5-c32dc04de52d Meanwhile, melt remaining tablespoon of butter over medium-low heat in the same pan. Add garlic and cook for one minute, stirring constantly. Pour in cream mixture. Simmer gently, adjusting heat if necessary to prevent boiling, while pasta cooks. When pasta is ready, stir lemon juice and cheese into sauce until smooth and creamy. Whisk in reserved pasta water until smooth. Add spinach and pasta, raise heat to medium, and toss with tongs for a couple of minutes until spinach is wilted and sauce clings nicely to pasta. Stir in chicken along with any accumulated juices. Off the heat, season with freshly ground black pepper (and salt if you like).
cf4bff88-93ac-47e3-add5-c32dc04de52d Divide among four shallow bowls and serve immediately.
b1c715f0-e593-48f6-9b3f-c6fcd68dde6e Fill a medium pot halfway with water, add 2 tablespoons salt, and bring to a boil. Add orzo, give it one big stir, and then cook undisturbed to al dente according to package instructions. Adjust heat as necessary to maintain a boil or very brisk simmer without letting the pot overflow.
b1c715f0-e593-48f6-9b3f-c6fcd68dde6e Drain pasta, place back into pot, and toss with butter and lemon juice until butter is melted. Stir in pecorino and plenty of freshly ground black pepper and serve.
affdfcfb-08fa-416b-b6a4-d45bc38f2792 Cook pasta to al dente in well-salted water according to package directions.
affdfcfb-08fa-416b-b6a4-d45bc38f2792 While the pasta cooks, warm the olive oil over medium heat in a 5-quart round braiser or other deep, wide pan.
affdfcfb-08fa-416b-b6a4-d45bc38f2792 Add tomatoes and salt and cook, stirring occasionally, until tomatoes have softened, just a few minutes. Add ramps and cook until wilted, about two minutes. Add spinach and cook, stirring occasionally, until wilted.
affdfcfb-08fa-416b-b6a4-d45bc38f2792 Turn off heat and add sopressata to the top of the mixture to warm gently.
affdfcfb-08fa-416b-b6a4-d45bc38f2792 Drain the pasta and stir it into the vegetable mixture along with the butter.
affdfcfb-08fa-416b-b6a4-d45bc38f2792 Spoon into bowls and top with grated cheese, black pepper and, if you like, ramp pesto.
ad9a7f3b-b589-4472-a0f8-9ed15d28f9aa Set a heavy 5 1/2-quart pot (this is my favorite) over medium-high heat and add the bacon. Cook, stirring occasionally, until browned. If there is more than about two tablespoons of fat at the bottom of the pot, spoon out the rest and discard or save for another use. Add onion, carrot, and celery and continue cooking, stirring from time to time, until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in garlic and tomato paste and cook two minutes more.
ad9a7f3b-b589-4472-a0f8-9ed15d28f9aa Add ground beef, along with one teaspoon of the salt, stirring to break up the meat into small pieces. Cook for about 5 minutes, until beef isn't pink. Stir in wine and simmer for a few minutes, until liquid is reduced by about half. Stir in tomato sauce, chopped tomatoes, cinnamon, nutmeg, and remaining teaspoon of salt.
ad9a7f3b-b589-4472-a0f8-9ed15d28f9aa Cover pot and reduce heat to maintain a gentle simmer while you cook the spaghetti. Stir in cream and leave pot uncovered for the last few minutes of cooking.
ad9a7f3b-b589-4472-a0f8-9ed15d28f9aa While the sauce simmers, fill a large, heavy pot halfway with well salted water and bring to a boil. Cook spaghetti al dente according to package instructions. Drain, return pasta to pot, and toss with several ladles of sauce. (Psst...I also sometimes throw in a big pat of really good butter while tossing the spaghetti with the sauce.)
ad9a7f3b-b589-4472-a0f8-9ed15d28f9aa To serve, plate spaghetti in wide, shallow bowls and top with additional sauce. Pass grated cheese and a pepper mill at the table, along with some flaky sea salt if you like.
42289ad1-6e15-4776-add8-d886c9d5cddd Melt and lightly brown the butter in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat.
42289ad1-6e15-4776-add8-d886c9d5cddd Add shallots, garlic and sage and cook, stirring frequently, until tender, about five minutes.
42289ad1-6e15-4776-add8-d886c9d5cddd Add wine and simmer briskly until reduced by half.
42289ad1-6e15-4776-add8-d886c9d5cddd Add cream, broth and beets and simmer for 5 to 10 minutes to create a nice, slightly thickened sauce.
42289ad1-6e15-4776-add8-d886c9d5cddd Crumble in Bleu de Chèvre, reserving a little bit to garnish if you like. Taste for salt, and sprinkle in plenty of pepper.
